query: where(source_json.resultType=50053)
description: Account Lockout: Identifies user account which has been locked because the user tried to sign in too many times with an incorrect user ID or password.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("failure") AND Count = NOCASE("<10%"))
description: Increased Failed Authentications Of Any Type: Detects when sign-ins increased by 10% or greater.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND Count = NOCASE("<10%"))
description: Measurable Increase Of Successful Authentications: Detects when successful sign-ins increased by 10% or greater.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND AppId = NOCASE("Insert Application ID use OR for multiple") AND source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("singleFactorAuthentication"))
description: Authentications To Important Apps Using Single Factor Authentication: Detect when authentications to important application(s) only required single-factor authentication

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND NOT Location ICONTAINS "<Countries you DO operate out of e,g GB, use OR for multiple>")
description: Successful Authentications From Countries You Do Not Operate Out Of: Detect successful authentications from countries you do not operate out of.

query: where(user_agent ICONTAINS "azurehound" AND source_json.resultType=0)
description: Discovery Using AzureHound: Detects AzureHound (A BloodHound data collector for Microsoft Azure) activity via the default User-Agent that is used during its operation after successful authentication.

query: where(authentication_target = NOCASE("Device Registration Service") AND source_json.properties.conditionalAccessStatus = NOCASE("success") AND NOT source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("multiFactorAuthentication"))
description: Device Registration or Join Without MFA: Monitor and alert for device registration or join events where MFA was not performed.

query: where(NOT Status = NOCASE("Success") AND NOT Location ICONTAINS "<Countries you DO operate out of e,g GB, use OR for multiple>")
description: Failed Authentications From Countries You Do Not Operate Out Of: Detect failed authentications from countries you do not operate out of.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("singleFactorAuthentication"))
description: Azure AD Only Single Factor Authentication Required: Detect when users are authenticating without MFA being required.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("singleFactorAuthentication") AND RiskState = NOCASE("atRisk") AND (DeviceDetail.trusttype = NOCASE("") OR DeviceDetail.trusttype = null))
description: Suspicious SignIns From A Non Registered Device: Detects risky authentication from a non AD registered device without MFA being required.

query: where(DeviceDetail.isCompliant = NOCASE("false"))
description: Sign-ins from Non-Compliant Devices: Monitor and alert for sign-ins where the device was non-compliant.

query: where(source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("singleFactorAuthentication") AND source_json.resultType=0 AND NetworkLocationDetails = NOCASE("[]") AND DeviceDetail.deviceId = NOCASE(""))
description: Sign-ins by Unknown Devices: Monitor and alert for Sign-ins by unknown devices from non-Trusted locations.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND (user_agent ICONTAINS-ANY ["BAV2ROPC", "CBAinPROD", "CBAinTAR"]))
description: Potential MFA Bypass Using Legacy Client Authentication: Detects successful authentication from potential clients using legacy authentication via user agent strings. This could be a sign of MFA bypass using a password spray attack.

query: where(properties.message = NOCASE("Device Code"))
description:
Application Using Device Code Authentication Flow: Device code flow is an OAuth 2.0 protocol flow specifically for input constrained devices and is not used in all environments.
If this type of flow is seen in the environment and not being used in an input constrained device scenario, further investigation is warranted.
This can be a misconfigured application or potentially something malicious.

query: where(properties.message = NOCASE("ROPC"))
description:
Applications That Are Using ROPC Authentication Flow: Resource owner password credentials (ROPC) should be avoided if at all possible as this requires the user to expose their current password credentials to the application directly.
The application then uses those credentials to authenticate the user against the identity provider.

query: where(source_json.resultType=50057 AND source_json.resultDescription = NOCASE("Failure"))
description: Account Disabled or Blocked for Sign in Attempts: Detects when an account is disabled or blocked for sign in but tried to log in

query: where(source_json.resultType=53003 AND Resultdescription = NOCASE("Blocked by Conditional Access"))
description: Sign-in Failure Due to Conditional Access Requirements Not Met: Define a baseline threshold for failed sign-ins due to Conditional Access failures

query: where(source_json.operationName = NOCASE("Sign-ins") AND (source_json.properties.appDisplayName IIN ["Other client", "IMAP", "POP3", "MAPI", "SMTP", "Exchange ActiveSync", "Exchange Web Services"]) AND account = NOCASE("UPN"))
description: Use of Legacy Authentication Protocols: Alert on when legacy authentication has been used on an account

query: where(source_json.resultType=50057 AND source_json.resultDescription = NOCASE("User account is disabled. The account has been disabled by an administrator."))
description: Login to Disabled Account: Detect failed attempts to sign in to disabled accounts.

query: where(source_json.properties.authenticationRequirement = NOCASE("multiFactorAuthentication") AND Status ICONTAINS "MFA Denied")
description: Multifactor Authentication Denied: User has indicated they haven't instigated the MFA prompt and could indicate an attacker has the password for the account.

query: where(source_json.resultType=50074 AND source_json.resultDescription ICONTAINS "Strong Auth required" OR source_json.resultType=500121 AND source_json.resultDescription ICONTAINS "Authentication failed during strong authentication request")
description: Multifactor Authentication Interrupted: Identifies user login with multifactor authentication failures, which might be an indication an attacker has the password for the account but can't pass the MFA challenge.

query: where(source_json.resultType=50097 AND source_json.resultDescription = NOCASE("Device authentication is required") OR source_json.resultType=50155 AND source_json.resultDescription = NOCASE("DeviceAuthenticationFailed") OR source_json.resultType=50158 AND source_json.resultDescription = NOCASE("ExternalSecurityChallenge - External security challenge was not satisfied"))
description: Azure Unusual Authentication Interruption: Detects when there is a interruption in the authentication process.

query: where(source_json.resultType=53003)
description:
User Access Blocked by Azure Conditional Access: Detect access has been blocked by Conditional Access policies.
The access policy does not allow token issuance which might be sightsâ‰ˆ of unauthorizeed login to valid accounts.

query: where(Status = NOCASE("Success") AND source_json.properties.homeTenantId = NOCASE("HomeTenantID") AND NOT source_json.properties.resourceTenantId ICONTAINS "HomeTenantID")
description: Users Authenticating To Other Azure AD Tenants: Detect when users in your Azure AD tenant are authenticating to other Azure AD Tenants.

query: where((query=/(.*\.burpcollaborator\.net$|.*\.canarytokens\.com$|.*\.ceye\.io$|.*\.ddns\.1443\.eu\.org$|.*\.ddns\.bypass\.eu\.org$|.*\.ddns\.xn\-\-gg8h\.eu\.org$|.*\.digimg\.store$|.*\.dns\.su18\.org$|.*\.dnshook\.site$|.*\.dnslog\.cn$|.*\.dnslog\.ink$|.*\.instances\.httpworkbench\.com$|.*\.interact\.sh$|.*\.log\.dnslog\.pp\.ua$|.*\.log\.dnslog\.qzz\.io$|.*\.log\.dnslogs\.dpdns\.org$|.*\.log\.javaweb\.org$|.*\.log\.nat\.cloudns\.ph$|.*\.oast\.fun$|.*\.oast\.live$|.*\.oast\.me$|.*\.oast\.online$|.*\.oast\.pro$|.*\.oast\.site$|.*\.oastify\.com$|.*\.p8\.lol$|.*\.requestbin\.net$)/i) AND NOT query ICONTAINS "polling.oastify.com")
description: DNS Query to External Service Interaction Domains: Detects suspicious DNS queries to external service interaction domains often used for out-of-band interactions after successful RCE

query: where(query ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["aaa.stage.", "post.1"] OR query ICONTAINS ".stage.123456.")
description: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

query: where(query ICONTAINS-ANY ["pool.minexmr.com", "fr.minexmr.com", "de.minexmr.com", "sg.minexmr.com", "ca.minexmr.com", "us-west.minexmr.com", "pool.supportxmr.com", "mine.c3pool.com", "xmr-eu1.nanopool.org", "xmr-eu2.nanopool.org", "xmr-us-east1.nanopool.org", "xmr-us-west1.nanopool.org", "xmr-asia1.nanopool.org", "xmr-jp1.nanopool.org", "xmr-au1.nanopool.org", "xmr.2miners.com", "xmr.hashcity.org", "xmr.f2pool.com", "xmrpool.eu", "pool.hashvault.pro"])
description: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools

query: where(query ICONTAINS "==.")
description: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

query: where(query = NOCASE("api.telegram.org"))
description: Telegram Bot API Request: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

query: where(query IIN ["ifferfsodp9ifjaposdfjhgosurijfaewrwergwea.testing", "ifferfsodp9ifjaposdfjhgosurijfaewrwergwea.test", "ifferfsodp9ifjaposdfjhgosurijfaewrwergwea.com", "ayylmaotjhsstasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdfasdf.com", "iuqssfsodp9ifjaposdfjhgosurijfaewrwergwea.com"])
description: Wannacry Killswitch Domain: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

query: where(http_method = NOCASE("POST") AND url=/.*\/mgmt\/tm\/util\/bash$/i)
description: F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API Command Execution - Proxy: Detects POST requests to the F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API "bash" endpoint, which allows the execution of commands on the BIG-IP

query: where(url ICONTAINS "momyshark\?key=")
description: HackTool - BabyShark Agent Default URL Pattern: Detects Baby Shark C2 Framework default communication patterns

query: where(url ICONTAINS "/checkupdate.php" AND url_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["lng=", "ver=", "beta=", "type=", "rmode=", "product="])
description: PUA - Advanced IP/Port Scanner Update Check: Detect the update check performed by Advanced IP/Port Scanner utilities.

query: where(url ICONTAINS "/pwndrop/")
description: PwnDrp Access: Detects downloads from PwnDrp web servers developed for red team testing and most likely also used for criminal activity

query: where(url ICONTAINS-ANY [".paste.ee/r/", ".pastebin.com/raw/", ".hastebin.com/raw/", ".ghostbin.co/paste/*/raw/", "pastetext.net/", "pastebin.pl/", "paste.ee/"])
description: Raw Paste Service Access: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

query: where((url ICONTAINS "/flash_install.php" OR url=/.*\/install_flash_player\.exe$/i) AND NOT url_host=/.*\.adobe\.com$/i)
description: Flash Player Update from Suspicious Location: Detects a flashplayer update from an unofficial location

query: where(cs-uri=/(?i)(ipfs\.io\/|ipfs\.io\s).+\..+@.+\.[a-z]+/i)
description: Suspicious Network Communication With IPFS: Detects connections to interplanetary file system (IPFS) containing a user's email address which mirrors behaviours observed in recent phishing campaigns leveraging IPFS to host credential harvesting webpages.

query: where(query ICONTAINS ".anonfiles.com")
description: DNS Query for Anonfiles.com Domain - Sysmon: Detects DNS queries for "anonfiles.com", which is an anonymous file upload platform often used for malicious purposes

query: where(query=/(.*\.v2\.argotunnel\.com$|.*protocol\-v2\.argotunnel\.com$|.*trycloudflare\.com$|.*update\.argotunnel\.com$)/i)
description:
Cloudflared Tunnels Related DNS Requests: Detects DNS requests to Cloudflared tunnels domains.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

query: where(query ICONTAINS-ANY ["msapp.workers.dev", "trycloudflare.com", "infinityfreeapp.com", "my5353.com", "reurl.cc", "lihi.cc", "tinyurl.com"])
description:
DNS Query To Common Malware Hosting and Shortener Services: Detects DNS queries to domains commonly used by threat actors to host malware payloads or redirect through URL shorteners.
These include platforms like Cloudflare Workers, TryCloudflare, InfinityFree, and URL shorteners such as tinyurl and lihi.cc.
Such DNS activity can indicate potential delivery or command-and-control communication attempts.

query: where(query=/.*\.devtunnels\.ms$/i)
description: DNS Query To Devtunnels Domain: Detects DNS query requests to Devtunnels domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

query: where(query ICONTAINS-ALL ["UWhRCA", "BAAAA"])
description:
Suspicious DNS Query Indicating Kerberos Coercion via DNS Object SPN Spoofing: Detects DNS queries containing patterns associated with Kerberos coercion attacks via DNS object spoofing.
The pattern "1UWhRCAAAAA..BAAAA" is a base64-encoded signature that corresponds to a marshaled CREDENTIAL_TARGET_INFORMATION structure.
Attackers can use this technique to coerce authentication from victim systems to attacker-controlled hosts.
It is one of the strong indicators of a Kerberos coercion attack, where adversaries manipulate DNS records
to spoof Service Principal Names (SPNs) and redirect authentication requests like CVE-2025-33073.

query: where(query ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["aaa.stage.", "post.1"] OR query ICONTAINS ".stage.123456.")
description: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing - Sysmon: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

query: where(query ICONTAINS "userstorage.mega.co.nz")
description: DNS Query To MEGA Hosting Website: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to MEGA sharing website

query: where(query=/(.*\.hiddenservice\.net$|.*\.onion\.ca$|.*\.onion\.cab$|.*\.onion\.casa$|.*\.onion\.city$|.*\.onion\.direct$|.*\.onion\.dog$|.*\.onion\.glass$|.*\.onion\.gq$|.*\.onion\.ink$|.*\.onion\.it$|.*\.onion\.link$|.*\.onion\.lt$|.*\.onion\.lu$|.*\.onion\.nu$|.*\.onion\.pet$|.*\.onion\.plus$|.*\.onion\.rip$|.*\.onion\.sh$|.*\.onion\.to$|.*\.onion\.top$|.*\.onion$|.*\.s1\.tor\-gateways\.de$|.*\.s2\.tor\-gateways\.de$|.*\.s3\.tor\-gateways\.de$|.*\.s4\.tor\-gateways\.de$|.*\.s5\.tor\-gateways\.de$|.*\.t2w\.pw$|.*\.tor2web\.ae\.org$|.*\.tor2web\.blutmagie\.de$|.*\.tor2web\.com$|.*\.tor2web\.fi$|.*\.tor2web\.io$|.*\.tor2web\.org$|.*\.tor2web\.xyz$|.*\.torlink\.co$)/i)
description: DNS Query Tor .Onion Address - Sysmon: Detects DNS queries to an ".onion" address related to Tor routing networks

query: where(query ICONTAINS "ufile.io")
description: DNS Query To Ufile.io: Detects DNS queries to "ufile.io", which was seen abused by malware and threat actors as a method for data exfiltration

query: where(query=/.*\.tunnels\.api\.visualstudio\.com$/i)
description: DNS Query To Visual Studio Code Tunnels Domain: Detects DNS query requests to Visual Studio Code tunnel domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

query: where((process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "7-Zip" OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\7z\.exe$|.*\\7zr\.exe$|.*\\7za\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["7z.exe", "7za.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".dmp", ".dump", ".hdmp"]))
description: 7Zip Compressing Dump Files: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

query: where((process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "7-Zip" OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\7z\.exe$|.*\\7zr\.exe$|.*\\7za\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["7z.exe", "7za.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -p" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" a ", " u "]))
description: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With 7-ZIP: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\AccCheckConsole\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AccCheckConsole.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -hwnd", " -process ", " -window "]))
description:
Potential DLL Injection Via AccCheckConsole: Detects the execution "AccCheckConsole" a command-line tool for verifying the accessibility implementation of an application's UI.
One of the tests that this checker can run are called "verification routine", which tests for things like Consistency, Navigation, etc.
The tool allows a user to provide a DLL that can contain a custom "verification routine". An attacker can build such DLLs and pass it via the CLI, which would then be loaded in the context of the "AccCheckConsole" utility.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\addinutil\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\System32\\conhost\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\werfault\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\werfault\.exe$)/i))
description: Uncommon Child Process Of AddinUtil.EXE: Detects uncommon child processes of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via a custom Addins.Store payload.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\addinutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AddInUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-AddInRoot:", "-PipelineRoot:"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['-AddInRoot:"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\VSTA', "-AddInRoot:C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\VSTA", '-PipelineRoot:"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\VSTA', "-PipelineRoot:C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\VSTA"]))
description: Uncommon AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with uncommon Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\addinutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AddInUtil.exe")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm64\\", ":\Windows\WinSxS\\"]))
description: AddinUtil.EXE Execution From Uncommon Directory: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) from a non-standard directory.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\adplus\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Adplus.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -hang ", " -pn ", " -pmn ", " -p ", " -po ", " -c ", " -sc "]))
description: Potential Adplus.EXE Abuse: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.

query: where((process.exe_path = NOCASE("\AgentExecutor.exe") OR process.name = NOCASE("AgentExecutor.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -powershell", " -remediationScript"]) AND NOT parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Microsoft\.Management\.Services\.IntuneWindowsAgent\.exe$/i)
description: AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\AgentExecutor\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AgentExecutor.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -powershell", " -remediationScript"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\\", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\\"] OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Microsoft\.Management\.Services\.IntuneWindowsAgent\.exe$/i))
description: Suspicious AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Software\Microsoft\Windows Script\Settings", "AmsiEnable"] AND ((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Set-ItemProperty", "New-ItemProperty", "sp "]) OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "add"))
description:
Windows AMSI Related Registry Tampering Via CommandLine: Detects tampering of AMSI (Anti-Malware Scan Interface) related registry values via command line tools such as reg.exe or PowerShell.
AMSI provides a generic interface for applications and services to integrate with antimalware products.
Adversaries may disable AMSI to evade detection of malicious scripts and code execution.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\appvlp\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\rundll32\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\rundll32\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Program Files\Microsoft Office" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\msoasb\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Program Files\Microsoft Office", "\SkypeSrv\\"] AND process.exe_path=/.*\\SKYPESERVER\.EXE$/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Program Files\Microsoft Office" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\MSOUC\.EXE$/i))
description:
Uncommon Child Process Of Appvlp.EXE: Detects uncommon child processes of Appvlp.EXE
Appvlp or the Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. Attackers are able to abuse "AppVLP" to execute shell commands.
Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but it can also be abused to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder
or to mark a file as a system file.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\ArcSOC\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line = NOCASE('cmd.exe /c "ver"')))
description:
Suspicious ArcSOC.exe Child Process: Detects script interpreters, command-line tools, and similar suspicious child processes of ArcSOC.exe.
ArcSOC.exe is the process name which hosts ArcGIS Server REST services. If an attacker compromises an ArcGIS
Server system and uploads a malicious Server Object Extension (SOE), they can send crafted requests to the corresponding
service endpoint and remotely execute code from the ArcSOC.exe process.

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm64\\"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\aspnet_compiler\.exe$/i)
description: AspNetCompiler Execution: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" which can be abused to compile and execute C# code.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\aspnet_compiler\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Roaming\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\"]))
description: Suspicious Child Process of AspNetCompiler: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "aspnet_compiler.exe".

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm\\", ":\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm64\\"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\aspnet_compiler\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Roaming\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious ASP.NET Compilation Via AspNetCompiler: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" with potentially suspicious paths for compilation.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\at\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "interactive")
description: Interactive AT Job: Detects an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\AtBroker\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AtBroker.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "start" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["animations", "audiodescription", "caretbrowsing", "caretwidth", "colorfiltering", "cursorindicator", "cursorscheme", "filterkeys", "focusborderheight", "focusborderwidth", "highcontrast", "keyboardcues", "keyboardpref", "livecaptions", "magnifierpane", "messageduration", "minimumhitradius", "mousekeys", "Narrator", "osk", "overlappedcontent", "showsounds", "soundsentry", "speechreco", "stickykeys", "togglekeys", "voiceaccess", "windowarranging", "windowtracking", "windowtrackingtimeout", "windowtrackingzorder"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Oracle_JavaAccessBridge")
description: Uncommon  Assistive Technology Applications Execution Via AtBroker.EXE: Detects the start of a non built-in assistive technology applications via "Atbroker.EXE".

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\attrib\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ATTRIB.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " +h " AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\desktop.ini " AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line = NOCASE("+R +H +S +A \\*.cui") AND parent_process.cmd_line = NOCASE("C:\WINDOWS\system32\\*.bat")))
description: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\attrib\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ATTRIB.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " +s" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" %", "\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Local\\", "\ProgramData\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".bat", ".dll", ".exe", ".hta", ".ps1", ".vbe", ".vbs"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Windows\TEMP\\", ".exe"]))
description: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/logon:none", "/system:none", "/sam:none", "/privilege:none", "/object:none", "/process:none", "/policy:none"])
description:
Audit Policy Tampering Via NT Resource Kit Auditpol: Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\auditpol\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AUDITPOL.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["disable", "clear", "remove", "restore"]))
description:
Audit Policy Tampering Via Auditpol: Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\wmic\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wmic.exe") OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\wmiprvse\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg", " add "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs", """:\ProgramData'""", ":\Windows\Temp", ":\Temp", "\AppData\Local\Temp", "\AppData\Roaming", ":\$Recycle.bin", ":\Users\Default", ":\Users\public", "%temp%", "%tmp%", "%Public%", "%AppData%"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":\Users\\" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Favorites", "\Favourites", "\Contacts", "\Music", "\Pictures", "\Documents", "\Photos"])))
description: Suspicious Autorun Registry Modified via WMI: Detects suspicious activity where the WMIC process is used to create an autorun registry entry via reg.exe, which is often indicative of persistence mechanisms employed by malware.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\baaupdate\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description:
Suspicious BitLocker Access Agent Update Utility Execution: Detects the execution of the BitLocker Access Agent Update Utility (baaupdate.exe) which is not a common parent process for other processes.
Suspicious child processes spawned by baaupdate.exe could indicate an attempt at lateral movement via BitLocker DCOM & COM Hijacking.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\System32\\bash\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\bash\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Bash.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c ")
description:
Indirect Inline Command Execution Via Bash.EXE: Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher with the "-c" flag.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\System32\\bash\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\bash\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Bash.exe")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["bash.exe -", "bash -"] OR process.cmd_line = null OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("") OR process.cmd_line IIN ["bash.exe", "bash"]))
description:
Indirect Command Execution From Script File Via Bash.EXE: Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher without any flags to execute the content of a bash script directly.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bcdedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bcdedit.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "set" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["bootstatuspolicy", "ignoreallfailures"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["recoveryenabled", "no"]))
description: Boot Configuration Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bcdedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bcdedit.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["delete", "deletevalue", "import", "safeboot", "network"]))
description: Potential Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE: Detects potential malicious and unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bcp\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("BCP.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" out ", " queryout "]))
description:
Data Export From MSSQL Table Via BCP.EXE: Detects the execution of the BCP utility in order to export data from the database.
Attackers were seen saving their malware to a database column or table and then later extracting it via "bcp.exe" into a file.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\bginfo\.exe$|.*\\bginfo64\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", ":\PerfLogs\\"]))
description: Suspicious Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE: Detects suspicious child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\bginfo\.exe$|.*\\bginfo64\.exe$)/i)
description: Uncommon Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE: Detects uncommon child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\BitLockerToGo\.exe$/i)
description:
BitLockerTogo.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of "BitLockerToGo.EXE".
BitLocker To Go is BitLocker Drive Encryption on removable data drives. This feature includes the encryption of, USB flash drives, SD cards, External hard disk drives, Other drives that are formatted by using the NTFS, FAT16, FAT32, or exFAT file system.
This is a rarely used application and usage of it at all is worth investigating.
Malware such as Lumma stealer has been seen using this process as a target for process hollowing.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /transfer " OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" \/create ", " \/addfile "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http"))
description: File Download Via Bitsadmin: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /transfer ", " \/create ", " \/addfile "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\/\/1", ":\/\/2", ":\/\/3", ":\/\/4", ":\/\/5", ":\/\/6", ":\/\/7", ":\/\/8", ":\/\/9"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":\/\/7-")
description: Suspicious Download From Direct IP Via Bitsadmin: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file using an URL that contains an IP

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /transfer ", " \/create ", " \/addfile "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".githubusercontent.com", "anonfiles.com", "cdn.discordapp.com", "ddns.net", "dl.dropboxusercontent.com", "ghostbin.co", "github.com", "glitch.me", "gofile.io", "hastebin.com", "mediafire.com", "mega.nz", "onrender.com", "pages.dev", "paste.ee", "pastebin.com", "pastebin.pl", "pastetext.net", "privatlab.com", "privatlab.net", "send.exploit.in", "sendspace.com", "storage.googleapis.com", "storjshare.io", "supabase.co", "temp.sh", "transfer.sh", "trycloudflare.com", "ufile.io", "w3spaces.com", "workers.dev"]))
description: Suspicious Download From File-Sharing Website Via Bitsadmin: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file from a suspicious domain

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /transfer ", " \/create ", " \/addfile "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".7z", ".asax", ".ashx", ".asmx", ".asp", ".aspx", ".bat", ".cfm", ".cgi", ".chm", ".cmd", ".dll", ".gif", ".jpeg", ".jpg", ".jsp", ".jspx", ".log", ".png", ".ps1", ".psm1", ".rar", ".scf", ".sct", ".txt", ".vbe", ".vbs", ".war", ".wsf", ".wsh", ".xll", ".zip"]))
description: File With Suspicious Extension Downloaded Via Bitsadmin: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file with a suspicious extension

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /transfer ", " \/create ", " \/addfile "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs", ":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\\", "\$Recycle.Bin\\", "\AppData\Local\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\Contacts\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Favorites\\", "\Favourites\\", "\inetpub\wwwroot\\", "\Music\\", "\Pictures\\", "\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\\", "\Users\Default\\", "\Videos\\", "%ProgramData%", "%public%", "%temp%", "%tmp%"]))
description: File Download Via Bitsadmin To A Suspicious Target Folder: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to a suspicious target folder

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("bitsadmin.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/SetNotifyCmdLine" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["%COMSPEC%", "cmd.exe", "regsvr32.exe"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Addfile" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http:", "https:", "ftp:", "ftps:"])))
description:
Monitoring For Persistence Via BITS: BITS will allow you to schedule a command to execute after a successful download to notify you that the job is finished.
When the job runs on the system the command specified in the BITS job will be executed.
This can be abused by actors to create a backdoor within the system and for persistence.
It will be chained in a BITS job to schedule the download of malware/additional binaries and execute the program after being downloaded.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--remote-debugging-", "--user-data-dir", "--headless"])
description: Potential Data Stealing Via Chromium Headless Debugging: Detects chromium based browsers starting in headless and debugging mode and pointing to a user profile. This could be a sign of data stealing or remote control

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--headless")
description: Browser Execution In Headless Mode: Detects execution of Chromium based browser in headless mode

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--headless", "dump-dom", "http"] AND NOT ((process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\Edge\Application\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\EdgeCore\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft\EdgeWebView\\", "C:\Program Files\Microsoft\Edge\Application\\", "C:\Program Files\Microsoft\EdgeCore\\", "C:\Program Files\Microsoft\EdgeWebView\\", "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.MicrosoftEdge"]) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\msedgewebview2\.exe$|.*\\MicrosoftEdge\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--headless --disable-gpu --disable-extensions --disable-plugins --mute-audio --no-first-run --incognito --aggressive-cache-discard --dump-dom" OR (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WindowsApps\\", "\Windows\SystemApps\Microsoft.MicrosoftEdge"]) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\MicrosoftEdge\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--headless --disable-gpu --disable-extensions --disable-plugins --mute-audio --no-first-run --incognito --aggressive-cache-discard --dump-dom"))
description: File Download with Headless Browser: Detects execution of chromium based browser in headless mode using the "dump-dom" command line to download files

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--load-extension=")
description: Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension: Detects a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with a custom extension

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--headless" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["://run.mocky", "://mockbin"]))
description: Chromium Browser Headless Execution To Mockbin Like Site: Detects the execution of a Chromium based browser process with the "headless" flag and a URL pointing to the mockbin.org service (which can be used to exfiltrate data).

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--load-extension=")
description: Suspicious Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension: Detects a suspicious process spawning a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start an instance with a custom extension

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http" AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.7z$|.*\.dat$|.*\.dll$|.*\.exe$|.*\.hta$|.*\.ps1$|.*\.psm1$|.*\.txt$|.*\.vbe$|.*\.vbs$|.*\.zip$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['.7z"', '.dat"', '.dll"', '.hta"', '.ps1"', '.psm1"', '.txt"', '.vbe"', '.vbs"', '.zip"']))
description: File Download From Browser Process Via Inline URL: Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " --remote-debugging-" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\firefox\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -start-debugger-server")
description: Browser Started with Remote Debugging: Detects browsers starting with the remote debugging flags. Which is a technique often used to perform browser injection attacks

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Tor Browser") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Tor Browser") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\tor\.exe$|.*\\Tor\ Browser\\Browser\\firefox\.exe$)/i)
description: Tor Client/Browser Execution: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\calc.exe " OR process.exe_path=/.*\\calc\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\System32\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\\", ":\Windows\WinSxS\\"]))
description: Suspicious Calculator Usage: Detects suspicious use of 'calc.exe' with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cdb\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CDB.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -c ", " -cf "]))
description: Potential Binary Proxy Execution Via Cdb.EXE: Detects usage of "cdb.exe" to launch arbitrary processes or commands from a debugger script file

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\CertMgr\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CERTMGT.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/add", "root"])
description:
New Root Certificate Installed Via CertMgr.EXE: Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certoc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertOC.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-GetCACAPS", "http"])
description: File Download via CertOC.EXE: Detects when a user downloads a file by using CertOC.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certoc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertOC.exe")) AND process.cmd_line=/:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-GetCACAPS")
description: File Download From IP Based URL Via CertOC.EXE: Detects when a user downloads a file from an IP based URL using CertOC.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certoc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertOC.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•LoadDLL "))
description: DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certoc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertOC.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”LoadDLL " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•LoadDLL ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Appdata\Local\Temp\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Users\Public\\", "C:\Windows\Tasks\\", "C:\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Suspicious DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to load the target DLL file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certreq\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertReq.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-Post" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Post" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“Post" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”Post" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•Post") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-config" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/config" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“config" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”config" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•config") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http")
description:
Suspicious CertReq Command to Download: Detects a suspicious CertReq execution downloading a file.
This behavior is often used by attackers to download additional payloads or configuration files.
Certreq is a built-in Windows utility used to request and retrieve certificates from a certification authority (CA). However, it can be abused by threat actors for malicious purposes.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-addstore" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/addstore" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“addstore" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”addstore" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•addstore") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "root")
description:
New Root Certificate Installed Via Certutil.EXE: Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-decode " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/decode " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“decode " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”decode " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•decode " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-decodehex " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/decodehex " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“decodehex " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”decodehex " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•decodehex "))
description: File Decoded From Base64/Hex Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with either the "decode" or "decodehex" flags to decode base64 or hex encoded files. This can be abused by attackers to decode an encoded payload before execution

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["urlcache ", "verifyctl ", "URL "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http")
description: Suspicious Download Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["urlcache ", "verifyctl ", "URL "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["://1", "://2", "://3", "://4", "://5", "://6", "://7", "://8", "://9"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "://7-")
description: Suspicious File Downloaded From Direct IP Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from direct IPs.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["urlcache ", "verifyctl ", "URL "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".githubusercontent.com", "anonfiles.com", "cdn.discordapp.com", "ddns.net", "dl.dropboxusercontent.com", "ghostbin.co", "github.com", "glitch.me", "gofile.io", "hastebin.com", "mediafire.com", "mega.nz", "onrender.com", "pages.dev", "paste.ee", "pastebin.com", "pastebin.pl", "pastetext.net", "privatlab.com", "privatlab.net", "send.exploit.in", "sendspace.com", "storage.googleapis.com", "storjshare.io", "supabase.co", "temp.sh", "transfer.sh", "trycloudflare.com", "ufile.io", "w3spaces.com", "workers.dev"]))
description: Suspicious File Downloaded From File-Sharing Website Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from file-sharing websites.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•encode"))
description: File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64. This can be abused by threat actors and attackers for data exfiltration

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•encode") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".acl", ".bat", ".doc", ".gif", ".jpeg", ".jpg", ".mp3", ".pdf", ".png", ".ppt", ".tmp", ".xls", ".xml"]))
description: Suspicious File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the extensions of the file is suspicious

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”encode" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•encode") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Roaming\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Local\Temp\\", "\PerfLogs\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\", "$Recycle.Bin"]))
description: File In Suspicious Location Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the files are located in potentially suspicious locations

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-exportPFX " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/exportPFX " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“exportPFX " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”exportPFX " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•exportPFX "))
description: Certificate Exported Via Certutil.EXE: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\certutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CertUtil.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -syncwithWU ", " \\"])
description: Potential NTLM Coercion Via Certutil.EXE: Detects possible NTLM coercion via certutil using the 'syncwithWU' flag

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /c " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -r " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/r " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“r " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”r " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•r " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -k " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/k " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“k " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”k " OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•k ") AND process.exe_path=/.*\\chcp\.com$/i AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*chcp$|.*chcp\ $|.*chcp\ \ $)/i))
description: Console CodePage Lookup Via CHCP: Detects use of chcp to look up the system locale value as part of host discovery

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\chcp\.com$/i AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\ 936$|.*\ 1258$)/i))
description: Suspicious CodePage Switch Via CHCP: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("CIPHER.EXE") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cipher\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /w:")
description:
Deleted Data Overwritten Via Cipher.EXE: Detects usage of the "cipher" built-in utility in order to overwrite deleted data from disk.
Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources.
Data destruction is likely to render stored data irrecoverable by forensic techniques through overwriting files or data on local and remote drives

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\TrolleyExpress 7", "\TrolleyExpress 8", "\TrolleyExpress 9", "\TrolleyExpress.exe 7", "\TrolleyExpress.exe 8", "\TrolleyExpress.exe 9", "\TrolleyExpress.exe -ma "] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\TrolleyExpress\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.name ICONTAINS "CtxInstall" OR process.name = null))
description: Process Access via TrolleyExpress Exclusion: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\clip\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("clip.exe"))
description: Data Copied To Clipboard Via Clip.EXE: Detects the execution of clip.exe in order to copy data to the clipboard. Adversaries may collect data stored in the clipboard from users copying information within or between applications.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\cloudflared\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Program Files (x86)\cloudflared\\", ":\Program Files\cloudflared\\"]))
description: Cloudflared Portable Execution: Detects the execution of the "cloudflared" binary from a non standard location.

description:
Cloudflared Quick Tunnel Execution: Detects creation of an ad-hoc Cloudflare Quick Tunnel, which can be used to tunnel local services such as HTTP, RDP, SSH and SMB.
The free TryCloudflare Quick Tunnel will generate a random subdomain on trycloudflare[.]com, following a call to api[.]trycloudflare[.]com.
The tool has been observed in use by threat groups including Akira ransomware.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" tunnel ", "cleanup "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-config ", "-connector-id "]))
description: Cloudflared Tunnel Connections Cleanup: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool with the tunnel "cleanup" flag in order to cleanup tunnel connections.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" tunnel ", " run "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-config ", "-credentials-contents ", "-credentials-file ", "-token "]))
description: Cloudflared Tunnel Execution: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool to connect back to a tunnel. This was seen used by threat actors to maintain persistence and remote access to compromised networks.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "assoc")
description:
Change Default File Association Via Assoc: Detects file association changes using the builtin "assoc" command.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["assoc ", "exefile"] AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".exe=exefile")
description:
Change Default File Association To Executable Via Assoc: Detects when a program changes the default file association of any extension to an executable.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["copy ", " \\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".dmp", ".dump", ".hdmp"]))
description: Copy .DMP/.DUMP Files From Remote Share Via Cmd.EXE: Detects usage of the copy builtin cmd command to copy files with the ".dmp"/".dump" extension from a remote share

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["curl ", "http", "-o", "&"])
description: Curl Download And Execute Combination: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["del ", "erase "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -f" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /f" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“f" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”f" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•f" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•q"))
description:
File Deletion Via Del: Detects execution of the builtin "del"/"erase" commands in order to delete files.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["del ", "erase "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\\*.au3", "\\*.dll", "\\*.exe", "\\*.js"]))
description: Greedy File Deletion Using Del: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir*-s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir*/s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir*â€“s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir*â€”s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir*â€•s"))
description: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Windows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["^^", "^|^", ",;,", ";;;;", ";; ;;", "(,(,", "%COMSPEC:~", " c^m^d", "^c^m^d", " c^md", " cm^d", "^cm^d", " s^et ", " s^e^t ", " se^t "])
description: Potential Dosfuscation Activity: Detects possible payload obfuscation via the commandline

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http", "://", "%AppData%"])
description: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "start " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "start/b" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "start/min") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-b " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/b " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“b " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”b " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•b " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '-b"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '/b"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€“b"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€”b"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€•b"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-min " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/min " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“min " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”min " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•min " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '-min"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '/min"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€“min"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€”min"' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'â€•min"') AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Default\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\Contacts\\", "\Documents\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Favorites\\", "\Favourites\\", "\inetpub\\", "\Music\\", "\Photos\\", "\Temporary Internet\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Videos\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".bat", ".cmd", ".cpl", ".hta", ".js", ".ps1", ".scr", ".vbe", ".vbs"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -nop ", " -sta ", ".downloadfile(", ".downloadstring(", "-noni ", "-w hidden "]))
description:
Cmd Launched with Hidden Start Flags to Suspicious Targets: Detects cmd.exe executing commands with the "start" utility using "/b" (no window) or "/min" (minimized) flags.
To reduce false positives from standard background tasks, detection is restricted to scenarios where the target is a known script extension or located in suspicious temporary/public directories.
This technique was observed in Chaos, DarkSide, and Emotet malware campaigns.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["mklink", "\osk.exe", "\cmd.exe"])
description: Potential Privilege Escalation Using Symlink Between Osk and Cmd: Detects the creation of a symbolic link between "cmd.exe" and the accessibility on-screen keyboard binary (osk.exe) using "mklink". This technique provides an elevated command prompt to the user from the login screen without the need to log in.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["mklink", "HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy"])
description: VolumeShadowCopy Symlink Creation Via Mklink: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\cmd.exe" OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" net use http", "& start /b ", "\DavWWWRoot\\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe ", ".dll ", ".bat ", ".vbs ", ".ps1 "]))
description: Suspicious File Execution From Internet Hosted WebDav Share: Detects the execution of the "net use" command to mount a WebDAV server and then immediately execute some content in it. As seen being used in malicious LNK files

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd.exe/c", "\cmd/c", '"cmd/c', "cmd.exe/k", "\cmd/k", '"cmd/k', "cmd.exe/r", "\cmd/r", '"cmd/r'] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/cwhoami", "/cpowershell", "/cschtasks", "/cbitsadmin", "/ccertutil", "/kwhoami", "/kpowershell", "/kschtasks", "/kbitsadmin", "/kcertutil"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd.exe /c", "cmd \/c", "cmd.exe \/k", "cmd \/k", "cmd.exe \/r", "cmd \/r"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd.exe \/c ", "cmd \/c ", "cmd.exe \/k ", "cmd \/k ", "cmd.exe \/r ", "cmd \/r "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["AppData\Local\Programs\Microsoft VS Code\resources\app\node_modules", "cmd.exe\/c .", "cmd.exe \/c"]))
description:
Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly: Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe.
This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).

query:
where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["type %windir%\system32
tdll.dll", "type %systemroot%\system32
tdll.dll", "type c:\windows\system32
tdll.dll", "
tdll.dll > \.\pipe\"])
description: NtdllPipe Like Activity Execution: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection. As seen being used in the POC NtdllPipe

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("cmd.exe")) AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/c", "/k", "/r"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/c", "/k", "/r"]) AND (parent_process.cmd_line = NOCASE("/../../") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/../../") AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\Tasktop\keycloak\bin\/../../jre\bin\java")
description: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ping", "copy "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•n ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•y "))
description: Potentially Suspicious Ping/Copy Command Combination: Detects uncommon and potentially suspicious one-liner command containing both "ping" and "copy" at the same time, which is usually used by malware.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•n ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Nul" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -q " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/q " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“q " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”q " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•q ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ping", "del "])
description: Suspicious Ping/Del Command Combination: Detects a method often used by ransomware. Which combines the "ping" to wait a couple of seconds and then "del" to delete the file in question. Its used to hide the file responsible for the initial infection for example

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [">?%APPDATA%\\", ">?%TEMP%\\", ">?%TMP%\\", ">?%USERPROFILE%\\", ">?C:\ProgramData\\", ">?C:\Temp\\", ">?C:\Users\Public\\", ">?C:\Windows\Temp\\"] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" >", '">', """'>"""]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["C:\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\\"]))
description:
Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect: Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location.
This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rmdir" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/s", "/q"]))
description:
Directory Removal Via Rmdir: Detects execution of the builtin "rmdir" command in order to delete directories.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["copy ", "\\\?\GLOBALROOT\Device\HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy"])
description: Copy From VolumeShadowCopy Via Cmd.EXE: Detects the execution of the builtin "copy" command that targets a shadow copy (sometimes used to copy registry hives that are in use)

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "<")
description: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\winlogon\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\wt\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["sethc.exe", "utilman.exe", "osk.exe", "Magnify.exe", "Narrator.exe", "DisplaySwitch.exe"]))
description: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Execution: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["copy ", "/y ", "C:\windows\system32\cmd.exe C:\windows\system32\sethc.exe"])
description:
Persistence Via Sticky Key Backdoor: By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system.
When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["type ", " > \\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["type \\", " > "])
description: Potential Download/Upload Activity Using Type Command: Detects usage of the "type" command to download/upload data from WebDAV server

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\csrss\.exe$|.*\\ctfmon\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$|.*\\epad\.exe$|.*\\FlashPlayerUpdateService\.exe$|.*\\GoogleUpdate\.exe$|.*\\jucheck\.exe$|.*\\jusched\.exe$|.*\\LogonUI\.exe$|.*\\lsass\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\SearchIndexer\.exe$|.*\\SearchProtocolHost\.exe$|.*\\SIHClient\.exe$|.*\\sihost\.exe$|.*\\slui\.exe$|.*\\spoolsv\.exe$|.*\\sppsvc\.exe$|.*\\taskhostw\.exe$|.*\\unsecapp\.exe$|.*\\WerFault\.exe$|.*\\wermgr\.exe$|.*\\wlanext\.exe$|.*\\WUDFHost\.exe$)/i))
description: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmdkey\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("cmdkey.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•g") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•u") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -p" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/p" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“p" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”p" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•p"))
description:
New Generic Credentials Added Via Cmdkey.EXE: Detects usage of "cmdkey.exe" to add generic credentials.
As an example, this can be used before connecting to an RDP session via command line interface.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmdkey\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("cmdkey.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -l" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /l" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“l" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”l" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•l"))
description: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmdl32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CMDL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/vpn", "/lan"])
description:
Potential Arbitrary File Download Via Cmdl32.EXE: Detects execution of Cmdl32 with the "/vpn" and "/lan" flags.
Attackers can abuse this utility in order to download arbitrary files via a configuration file.
Inspect the location and the content of the file passed as an argument in order to determine if it is suspicious.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmstp\.exe$/i)
description: CMSTP Execution Process Creation: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ConfigSecurityPolicy.exe" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\ConfigSecurityPolicy\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ConfigSecurityPolicy.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp://", "http://", "https://"]))
description:
Arbitrary File Download Via ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE: Detects the execution of "ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE", a binary part of Windows Defender used to manage settings in Windows Defender.
Users can configure different pilot collections for each of the co-management workloads.
It can be abused by attackers in order to upload or download files.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\conhost\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("CONHOST.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--headless", "powershell"])
description:
Powershell Executed From Headless ConHost Process: Detects the use of powershell commands from headless ConHost window.
The "--headless" flag hides the windows from the user upon execution.

query: where(parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "conhost" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/../../")
description: Conhost.exe CommandLine Path Traversal: detects the usage of path traversal in conhost.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\conhost\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*:\\Windows\\System32\\conhost\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path = null OR process.exe_path = NOCASE("")) AND NOT Provider_Name = NOCASE("SystemTraceProvider-Process"))
description: Uncommon Child Process Of Conhost.EXE: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\conhost\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["cmd.exe", "cscript.exe", "mshta.exe", "powershell_ise.exe", "powershell.exe", "pwsh.dll", "regsvr32.exe", "wscript.exe"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Child Processes Spawned by ConHost: Detects suspicious child processes related to Windows Shell utilities spawned by `conhost.exe`, which could indicate malicious activity using trusted system components.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\conhost\.exe$/i AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\lsass\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\services\.exe$|.*\\smss\.exe$|.*\\spoolsv\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\userinit\.exe$|.*\\wininit\.exe$|.*\\winlogon\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-k apphost -s AppHostSvc", "-k imgsvc", "-k localService -p -s RemoteRegistry", "-k LocalSystemNetworkRestricted -p -s NgcSvc", "-k NetSvcs -p -s NcaSvc", "-k netsvcs -p -s NetSetupSvc", "-k netsvcs -p -s wlidsvc", "-k NetworkService -p -s DoSvc", "-k wsappx -p -s AppXSvc", "-k wsappx -p -s ClipSVC", "-k wusvcs -p -s WaaSMedicSvc"]) AND NOT (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\Dropbox\Client\\", "C:\Program Files\Dropbox\Client\\"]))
description: Conhost Spawned By Uncommon Parent Process: Detects when the Console Window Host (conhost.exe) process is spawned by an uncommon parent process, which could be indicative of potential code injection activity.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["add", "CurrentVersion\Control Panel\CPLs"] OR process.cmd_line=/.*\.cpl$/i AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\System32\\", "%System%", "|C:\Windows\system32|"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["regsvr32 ", " /s ", "igfxCPL.cpl"]))
description: Control Panel Items: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\createdump\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("FX_VER_INTERNALNAME_STR")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -u ", " --full ", " -f ", " --name ", ".dmp "]))
description: CreateDump Process Dump: Detects uses of the createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "reg.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["add ", "New-ItemProperty ", "Set-ItemProperty ", "si ", "delete ", "del ", "Remove-ItemProperty ", "rp "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Control\DeviceGuard", "\Control\LSA", "Software\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\DeviceGuard"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["EnableVirtualizationBasedSecurity", "RequirePlatformSecurityFeatures", "LsaCfgFlags"]))
description:
Windows Credential Guard Registry Tampering Via CommandLine: Detects attempts to add, modify, or delete Windows Credential Guard related registry keys or values via command line tools such as Reg.exe or PowerShell.
Credential Guard uses virtualization-based security to isolate secrets so that only privileged system software can access them.
Adversaries may disable Credential Guard to gain access to sensitive credentials stored in the system, such as NTLM hashes and Kerberos tickets, which can be used for lateral movement and privilege escalation.
The rule matches suspicious command lines that target DeviceGuard or LSA registry paths and manipulate keys like EnableVirtualizationBasedSecurity, RequirePlatformSecurityFeatures, or LsaCfgFlags.
Such activity may indicate an attempt to disable or tamper with Credential Guard, potentially exposing sensitive credentials for misuse.
