query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\csc\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Temporary Internet", "\Windows\Temp\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favorites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favourites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Contacts\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Pictures\\"] OR process.cmd_line=/([Pp]rogram[Dd]ata|%([Ll]ocal)?[Aa]pp[Dd]ata%|\\[Aa]pp[Dd]ata\\([Ll]ocal([Ll]ow)?|[Rr]oaming))\\[^\\]{1,256}$/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\\", "C:\Program Files\\"] OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\sdiagnhost.exe") OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\inetsrv\w3wp.exe")) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\choco.exe", "C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\tools\shimgen.exe"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection" OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["JwB7ACIAZgBhAGkAbABlAGQAIgA6AHQAcgB1AGUALAAiAG0AcwBnACIAOgAiAEEAbgBzAGkAYgBsAGUAIAByAGUAcQB1AGkAcgBlAHMAIABQAG8AdwBlAHIAUwBoAGUAbABsACAAdgAzAC4AMAAgAG8AcgAgAG4AZQB3AGUAcgAiAH0AJw", "cAewAiAGYAYQBpAGwAZQBkACIAOgB0AHIAdQBlACwAIgBtAHMAZwAiADoAIgBBAG4AcwBpAGIAbABlACAAcgBlAHEAdQBpAHIAZQBzACAAUABvAHcAZQByAFMAaABlAGwAbAAgAHYAMwAuADAAIABvAHIAIABuAGUAdwBlAHIAIgB9ACcA", "nAHsAIgBmAGEAaQBsAGUAZAAiADoAdAByAHUAZQAsACIAbQBzAGcAIgA6ACIAQQBuAHMAaQBiAGwAZQAgAHIAZQBxAHUAaQByAGUAcwAgAFAAbwB3AGUAcgBTAGgAZQBsAGwAIAB2ADMALgAwACAAbwByACAAbgBlAHcAZQByACIAfQAnA"]))
description: Dynamic .NET Compilation Via Csc.EXE: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\csc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("csc.exe")) AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\excel\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\onenote\.exe$|.*\\outlook\.exe$|.*\\powerpnt\.exe$|.*\\winword\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-Encoded ", "FromBase64String"]) OR parent_process.cmd_line=/([Pp]rogram[Dd]ata|%([Ll]ocal)?[Aa]pp[Dd]ata%|\\[Aa]pp[Dd]ata\\([Ll]ocal([Ll]ow)?|[Rr]oaming))\\[^\\]{1,256}$/i OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\Temporary Internet"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favorites\\"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favourites\\"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Contacts\\"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Pictures\\"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\\", "C:\Program Files\\"] OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\sdiagnhost.exe") OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\inetsrv\w3wp.exe")) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\ProgramData\chocolatey\choco.exe") OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows Defender Advanced Threat Protection" OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["JwB7ACIAZgBhAGkAbABlAGQAIgA6AHQAcgB1AGUALAAiAG0AcwBnACIAOgAiAEEAbgBzAGkAYgBsAGUAIAByAGUAcQB1AGkAcgBlAHMAIABQAG8AdwBlAHIAUwBoAGUAbABsACAAdgAzAC4AMAAgAG8AcgAgAG4AZQB3AGUAcgAiAH0AJw", "cAewAiAGYAYQBpAGwAZQBkACIAOgB0AHIAdQBlACwAIgBtAHMAZwAiADoAIgBBAG4AcwBpAGIAbABlACAAcgBlAHEAdQBpAHIAZQBzACAAUABvAHcAZQByAFMAaABlAGwAbAAgAHYAMwAuADAAIABvAHIAIABuAGUAdwBlAHIAIgB9ACcA", "nAHsAIgBmAGEAaQBsAGUAZAAiADoAdAByAHUAZQAsACIAbQBzAGcAIgA6ACIAQQBuAHMAaQBiAGwAZQAgAHIAZQBxAHUAaQByAGUAcwAgAFAAbwB3AGUAcgBTAGgAZQBsAGwAIAB2ADMALgAwACAAbwByACAAbgBlAHcAZQByACIAfQAnA"]))
description: Csc.EXE Execution Form Potentially Suspicious Parent: Detects a potentially suspicious parent of "csc.exe", which could be a sign of payload delivery.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\csi\.exe$|.*\\rcsi\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["csi.exe", "rcsi.exe"]) AND process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("Microsoft Corporation"))
description: Suspicious Csi.exe Usage: Csi.exe is a signed binary from Microsoft that comes with Visual Studio and provides C# interactive capabilities. It can be used to run C# code from a file passed as a parameter in command line. Early version of this utility provided with Microsoft â€œRoslynâ€ Community Technology Preview was named 'rcsi.exe'

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\csi\.exe$/i AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$)/i) AND process.name = NOCASE("csi.exe"))
description: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\csvde\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("csvde.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -f" AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -i")
description: Active Directory Structure Export Via Csvde.EXE: Detects the execution of "csvde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/\s-c\s/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--cookie-jar"))
description: Potential Cookies Session Hijacking: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "-c" flag in order to save cookie data.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/\s-H\s/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--header") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "User-Agent:")
description: Curl Web Request With Potential Custom User-Agent: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with a potential custom "User-Agent". Attackers can leverage this to download or exfiltrate data via "curl" to a domain that only accept specific "User-Agent" strings

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND process.cmd_line=/:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -O", "--remote-name", "--output"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.bat$|.*\.bat"$|.*\.dat$|.*\.dat"$|.*\.dll$|.*\.dll"$|.*\.exe$|.*\.exe"$|.*\.gif$|.*\.gif"$|.*\.hta$|.*\.hta"$|.*\.jpeg$|.*\.jpeg"$|.*\.log$|.*\.log"$|.*\.msi$|.*\.msi"$|.*\.png$|.*\.png"$|.*\.ps1$|.*\.ps1"$|.*\.psm1$|.*\.psm1"$|.*\.vbe$|.*\.vbe"$|.*\.vbs$|.*\.vbs"$|.*\.bat'$|.*\.dat'$|.*\.dll'$|.*\.exe'$|.*\.gif'$|.*\.hta'$|.*\.jpeg'$|.*\.log'$|.*\.msi'$|.*\.png'$|.*\.ps1'$|.*\.psm1'$|.*\.vbe'$|.*\.vbs'$)/i))
description: File Download From IP URL Via Curl.EXE: Detects file downloads directly from IP address URL using curl.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND process.cmd_line=/:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -O", "--remote-name", "--output"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.bat$|.*\.bat"$|.*\.dat$|.*\.dat"$|.*\.dll$|.*\.dll"$|.*\.exe$|.*\.exe"$|.*\.gif$|.*\.gif"$|.*\.hta$|.*\.hta"$|.*\.jpeg$|.*\.jpeg"$|.*\.log$|.*\.log"$|.*\.msi$|.*\.msi"$|.*\.png$|.*\.png"$|.*\.ps1$|.*\.ps1"$|.*\.psm1$|.*\.psm1"$|.*\.vbe$|.*\.vbe"$|.*\.vbs$|.*\.vbs"$|.*\.bat'$|.*\.dat'$|.*\.dll'$|.*\.exe'$|.*\.gif'$|.*\.hta'$|.*\.jpeg'$|.*\.log'$|.*\.msi'$|.*\.png'$|.*\.ps1'$|.*\.psm1'$|.*\.vbe'$|.*\.vbs'$)/i))
description: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Curl.EXE: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using curl.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".githubusercontent.com", "anonfiles.com", "cdn.discordapp.com", "ddns.net", "dl.dropboxusercontent.com", "ghostbin.co", "github.com", "glitch.me", "gofile.io", "hastebin.com", "mediafire.com", "mega.nz", "onrender.com", "pages.dev", "paste.ee", "pastebin.com", "pastebin.pl", "pastetext.net", "pixeldrain.com", "privatlab.com", "privatlab.net", "send.exploit.in", "sendspace.com", "storage.googleapis.com", "storjshare.io", "supabase.co", "temp.sh", "transfer.sh", "trycloudflare.com", "ufile.io", "w3spaces.com", "workers.dev"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -O", "--remote-name", "--output"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.ps1$|.*\.ps1'$|.*\.ps1"$|.*\.dat$|.*\.dat'$|.*\.dat"$|.*\.msi$|.*\.msi'$|.*\.msi"$|.*\.bat$|.*\.bat'$|.*\.bat"$|.*\.exe$|.*\.exe'$|.*\.exe"$|.*\.vbs$|.*\.vbs'$|.*\.vbs"$|.*\.vbe$|.*\.vbe'$|.*\.vbe"$|.*\.hta$|.*\.hta'$|.*\.hta"$|.*\.dll$|.*\.dll'$|.*\.dll"$|.*\.psm1$|.*\.psm1'$|.*\.psm1"$)/i))
description: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via Curl.EXE: Detects potentially suspicious file download from file sharing domains using curl.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/\s-k\s/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--insecure"))
description: Insecure Transfer Via Curl.EXE: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "--insecure" flag.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--doh-insecure", "--proxy-insecure"]))
description: Insecure Proxy/DOH Transfer Via Curl.EXE: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "insecure" flag over proxy or DOH.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "file:///")
description: Local File Read Using Curl.EXE: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "file://" protocol handler in order to read local files.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("The curl executable")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["%AppData%", "%Public%", "%Temp%", "%tmp%", "\AppData\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\", "C:\PerfLogs\\", "C:\ProgramData\\", "C:\Windows\Temp\\"] OR process.cmd_line=/(.*\.dll$|.*\.gif$|.*\.jpeg$|.*\.jpg$|.*\.png$|.*\.temp$|.*\.tmp$|.*\.txt$|.*\.vbe$|.*\.vbs$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin\sh.exe") AND process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Program Files\Git\mingw64\bin\curl.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--silent --show-error --output ", "gfw-httpget-", "AppData"]))
description: Suspicious Curl.EXE Download: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\CustomShellHost\.exe$/i AND NOT process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\explorer.exe"))
description: Suspicious CustomShellHost Execution: Detects the execution of CustomShellHost.exe where the child isn't located in 'C:\Windows\explorer.exe'. CustomShellHost is a known LOLBin that can be abused by attackers for defense evasion techniques.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dctask64\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=6834B1B94E49701D77CCB3C0895E1AFD", "IMPHASH=1BB6F93B129F398C7C4A76BB97450BBA", "IMPHASH=FAA2AC19875FADE461C8D89DCF2710A3", "IMPHASH=F1039CED4B91572AB7847D26032E6BBF"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" executecmd64 ", " invokeexe ", " injectDll "]))
description:
ManageEngine Endpoint Central Dctask64.EXE Potential Abuse: Detects the execution of "dctask64.exe", a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\DefaultPack\.exe$/i)
description: Uncommon Child Process Of Defaultpack.EXE: Detects uncommon child processes of "DefaultPack.EXE" binary as a proxy to launch other programs

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Set-MpPreference" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-LowThreatDefaultAction", "-ModerateThreatDefaultAction", "-HighThreatDefaultAction", "-SevereThreatDefaultAction", "-ltdefac ", "-mtdefac ", "-htdefac ", "-stdefac "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Allow", "6", "NoAction", "9"]))
description:
PowerShell Defender Threat Severity Default Action Set to 'Allow' or 'NoAction': Detects the use of PowerShell to execute the 'Set-MpPreference' cmdlet to configure Windows Defender's threat severity default action to 'Allow' (value '6') or 'NoAction' (value '9').
This is a highly suspicious configuration change that effectively disables Defender's ability to automatically mitigate threats of a certain severity level.
An attacker might use this technique via the command line to bypass defenses before executing payloads.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["powershell_ise.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "reg.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["del", "Remove-Item", "ri "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\shellex\ContextMenuHandlers\EPP")
description:
Windows Defender Context Menu Removed: Detects the use of reg.exe or PowerShell to delete the Windows Defender context menu handler registry keys.
This action removes the "Scan with Microsoft Defender" option from the right-click menu for files, directories, and drives.
Attackers may use this technique to hinder manual, on-demand scans and reduce the visibility of the security product.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\desktopimgdownldr\.exe$/i AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\desktopimgdownldr\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/lockscreenurl:http")
description: Remote File Download Via Desktopimgdownldr Utility: Detects the desktopimgdownldr utility being used to download a remote file. An adversary may use desktopimgdownldr to download arbitrary files as an alternative to certutil.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /lockscreenurl:" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg delete", "\PersonalizationCSP"])
description: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\devcon\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DevCon.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " disable " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["15AD&DEV_0740", "VMWVMCIHOSTDEV"]))
description:
Devcon Execution Disabling VMware VMCI Device: Detects execution of devcon.exe with commands that disable the VMware Virtual Machine Communication Interface (VMCI) device.
This can be legitimate during VMware Tools troubleshooting or driver conflicts, but may also indicate malware attempting to hijack communication with the hardware via the VMCI device.
This has been used to facilitate VMware ESXi vulnerability exploits to escape VMs and execute code on the ESXi host.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\DeviceCredentialDeployment\.exe$/i)
description: DeviceCredentialDeployment Execution: Detects the execution of DeviceCredentialDeployment to hide a process from view.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\deviceenroller\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("deviceenroller.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/PhoneDeepLink")
description:
Potential DLL Sideloading Via DeviceEnroller.EXE: Detects the use of the PhoneDeepLink parameter to potentially sideload a DLL file that does not exist. This non-existent DLL file is named "ShellChromeAPI.dll".
Adversaries can drop their own renamed DLL and execute it via DeviceEnroller.exe using this parameter

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -t msi-install ", " -i http"])
description: Arbitrary MSI Download Via Devinit.EXE: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by "devinit.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system

query: where(parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\AppData\Local\Apps\2.0\\" AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\nltest\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\werfault\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of ClickOnce Application: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of a ClickOnce deployment application

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("DirLister.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\DirLister\.exe$/i)
description: DirLister Execution: Detect the usage of "DirLister.exe" a utility for quickly listing folder or drive contents. It was seen used by BlackCat ransomware to create a list of accessible directories and files.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "query" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-v" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/v" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“v" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”v" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•v") OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-ItemPropertyValue", "gpv"])) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender", "\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion", "\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall", "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\TimeZoneInformation", "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services"]))
description: System Information Discovery via Registry Queries: Detects attempts to query system information directly from the Windows Registry.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\diskshadow\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of DiskShadow.EXE: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "Diskshadow.exe". This could be an attempt to bypass parent/child relationship detection or application whitelisting rules.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("diskshadow.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\diskshadow\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•s ") AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".txt")
description:
Diskshadow Script Mode - Uncommon Script Extension Execution: Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode to execute an script with a potentially uncommon extension.
Initial baselining of the allowed extension list is required.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("diskshadow.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\diskshadow\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•s ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\ProgramData\\", "\Users\Public\\"]))
description: Diskshadow Script Mode - Execution From Potential Suspicious Location: Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode using the "/s" flag where the script is located in a potentially suspicious location.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dism\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DISM.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["WindowsPowerShellWebAccess", "/online", "/enable-feature"])
description: PowerShell Web Access Feature Enabled Via DISM: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\DismHost\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/Online", "/Disable-Feature"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\Dism\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/Online", "/Disable-Feature"])
description: Dism Remove Online Package: Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. DISM is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\VMwareXferlogs\.exe$/i AND NOT process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Program Files\VMware\\")
description: DLL Sideloading by VMware Xfer Utility: Detects execution of VMware Xfer utility (VMwareXferlogs.exe) from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\dllhost\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line IIN ["dllhost.exe", "dllhost"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line = null)
description: Dllhost.EXE Execution Anomaly: Detects a "dllhost" process spawning with no commandline arguments which is very rare to happen and could indicate process injection activity or malware mimicking similar system processes.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\iodine\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\dnscat2")
description: DNS Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution: Well-known DNS Exfiltration tools execution

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\dns\.exe$/i AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\conhost\.exe$/i)
description: Unusual Child Process of dns.exe: Detects an unexpected process spawning from dns.exe which may indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\dnscmd\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/enumrecords", "/enumzones", "/ZonePrint", "/info"]))
description: Potential Discovery Activity Via Dnscmd.EXE: Detects an attempt to leverage dnscmd.exe to enumerate the DNS zones of a domain. DNS zones used to host the DNS records for a particular domain.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\dnscmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/config", "/serverlevelplugindll"])
description: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed Via Dnscmd.EXE: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\dnx\.exe$/i)
description:
Potential Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.EXE: Detects the execution of Dnx.EXE. The Dnx utility allows for the execution of C# code.
Attackers might abuse this in order to bypass application whitelisting.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dotnet\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE(".NET Host")) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.csproj$|.*\.csproj"$|.*\.dll$|.*\.dll"$|.*\.csproj'$|.*\.dll'$)/i) AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Program Files (x86)\Notepad++\notepad++.exe", "C:\Program Files\Notepad++\notepad++.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["C:\ProgramData\CSScriptNpp\\", "-cscs_path:", "\cs-script\cscs.dll"]))
description: Arbitrary DLL or Csproj Code Execution Via Dotnet.EXE: Detects execution of arbitrary DLLs or unsigned code via a ".csproj" files via Dotnet.EXE.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dotnet\-trace\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("dotnet-trace.dll")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-- ", "collect"])
description: Binary Proxy Execution Via Dotnet-Trace.EXE: Detects commandline arguments for executing a child process via dotnet-trace.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dotnet\-dump\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("dotnet-dump.dll")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "collect")
description: Process Memory Dump Via Dotnet-Dump: Detects the execution of "dotnet-dump" with the "collect" flag. The execution could indicate potential process dumping of critical processes such as LSASS.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*driverquery\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("drvqry.exe")) AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Potential Recon Activity Using DriverQuery.EXE: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*driverquery\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("drvqry.exe")) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: DriverQuery.EXE Execution: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility. Which can be used to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dsacls\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DSACLS.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /G " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["GR", "GE", "GW", "GA", "WP", "WD"]))
description: Potentially Over Permissive Permissions Granted Using Dsacls.EXE: Detects usage of Dsacls to grant over permissive permissions

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dsacls\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DSACLS.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/user:", "/passwd:"])
description: Potential Password Spraying Attempt Using Dsacls.EXE: Detects possible password spraying attempts using Dsacls

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\dsquery\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("dsquery.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "trustedDomain")
description: Domain Trust Discovery Via Dsquery: Detects execution of "dsquery.exe" for domain trust discovery

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\dtrace\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lkd(0)" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["syscall:::return", "lkd("])
description: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Program Files", "\Microsoft Visual Studio\\", "\dump64.exe"] AND (process.name = NOCASE("procdump") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -ma ", " -mp "]))
description:
Potential Windows Defender AV Bypass Via Dump64.EXE Rename: Detects when a user is potentially trying to bypass the Windows Defender AV by renaming a tool to dump64.exe and placing it in the Visual Studio folder.
Currently the rule is covering only usage of procdump but other utilities can be added in order to increase coverage.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\DumpMinitool\.exe$|.*\\DumpMinitool\.x86\.exe$|.*\\DumpMinitool\.arm64\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["DumpMinitool.exe", "DumpMinitool.x86.exe", "DumpMinitool.arm64.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" Full", " Mini", " WithHeap"]))
description: DumpMinitool Execution: Detects the use of "DumpMinitool.exe" a tool that allows the dump of process memory via the use of the "MiniDumpWriteDump"

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\DumpMinitool\.exe$|.*\\DumpMinitool\.x86\.exe$|.*\\DumpMinitool\.arm64\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["DumpMinitool.exe", "DumpMinitool.x86.exe", "DumpMinitool.arm64.exe"]) AND (NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Microsoft Visual Studio\\", "\Extensions\\"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".txt" OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" Full", " Mini", " WithHeap"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--dumpType"))
description: Suspicious DumpMinitool Execution: Detects suspicious ways to use the "DumpMinitool.exe" binary

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\DXCap\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DXCap.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c ")
description: New Capture Session Launched Via DXCap.EXE: Detects the execution of "DXCap.EXE" with the "-c" flag, which allows a user to launch any arbitrary binary or windows package through DXCap itself. This can be abused to potentially bypass application whitelisting.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["esentutl", " /p"])
description: Esentutl Gather Credentials: Conti recommendation to its affiliates to use esentutl to access NTDS dumped file. Trickbot also uses this utilities to get MSEdge info via its module pwgrab.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\esentutl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\esentutl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "vss" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -m " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /m " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“m " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”m " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•m " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”y " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•y ") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\config\RegBack\sam", "\config\RegBack\security", "\config\RegBack\system", "\config\sam", "\config\security", "\config\system ", "\repair\sam", "\repair\security", "\repair\system", "\windows\ntds\ntds.dit"])
description: Copying Sensitive Files with Credential Data: Files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) copying

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\esentutl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("esentutl.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•r") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\Windows\WebCache")
description: Esentutl Steals Browser Information: One way Qbot steals sensitive information is by extracting browser data from Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge by using the built-in utility esentutl.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MiniNt"] OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["New-Item ", "ni "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\MiniNt")
description:
Security Event Logging Disabled via MiniNt Registry Key - Process: Detects attempts to disable security event logging by adding the `MiniNt` registry key.
This key is used to disable the Windows Event Log service, which collects and stores event logs from the operating system and applications.
Adversaries may want to disable this service to prevent logging of security events that could be used to detect their activities.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\eventvwr\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\System32\\mmc\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\WerFault\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\WerFault\.exe$)/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Event Viewer Child Process: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes of "eventvwr.exe" which might indicate a UAC bypass attempt

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\expand\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-F:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/F:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“F:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”F:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•F:") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\ProgramData", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\Admin$\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\C$\\", "\Temporary Internet"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favorites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favourites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Contacts\\"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Program Files (x86)\Dell\UpdateService\ServiceShell.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\ProgramData\Dell\UpdateService\Temp\\"))
description: Potentially Suspicious Cabinet File Expansion: Detects the expansion or decompression of cabinet files from potentially suspicious or uncommon locations, e.g. seen in Iranian MeteorExpress related attacks

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/factory,{75dff2b7-6936-4c06-a8bb-676a7b00b24b}" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "explorer.exe" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -root," OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /root," OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“root," OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”root," OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•root,"))
description:
Explorer Process Tree Break: Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe to launch arbitrary commands or binaries,
which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer spawning from "svchost"

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "shell:mycomputerfolder")
description: File Explorer Folder Opened Using Explorer Folder Shortcut Via Shell: Detects the initial execution of "cmd.exe" which spawns "explorer.exe" with the appropriate command line arguments for opening the "My Computer" folder.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/NOUACCHECK" AND NOT (parent_process.cmd_line = NOCASE("C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe -k netsvcs -p -s Schedule") OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe")))
description: Explorer NOUACCHECK Flag: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "findstr" OR process.exe_path=/.*findstr\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("FINDSTR.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -v " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /v " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“v " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”v " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•v ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -l " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/l " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“l " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”l " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•l ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\\")
description: Remote File Download Via Findstr.EXE: Detects execution of "findstr" with specific flags and a remote share path. This specific set of CLI flags would allow "findstr" to download the content of the file located on the remote share as described in the LOLBAS entry.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cpassword", "\sysvol\\", ".xml"])
description: Findstr GPP Passwords: Look for the encrypted cpassword value within Group Policy Preference files on the Domain Controller. This value can be decrypted with gpp-decrypt.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.lnk$|.*\.lnk"$|.*\.lnk'$)/i))
description: Findstr Launching .lnk File: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lsass" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ' -i "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ' /i "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ' â€“i "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ' â€”i "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ' â€•i "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -i lsass.exe" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /i lsass.exe" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“i lsass.exe" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”i lsass.exe" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•i lsass.exe" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'findstr "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "findstr lsass" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'findstr.exe "lsass' OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "findstr.exe lsass")
description: LSASS Process Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE: Detects findstring commands that include the keyword lsass, which indicates recon actviity for the LSASS process PID

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['"Everyone"', """'Everyone'""", '"BUILTIN\"', """'BUILTIN\'"""]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["icacls ", "findstr ", "Everyone"])
description:
Permission Misconfiguration Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE: Detects usage of findstr with the "EVERYONE" or "BUILTIN" keywords.
This was seen being used in combination with "icacls" and other utilities to spot misconfigured files or folders permissions.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ipconfig*|*find", "net*|*find", "netstat*|*find", "ping*|*find", "systeminfo*|*find", "tasklist*|*find", "whoami*|*find"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe /c TASKLIST \/V |", "FIND \/I", "\xampp\\", "\catalina_start.bat"]))
description:
Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE: Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\ avira$|.*\ avira"$|.*\ cb$|.*\ cb"$|.*\ cylance$|.*\ cylance"$|.*\ defender$|.*\ defender"$|.*\ kaspersky$|.*\ kaspersky"$|.*\ kes$|.*\ kes"$|.*\ mc$|.*\ mc"$|.*\ sec$|.*\ sec"$|.*\ sentinel$|.*\ sentinel"$|.*\ symantec$|.*\ symantec"$|.*\ virus$|.*\ virus"$)/i))
description:
Security Tools Keyword Lookup Via Findstr.EXE: Detects execution of "findstr" to search for common names of security tools. Attackers often pipe the results of recon commands such as "tasklist" or "whoami" to "findstr" in order to filter out the results.
This detection focuses on the keywords that the attacker might use as a filter.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "findstr" OR process.exe_path=/.*findstr\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("FINDSTR.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”s " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•s ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -i " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /i " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“i " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”i " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•i "))
description: Insensitive Subfolder Search Via Findstr.EXE: Detects execution of findstr with the "s" and "i" flags for a "subfolder" and "insensitive" search respectively. Attackers sometimes leverage this built-in utility to search the system for interesting files or filter through results of commands.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\find\.exe$|.*\\findstr\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["FIND.EXE", "FINDSTR.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " 385201")
description: Sysmon Discovery Via Default Driver Altitude Using Findstr.EXE: Detects usage of "findstr" with the argument "385201". Which could indicate potential discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using the default driver altitude (even if the name is changed).

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("finger.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\finger\.exe$/i)
description:
Finger.EXE Execution: Detects execution of the "finger.exe" utility.
Finger.EXE or "TCPIP Finger Command" is an old utility that is still present on modern Windows installation. It Displays information about users on a specified remote computer (typically a UNIX computer) that is running the finger service or daemon.
Due to the old nature of this utility and the rareness of machines having the finger service. Any execution of "finger.exe" can be considered "suspicious" and worth investigating.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\fltMC\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("fltMC.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "unload" AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\"]) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\endpoint\-protection\-installer\-x64\.tmp$/i AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*unload\ rtp_filesystem_filter$|.*unload\ rtp_filter$)/i) OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Program Files (x86)\ManageEngine\uems_agent\bin\dcfaservice64.exe") AND process.cmd_line=/.*unload\ DFMFilter$/i))
description: Filter Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE: Detect filter driver unloading activity via fltmc.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\fltMC\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("fltMC.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["unload", "sysmon"])
description: Sysmon Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE: Detects possible Sysmon filter driver unloaded via fltmc.exe

query: where((parent_process.cmd_line=/(.*\.exe$|.*\.exe"$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ISTARTS-WITH '/c echo "' AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\System32\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\\"]) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\forfiles\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Windows\System32\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\\"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i))
description: Forfiles.EXE Child Process Masquerading: Detects the execution of "forfiles" from a non-default location, in order to potentially spawn a custom "cmd.exe" from the current working directory.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\forfiles\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("forfiles.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c "))
description:
Forfiles Command Execution: Detects the execution of "forfiles" with the "/c" flag.
While this is an expected behavior of the tool, it can be abused in order to proxy execution through it with any binary.
Can be used to bypass application whitelisting.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\format\.com$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/fs:" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/fs:exFAT", "/fs:FAT", "/fs:NTFS", "/fs:ReFS", "/fs:UDF"]))
description: Uncommon FileSystem Load Attempt By Format.com: Detects the execution of format.com with an uncommon filesystem selection that could indicate a defense evasion activity in which "format.com" is used to load malicious DLL files or other programs.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\fsi\.exe$|.*\\fsianycpu\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["fsi.exe", "fsianycpu.exe"])
description:
Use of FSharp Interpreters: Detects the execution of FSharp Interpreters "FsiAnyCpu.exe" and "FSi.exe"
Both can be used for AWL bypass and to execute F# code via scripts or inline.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\fsutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("fsutil.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "drives")
description: Fsutil Drive Enumeration: Attackers may leverage fsutil to enumerated connected drives.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["fsutil", "behavior", "set", "SymlinkEvaluation"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["R2L:1", "R2R:1", "L2L:1"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious NTFS Symlink Behavior Modification: Detects the modification of NTFS symbolic link behavior using fsutil, which could be used to enable remote to local or remote to remote symlinks for potential attacks.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\fsutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("fsutil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["deletejournal", "createjournal", "setZeroData"]))
description:
Fsutil Suspicious Invocation: Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size, etc).
Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\ftp\.exe$/i OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\ftp\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ftp.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-s:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/s:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“s:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”s:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•s:"))
description: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Via FTP.EXE: Detects execution of "ftp.exe" script with the "-s" or "/s" flag and any child processes ran by "ftp.exe".

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\GfxDownloadWrapper\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "https://gameplayapi.intel.com/")
description: Arbitrary File Download Via GfxDownloadWrapper.EXE: Detects execution of GfxDownloadWrapper.exe with a URL as an argument to download file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\git\.exe$|.*\\git\-remote\-https\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("git.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" clone ", "git-remote-https "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["exploit", "Vulns", "vulnerability", "RemoteCodeExecution", "Invoke-", "CVE-", "poc-", "ProofOfConcept", "proxyshell", "log4shell", "eternalblue", "eternal-blue", "MS17-"]))
description: Suspicious Git Clone: Detects execution of "git" in order to clone a remote repository that contain suspicious keywords which might be suspicious

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\Runner\.Worker\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Runner.Worker.dll")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "spawnclient" OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\Runner\.Listener\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Runner.Listener.dll")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["run", "configure"]))
description:
Github Self-Hosted Runner Execution: Detects GitHub self-hosted runners executing workflows on local infrastructure that could be abused for persistence and code execution.
Shai-Hulud is an npm supply chain worm targeting CI/CD environments.
It installs runners on compromised systems to maintain access after credential theft, leveraging their access to secrets and internal networks.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\GoogleUpdate\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Google" OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\setup\.exe$|.*chrome_updater\.exe$|.*chrome_installer\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path = null))
description: Potentially Suspicious GoogleUpdate Child Process: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "GoogleUpdate.exe"

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\gpg\.exe$|.*\\gpg2\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("GnuPGâ€™s OpenPGP tool")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -d ", "passphrase"])
description: File Decryption Using Gpg4win: Detects usage of Gpg4win to decrypt files

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\gpg\.exe$|.*\\gpg2\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("GnuPGâ€™s OpenPGP tool")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -c ", "passphrase"])
description: File Encryption Using Gpg4win: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt files

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\gpg\.exe$|.*\\gpg2\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("gpg.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("GnuPGâ€™s OpenPGP tool")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Program Files (x86)\GNU\GnuPG\bin\\", ":\Program Files (x86)\GnuPG VS-Desktop\\", ":\Program Files (x86)\GnuPG\bin\\", ":\Program Files (x86)\Gpg4win\bin\\"]))
description: Portable Gpg.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of "gpg.exe" from uncommon location. Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\gpg\.exe$|.*\\gpg2\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("GNU Privacy Guard (GnuPG)") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("GnuPGâ€™s OpenPGP tool")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-passphrase" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\"]))
description: File Encryption/Decryption Via Gpg4win From Suspicious Locations: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\gpresult\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/z", "/v"]))
description: Gpresult Display Group Policy Information: Detects cases in which a user uses the built-in Windows utility gpresult to display the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) information

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\gup\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\Notepad++\notepad++.exe" OR parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Notepad++\updater\\" OR process.cmd_line = null))
description: Arbitrary Binary Execution Using GUP Utility: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) to launch other commands or executables

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\GUP\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("gup.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -unzipTo ", "http"] AND NOT parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\notepad\+\+\.exe$/i)
description: File Download Using Notepad++ GUP Utility: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) from a process other than Notepad++ to download files.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\gup\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["bitsadmin", "certutil", "curl", "finger", "forfiles", "regsvr32", "rundll32", "wget"]))
description:
Suspicious Child Process of Notepad++ Updater - GUP.Exe: Detects suspicious child process creation by the Notepad++ updater process (gup.exe).
This could indicate potential exploitation of the updater component to deliver unwanted malware.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\GUP\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\Program\ Files\\Notepad\+\+\\updater\\GUP\.exe$|.*\\Program\ Files\ \(x86\)\\Notepad\+\+\\updater\\GUP\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Users\\" AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppData\\Local\\Notepad\+\+\\updater\\GUP\.exe$|.*\\AppData\\Roaming\\Notepad\+\+\\updater\\GUP\.exe$)/i)))
description: Suspicious GUP Usage: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("HH.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\hh\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".chm")
description: HH.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of "hh.exe" to open ".chm" files.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("HH.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\hh\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://", "\\"]))
description: Remote CHM File Download/Execution Via HH.EXE: Detects the usage of "hh.exe" to execute/download remotely hosted ".chm" files.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\hh\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\CertReq\.exe$|.*\\CertUtil\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\installutil\.exe$|.*\\MSbuild\.exe$|.*\\MSHTA\.EXE$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: HTML Help HH.EXE Suspicious Child Process: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("HH.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\hh\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".application", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Content.Outlook\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Suspicious HH.EXE Execution: Detects a suspicious execution of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" --adcs ", " --port "])
description: HackTool - ADCSPwn Execution: Detects command line parameters used by ADCSPwn, a tool to escalate privileges in an active directory network by coercing authenticate from machine accounts and relaying to the certificate service

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "SharpHound" OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "SharpHound" OR process.exe_file.author ICONTAINS-ANY ["SpecterOps", "evil corp"] OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Bloodhound.exe", "\SharpHound.exe"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -CollectionMethod All ", " --CollectionMethods Session ", " --Loop --Loopduration ", " --PortScanTimeout ", ".exe -c All -d ", "Invoke-Bloodhound", "Get-BloodHoundData"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -JsonFolder ", " -ZipFileName "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" DCOnly ", " --NoSaveCache "])
description: HackTool - Bloodhound/Sharphound Execution: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["rundll32.exe", ".dll", "StartNodeRelay"])
description: HackTool - F-Secure C3 Load by Rundll32: F-Secure C3 produces DLLs with a default exported StartNodeRelay function.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Certify\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Certify.exe") OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Certify" OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe cas ", ".exe find ", ".exe pkiobjects ", ".exe request ", ".exe download "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /vulnerable", " \/template:", " \/altname:", " \/domain:", " \/path:", " \/ca:"]))
description: HackTool - Certify Execution: Detects Certify a tool for Active Directory certificate abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Certipy\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Certipy.exe") OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Certipy" OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" account ", " auth ", " cert ", " find ", " forge ", " ptt ", " relay ", " req ", " shadow ", " template "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -bloodhound", " -ca-pfx ", " -dc-ip ", " -kirbi", " -old-bloodhound", " -pfx ", " -target", " -template", " -username ", " -vulnerable", "auth -pfx", "shadow auto", "shadow list"]))
description: HackTool - Certipy Execution: Detects Certipy execution, a tool for Active Directory Certificate Services enumeration and abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["cmd ", "cmd.exe", "c:\windows\system32\cmd.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["psinject", "spawnas", "make_token", "remote-exec", "rev2self", "dcsync", "logonpasswords", "execute-assembly", "getsystem"]))
description: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Commands: Detects use of Cobalt Strike commands accidentally entered in the CMD shell

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-UserHunter", "Invoke-ShareFinder", "Invoke-Kerberoast", "Invoke-SMBAutoBrute", "Invoke-Nightmare", "zerologon", "av_query"]))
description: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Modules: Detects Cobalt Strike module/commands accidentally entered in CMD shell

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["rundll32.exe", "rundll32 "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".dll" AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\ StartW$|.*,StartW$)/i))
description: CobaltStrike Load by Rundll32: Rundll32 can be use by Cobalt Strike with StartW function to load DLLs from the command line.

query: where(process.cmd_line=/.*cmd\.exe\ \/C\ whoami$/i AND parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Temp\\" OR (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\runonce\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe /c echo", "> \\.\pipe"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe \/C echo", " > \\.\pipe"] AND process.cmd_line=/.*conhost\.exe\ 0xffffffff\ \-ForceV1$/i OR parent_process.cmd_line=/.*\/C\ whoami$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*conhost\.exe\ 0xffffffff\ \-ForceV1$/i)
description: Potential CobaltStrike Process Patterns: Detects potential process patterns related to Cobalt Strike beacon activity

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\CoercedPotato\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " --exploitId " OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=A75D7669DB6B2E107A44C4057FF7F7D6", "IMPHASH=F91624350E2C678C5DCBE5E1F24E22C9", "IMPHASH=14C81850A079A87E83D50CA41C709A15"])
description: HackTool - CoercedPotato Execution: Detects the use of CoercedPotato, a tool for privilege escalation

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-Sta", "-Nop", "-Window", "Hidden"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-Command", "-EncodedCommand"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["sv o (New-Object IO.MemorySteam);sv d ", "mshta file.hta", "GruntHTTP", "-EncodedCommand cwB2ACAAbwAgA"])
description: HackTool - Covenant PowerShell Launcher: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\crackmapexec\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -M pe_inject " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" --local-auth", " -u ", " -x "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" --local-auth", " -u ", " -p ", """ -H 'NTHASH'"""] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" mssql ", " -u ", " -p ", " -M ", " -d "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" smb ", " -u ", " -H ", " -M ", " -o "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" smb ", " -u ", " -p ", " --local-auth"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" --local-auth", " -u ", " -p "] AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" 10.", " 192.168.", "/24 "])
description: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution: This rule detect common flag combinations used by CrackMapExec in order to detect its use even if the binary has been replaced.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd.exe /Q \/c * 1> \\*\*\* 2>&1", "cmd.exe \/C * > \\*\*\* 2>&1", "cmd.exe \/C * > *\Temp\* 2>&1", 'powershell.exe -exec bypass -noni -nop -w 1 -C "', "powershell.exe -noni -nop -w 1 -enc "])
description: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution Patterns: Detects various execution patterns of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["tasklist /fi ", "Imagename eq lsass.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd.exe \/c ", "cmd.exe \/r ", "cmd.exe \/k ", "cmd \/c ", "cmd \/r ", "cmd \/k "]) AND (process.username ICONTAINS-ANY ["AUTHORI", "AUTORI"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["do rundll32.exe C:\windows\System32\comsvcs.dll, MiniDump", "\Windows\Temp\\", " full", "%%B"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["tasklist \/v \/fo csv", 'findstr /i "lsass"'])
description: HackTool - CrackMapExec Process Patterns: Detects suspicious process patterns found in logs when CrackMapExec is used

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["join*split", """( $ShellId[1]+$ShellId[13]+'x')""", "( $PSHome[*]+$PSHOME[*]+", """( $env:Public[13]+$env:Public[5]+'x')""", """( $env:ComSpec[4,*,25]-Join'')""", """[1,3]+'x'-Join'')"""]))
description: HackTool - CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\CreateMiniDump\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS "IMPHASH=4a07f944a83e8a7c2525efa35dd30e2f")
description: HackTool - CreateMiniDump Execution: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker's machine

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /am51", " \/password"])
description: HackTool - DInjector PowerShell Cradle Execution: Detects the use of the Dinject PowerShell cradle based on the specific flags

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Doppelganger\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=AB94D5217896ADCD765A06B2D52F0AEB", "IMPHASH=65F0EA61156EE0C2A35421926F0C7F78"])
description: HackTool - Doppelanger LSASS Dumper Execution: Detects the execution of the Doppelanger hacktool which is used to dump LSASS memory via process cloning while evading common detection methods

query: where(Hashes ICONTAINS "MD5=09D278F9DE118EF09163C6140255C690" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Dumpert.dll")
description: HackTool - Dumpert Process Dumper Execution: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\EDR-Freeze", "\EDRFreeze"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=1195F7935954A2CD09157390C33F8E8C", "IMPHASH=129F58DE3D687FB7F012BF6C3D679997", "IMPHASH=2C617A175D0086251642C6619F7CC8BA", "IMPHASH=8828F0B906F7844358FB92A899E9520F", "IMPHASH=AF76D95157EC554DC1EF178E4E66D447", "IMPHASH=E1B04316B61ACA31DD52ABBEC0A37FD5", "IMPHASH=8B2D5B54AFCFEC60D54F6B31D80ED4A0", "IMPHASH=AB8BB31EDD91D2A05FE7B62A535E9EB7"])
description:
Hacktool - EDR-Freeze Execution: Detects execution of EDR-Freeze, a tool that exploits the MiniDumpWriteDump function and WerFaultSecure.exe to suspend EDR and Antivirus processes on Windows.
EDR-Freeze leverages a race-condition attack to put security processes into a dormant state by suspending WerFaultSecure at the moment it freezes the target process.
This technique does not require kernel-level exploits or BYOVD, but instead abuses user-mode functionality to temporarily disable monitoring by EDR or Antimalware solutions.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\EDRSilencer\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("EDRSilencer.exe") OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "EDRSilencer")
description: HackTool - EDRSilencer Execution: Detects the execution of EDRSilencer, a tool that leverages Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) to block Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents from reporting security events to the server based on PE metadata information.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -NoP -sta -NonI -W Hidden -Enc ", " -noP -sta -w 1 -enc ", " -NoP -NonI -W Hidden -enc ", " -noP -sta -w 1 -enc", " -enc  SQB", " -nop -exec bypass -EncodedCommand "])
description: HackTool - Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -NoP -NonI -w Hidden -c $x=$((gp HKCU:Software\Microsoft\Windows Update).Update)", " -NoP -NonI -c $x=$((gp HKCU:Software\Microsoft\Windows Update).Update);"])
description: HackTool - Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ruby\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-i ", "-u ", "-p "])
description: HackTool - WinRM Access Via Evil-WinRM: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

description: Hacktool Execution - Imphash: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via their import hash (imphash) even if the files have been renamed

query: where(process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("Cube0x0"))
description: Hacktool Execution - PE Metadata: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via PE metadata (company, product, etc.) even if the files have been renamed

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\gmer\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=E9DC058440D321AA17D0600B3CA0AB04", "SHA1=539C228B6B332F5AA523E5CE358C16647D8BBE57", "SHA256=E8A3E804A96C716A3E9B69195DB6FFB0D33E2433AF871E4D4E1EAB3097237173"])
description: HackTool - GMER Rootkit Detector and Remover Execution: Detects the execution GMER tool based on image and hash fields.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\loader\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--pid:" OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=38D9E015591BBFD4929E0D0F47FA0055", "IMPHASH=0E2216679CA6E1094D63322E3412D650"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--pid:", "--outfile:"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".dmp", "lsass", ".obf", "dump"]))
description: HackTool - HandleKatz LSASS Dumper Execution: Detects the use of HandleKatz, a tool that demonstrates the usage of cloned handles to Lsass in order to create an obfuscated memory dump of the same

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\hashcat\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-a ", "-m 1000 ", "-r "])
description: HackTool - Hashcat Password Cracker Execution: Execute Hashcat.exe with provided SAM file from registry of Windows and Password list to crack against

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\HollowReaper\.exe$/i)
description:
HackTool - HollowReaper Execution: Detects usage of HollowReaper, a process hollowing shellcode launcher used for stealth payload execution through process hollowing.
It replaces the memory of a legitimate process with custom shellcode, allowing the attacker to execute payloads under the guise of trusted binaries.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\htran\.exe$|.*\\lcx\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe -tran ", ".exe -slave "])
description: HackTool - Htran/NATBypass Execution: Detects executable names or flags used by Htran or Htran-like tools (e.g. NATBypass)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-u ", "-p "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["^USER^", "^PASS^"]))
description: HackTool - Hydra Password Bruteforce Execution: Detects command line parameters used by Hydra password guessing hack tool

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\wmiprvse\.exe$|.*\\mmc\.exe$|.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\services\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe", "/Q", "/c", "\\127.0.0.1\\", "&1"] OR (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["svchost.exe -k netsvcs", "taskeng.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe", "/C", "Windows\Temp\\", "&1"])
description: HackTool - Potential Impacket Lateral Movement Activity: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\goldenPac", "\karmaSMB", "\kintercept", "\ntlmrelayx", "\rpcdump", "\samrdump", "\secretsdump", "\smbexec", "\smbrelayx", "\wmiexec", "\wmipersist"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\atexec_windows\.exe$|.*\\dcomexec_windows\.exe$|.*\\dpapi_windows\.exe$|.*\\findDelegation_windows\.exe$|.*\\GetADUsers_windows\.exe$|.*\\GetNPUsers_windows\.exe$|.*\\getPac_windows\.exe$|.*\\getST_windows\.exe$|.*\\getTGT_windows\.exe$|.*\\GetUserSPNs_windows\.exe$|.*\\ifmap_windows\.exe$|.*\\mimikatz_windows\.exe$|.*\\netview_windows\.exe$|.*\\nmapAnswerMachine_windows\.exe$|.*\\opdump_windows\.exe$|.*\\psexec_windows\.exe$|.*\\rdp_check_windows\.exe$|.*\\sambaPipe_windows\.exe$|.*\\smbclient_windows\.exe$|.*\\smbserver_windows\.exe$|.*\\sniff_windows\.exe$|.*\\sniffer_windows\.exe$|.*\\split_windows\.exe$|.*\\ticketer_windows\.exe$)/i)
description: HackTool - Impacket Tools Execution: Detects the execution of different compiled Windows binaries of the impacket toolset (based on names or part of their names - could lead to false positives)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "impersonate.exe" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" list ", " exec ", " adduser "]) OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=9520714AB576B0ED01D1513691377D01", "SHA256=E81CC96E2118DC4FBFE5BAD1604E0AC7681960143E2101E1A024D52264BB0A8A", "IMPHASH=0A358FFC1697B7A07D0E817AC740DF62"])

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Inveigh\.exe$/i OR process.name IIN ["\Inveigh.exe", "\Inveigh.dll"] OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Inveigh") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -SpooferIP", " -ReplyToIPs ", " -ReplyToDomains ", " -ReplyToMACs ", " -SnifferIP"])

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd", "&&", "clipboard]::", "-f"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/c", "/r"]))
description: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

query: where(process.cmd_line=/\$PSHome\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$PSHome\[/i OR process.cmd_line=/\$ShellId\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$ShellId\[/i OR process.cmd_line=/\$env:Public\[\s*\d{1,3}\s*\]\s*\+\s*\$env:Public\[/i OR process.cmd_line=/\$env:ComSpec\[(\s*\d{1,3}\s*,){2}/i OR process.cmd_line=/\*mdr\*\W\s*\)\.Name/i OR process.cmd_line=/\$VerbosePreference\.ToString\(/i OR process.cmd_line=/\[String\]\s*\$VerbosePreference/i)
description: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block

query: where(process.cmd_line=/cmd.{0,5}(?:\/c|\/r).+powershell.+(?:\$\{?input\}?|noexit).+\"/i)
description: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell
Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["new-object", "text.encoding]::ascii"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["system.io.compression.deflatestream", "system.io.streamreader", "readtoend("]))
description: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

query: where(process.cmd_line=/(?i)(set).*&&\s?set.*(environment|invoke|\$\{?input).*&&.*"/i)
description: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts

query: where(process.cmd_line=/(?i)echo.*clip.*&&.*(Clipboard|i`?n`?v`?o`?k`?e`?)/i)
description: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["set", "&&", "mshta", "vbscript:createobject", ".run", "(window.close)"])
description: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["&&set", "cmd", "/c", "-f"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["{0}", "{1}", "{2}", "{3}", "{4}", "{5}"]))
description: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line=/.*\.bat$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\xcopy\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["powershell.exe", ".bat.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\xcopy\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["pwsh.exe", ".bat.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\attrib\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["+s", "+h", ".bat.exe"]))

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/q", "/c", "chcp"])

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\KrbRelay\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("KrbRelay.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -spn ", " -clsid ", " -rbcd "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shadowcred", "clsid", "spn"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["spn ", "session ", "clsid "])
description: HackTool - KrbRelay Execution: Detects the use of KrbRelay, a Kerberos relaying tool

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\RemoteKrbRelay\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RemoteKrbRelay.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -clsid ", " -target ", " -victim "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-rbcd " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-cn ", "--computername "]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-chp " AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-chpPass ", "-chpUser "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-addgroupmember ", "-group ", "-groupuser "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-smb ", "--smbkeyword "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["interactive", "secrets", "service-add"]))

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\KrbRelayUp\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("KrbRelayUp.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" relay ", " -Domain ", " -ComputerName "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" krbscm ", " -sc "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" spawn ", " -d ", " -cn ", " -cp "])
description: HackTool - KrbRelayUp Execution: Detects KrbRelayUp used to perform a universal no-fix local privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\lazagne\.exe$/i OR (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Tmp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\$Recycle.bin", "\AppData\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Favorites\\", "\Links\\", "\Music\\", "\Photos\\", "\Pictures\\", "\Saved Games\\", "\Searches\\", "\Users\Contacts\\", "\Users\Default\\", "\Users\Searches\\", "\Videos\\", "\Windows\addins\\", "\Windows\Fonts\\", "\Windows\IME\\"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.exe\ all$|.*\.exe\ browsers$|.*\.exe\ chats$|.*\.exe\ databases$|.*\.exe\ games$|.*\.exe\ git$|.*\.exe\ mails$|.*\.exe\ maven$|.*\.exe\ memory$|.*\.exe\ multimedia$|.*\.exe\ sysadmin$|.*\.exe\ unused$|.*\.exe\ wifi$|.*\.exe\ windows$)/i) OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" all ", " browsers ", " chats ", " databases ", " games ", " mails ", " maven ", " memory ", " multimedia ", " php ", " svn ", " sysadmin ", " unused ", " wifi "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-1Password", "-apachedirectorystudio", "-autologon", "-ChromiumBased", "-coreftp", "-credfiles", "-credman", "-cyberduck", "-dbvis", "-EyeCon", "-filezilla", "-filezillaserver", "-ftpnavigator", "-galconfusion", "-gitforwindows", "-hashdump", "-iisapppool", "-IISCentralCertP", "-kalypsomedia", "-keepass", "-keepassconfig", "-lsa_secrets", "-mavenrepositories", "-memory_dump", "-Mozilla", "-mRemoteNG", "-mscache", "-opensshforwindows", "-openvpn", "-outlook", "-pidgin", "-postgresql", "-psi-im", "-puttycm", "-pypykatz", "-Rclone", "-rdpmanager", "-robomongo", "-roguestale", "-skype", "-SQLDeveloper", "-squirrel", "-tortoise", "-turba", "-UCBrowser", "-unattended", "-vault", "-vaultfiles", "-vnc", "-winscp"]))
description:
HackTool - LaZagne Execution: Detects the execution of the LaZagne. A utility used to retrieve multiple types of passwords stored on a local computer.
LaZagne has been leveraged multiple times by threat actors in order to dump credentials.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\LocalPotato\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [".exe -i C:\\", "-o Windows\\"] OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=E1742EE971D6549E8D4D81115F88F1FC", "IMPHASH=DD82066EFBA94D7556EF582F247C8BB5"])

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\services\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/c", "echo", "\pipe\\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd", "%COMSPEC%"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["rundll32", ".dll,a", "/p:"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "MpCmdRun")

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["DumpCreds", "mimikatz"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["::aadcookie", "::detours", "::memssp", "::mflt", "::ncroutemon", "::ngcsign", "::printnightmare", "::skeleton", "::preshutdown", "::mstsc", "::multirdp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["rpc::", "token::", "crypto::", "dpapi::", "sekurlsa::", "kerberos::", "lsadump::", "privilege::", "process::", "vault::"])

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\PCHunter64\.exe$|.*\\PCHunter32\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PCHunter.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Epoolsoft Windows Information View Tools") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["SHA1=5F1CBC3D99558307BC1250D084FA968521482025", "MD5=987B65CD9B9F4E9A1AFD8F8B48CF64A7", "SHA256=2B214BDDAAB130C274DE6204AF6DBA5AEEC7433DA99AA950022FA306421A6D32", "IMPHASH=444D210CEA1FF8112F256A4997EED7FF", "SHA1=3FB89787CB97D902780DA080545584D97FB1C2EB", "MD5=228DD0C2E6287547E26FFBD973A40F14", "SHA256=55F041BF4E78E9BFA6D4EE68BE40E496CE3A1353E1CA4306598589E19802522C", "IMPHASH=0479F44DF47CFA2EF1CCC4416A538663"])
description: HackTool - PCHunter Execution: Detects suspicious use of PCHunter, a tool like Process Hacker to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level stuff

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/Create", "powershell.exe -NonI", "/TN Updater /TR"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\/SC ONLOGON", "\/SC DAILY \/ST", "\/SC ONIDLE", "\/SC HOURLY"]))

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\PowerTool\.exe$|.*\\PowerTool64\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PowerTool.exe"))

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\purplesharp" OR process.name = NOCASE("PurpleSharp.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["xyz123456.exe", "PurpleSharp"])

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\pypykatz\.exe$|.*\\python\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["live", "registry"])

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\QuarksPwDump\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line IIN [" -dhl", " --dump-hash-local", " -dhdc", " --dump-hash-domain-cached", " --dump-bitlocker", " -dhd ", " --dump-hash-domain ", "--ntds-file"])

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["gthread-3.6.dll", "\Windows\Temp\tmp.bat", "sigcmm-2.4.dll"]))

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["PetitPotam", "RottenPotato", "HotPotato", "JuicyPotato", "\just_dce_", "Juicy Potato", "\temp\rot.exe", "\Potato.exe", "\SpoolSample.exe", "\Responder.exe", "\smbrelayx", "\ntlmrelayx", "\LocalPotato"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-Tater", " smbrelay", " ntlmrelay", "cme smb ", " /ntlm:NTLMhash ", "Invoke-PetitPotam", ".exe -t * -p "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '.exe -c "{' AND process.cmd_line=/.*\}"\ \-z$/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["HotPotatoes6", "HotPotatoes7", "HotPotatoes "]))

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Rubeus\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Rubeus.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Rubeus") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["asreproast ", "dump /service:krbtgt ", "dump \/luid:0x", "kerberoast ", "createnetonly \/program:", "ptt \/ticket:", "\/impersonateuser:", "renew \/ticket:", "asktgt \/user:", "harvest \/interval:", "s4u \/user:", "s4u \/ticket:", "hash \/password:", "golden \/aes256:", "silver \/user:"])

query: where(process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("SecurityXploded") OR process.exe_path=/.*PasswordDump\.exe$/i OR process.name=/.*PasswordDump\.exe$/i)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SelectMyParent\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["PPID-spoof", "ppid_spoof", "spoof-ppid", "spoof_ppid", "ppidspoof", "spoofppid", "spoofedppid", " -spawnto "] OR process.name ICONTAINS-ANY ["PPID-spoof", "ppid_spoof", "spoof-ppid", "spoof_ppid", "ppidspoof", "spoofppid", "spoofedppid"] OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("SelectMyParent") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=04D974875BD225F00902B4CAD9AF3FBC", "IMPHASH=A782AF154C9E743DDF3F3EB2B8F3D16E", "IMPHASH=89059503D7FBF470E68F7E63313DA3AD", "IMPHASH=CA28337632625C8281AB8A130B3D6BAD"])

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpChisel\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("SharpChisel"))
description: HackTool - SharpChisel Execution: Detects usage of the Sharp Chisel via the commandline arguments

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpDPAPI\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SharpDPAPI.exe") OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" backupkey ", " blob ", " certificates ", " credentials ", " keepass ", " masterkeys ", " rdg ", " vaults "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" {", "}:"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /file:", " \/machine", " \/mkfile:", " \/password:", " \/pvk:", " \/server:", " \/target:", " \/unprotect"]))

HackTool - SharpDPAPI Execution: Detects the execution of the SharpDPAPI tool based on CommandLine flags and PE metadata.
SharpDPAPI is a C# port of some DPAPI functionality from the Mimikatz project.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpImpersonation\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SharpImpersonation.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" user:", " binary:"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" user:", " shellcode:"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" technique:CreateProcessAsUserW", " technique:ImpersonateLoggedOnuser"])
description: HackTool - SharpImpersonation Execution: Detects execution of the SharpImpersonation tool. Which can be used to manipulate tokens on a Windows computers remotely (PsExec/WmiExec) or interactively

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpLDAPmonitor\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SharpLDAPmonitor.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/user:", "/pass:", "/dcip:"])
description: HackTool - SharpLDAPmonitor Execution: Detects execution of the SharpLDAPmonitor. Which can monitor the creation, deletion and changes to LDAP objects.
