query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharPersist\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("SharPersist") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -t schtask -c ", " -t startupfolder -c "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -t reg -c ", " -m add"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -t service -c ", " -m add"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -t schtask -c ", " -m add"])
description: HackTool - SharPersist Execution: Detects the execution of the hacktool SharPersist - used to deploy various different kinds of persistence mechanisms

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpEvtMute\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("SharpEvtMute") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['--Filter "rule ', '--Encoded --Filter \"'])
description: HackTool - SharpEvtMute Execution: Detects the use of SharpEvtHook, a tool that tampers with the Windows event logs

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpLdapWhoami\.exe$/i OR process.name ICONTAINS "SharpLdapWhoami" OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("SharpLdapWhoami") OR process.cmd_line=/(.*\ \/method:ntlm$|.*\ \/method:kerb$|.*\ \/method:nego$|.*\ \/m:nego$|.*\ \/m:ntlm$|.*\ \/m:kerb$)/i)
description: HackTool - SharpLdapWhoami Execution: Detects SharpLdapWhoami, a whoami alternative that queries the LDAP service on a domain controller

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpMove\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SharpMove.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "computername=" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["action=create", "action=dcom", "action=executevbs", "action=hijackdcom", "action=modschtask", "action=modsvc", "action=query", "action=scm", "action=startservice", "action=taskscheduler"]))
description: HackTool - SharpMove Tool Execution: Detects the execution of SharpMove, a .NET utility performing multiple tasks such as "Task Creation", "SCM" query, VBScript execution using WMI via its PE metadata and command line options.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpSuccessor\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SharpSuccessor.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SharpSuccessor" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", " /impersonate", " \/path", " \/account", " \/name"])
description:
HKTL - SharpSuccessor Privilege Escalation Tool Execution: Detects the execution of SharpSuccessor, a tool used to exploit the BadSuccessor attack for privilege escalation in WinServer 2025 Active Directory environments.
Successful usage of this tool can let the attackers gain the domain admin privileges by exploiting the BadSuccessor vulnerability.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpUp\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("SharpUp") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["HijackablePaths", "UnquotedServicePath", "ProcessDLLHijack", "ModifiableServiceBinaries", "ModifiableScheduledTask", "DomainGPPPassword", "CachedGPPPassword"])
description: HackTool - SharpUp PrivEsc Tool Execution: Detects the use of SharpUp, a tool for local privilege escalation

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("SharpView.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\SharpView\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Add-RemoteConnection", "Convert-ADName", "ConvertFrom-SID", "ConvertFrom-UACValue", "Convert-SidToName", "Export-PowerViewCSV", "Find-DomainObjectPropertyOutlier", "Find-DomainProcess", "Find-DomainShare", "Find-DomainUserEvent", "Find-DomainUserLocation", "Find-ForeignGroup", "Find-ForeignUser", "Find-GPOComputerAdmin", "Find-GPOLocation", "Find-Interesting", "Find-LocalAdminAccess", "Find-ManagedSecurityGroups", "Get-CachedRDPConnection", "Get-DFSshare", "Get-DomainComputer", "Get-DomainController", "Get-DomainDFSShare", "Get-DomainDNSRecord", "Get-DomainFileServer", "Get-DomainForeign", "Get-DomainGPO", "Get-DomainGroup", "Get-DomainGUIDMap", "Get-DomainManagedSecurityGroup", "Get-DomainObject", "Get-DomainOU", "Get-DomainPolicy", "Get-DomainSID", "Get-DomainSite", "Get-DomainSPNTicket", "Get-DomainSubnet", "Get-DomainTrust", "Get-DomainUserEvent", "Get-ForestDomain", "Get-ForestGlobalCatalog", "Get-ForestTrust", "Get-GptTmpl", "Get-GroupsXML", "Get-LastLoggedOn", "Get-LoggedOnLocal", "Get-NetComputer", "Get-NetDomain", "Get-NetFileServer", "Get-NetForest", "Get-NetGPO", "Get-NetGroupMember", "Get-NetLocalGroup", "Get-NetLoggedon", "Get-NetOU", "Get-NetProcess", "Get-NetRDPSession", "Get-NetSession", "Get-NetShare", "Get-NetSite", "Get-NetSubnet", "Get-NetUser", "Get-PathAcl", "Get-PrincipalContext", "Get-RegistryMountedDrive", "Get-RegLoggedOn", "Get-WMIRegCachedRDPConnection", "Get-WMIRegLastLoggedOn", "Get-WMIRegMountedDrive", "Get-WMIRegProxy", "Invoke-ACLScanner", "Invoke-CheckLocalAdminAccess", "Invoke-Kerberoast", "Invoke-MapDomainTrust", "Invoke-RevertToSelf", "Invoke-Sharefinder", "Invoke-UserImpersonation", "Remove-DomainObjectAcl", "Remove-RemoteConnection", "Request-SPNTicket", "Set-DomainObject", "Test-AdminAccess"])
description: HackTool - SharpView Execution: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -Inject " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -PayloadArgs ", " -PayloadFile "]) OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" approve ", " create ", " check ", " delete "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /payload:", " \/payload=", " \/updateid:", " \/updateid="]))
description:
HackTool - SharpWSUS/WSUSpendu Execution: Detects the execution of SharpWSUS or WSUSpendu, utilities that allow for lateral movement through WSUS.
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is a critical component of Windows systems and is frequently configured in a way that allows an attacker to circumvent internal networking limitations.

query: where(process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "st2stager")
description: HackTool - SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use via PE metadata

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-NoExit -Command [Console]::OutputEncoding=[Text.UTF8Encoding]::UTF8")
description: HackTool - Sliver C2 Implant Activity Pattern: Detects process activity patterns as seen being used by Sliver C2 framework implants

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" --buildcache ", " --bhdump ", " --certdump ", " --dnsdump "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -c ", " --cachefilename ", " -o ", " --outputdirectory"]))
description: HackTool - SOAPHound Execution: Detects the execution of SOAPHound, a .NET tool for collecting Active Directory data, using specific command-line arguments that may indicate an attempt to extract sensitive AD information.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Stracciatella\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Stracciatella.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Stracciatella") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["SHA256=9d25e61ec1527e2a69d7c2a4e3fe2fe15890710c198a66a9f25d99fdf6c7b956", "SHA256=fd16609bd9830c63b9413671678bb159b89c357d21942ddbb6b93add808d121a"])
description: HackTool - Stracciatella Execution: Detects Stracciatella which executes a Powershell runspace from within C# (aka SharpPick technique) with AMSI, ETW and Script Block Logging disabled based on PE metadata characteristics.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SysmonEOP\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=22F4089EB8ABA31E1BB162C6D9BF72E5", "IMPHASH=5123FA4C4384D431CD0D893EEB49BBEC"])
description: HackTool - SysmonEOP Execution: Detects the execution of the PoC that can be used to exploit Sysmon CVE-2022-41120

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("TruffleSnout.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\TruffleSnout\.exe$/i)
description: HackTool - TruffleSnout Execution: Detects the use of TruffleSnout.exe an iterative AD discovery toolkit for offensive operators, situational awareness and targeted low noise enumeration.

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("UACMe") OR process.exe_file.author IIN ["REvol Corp", "APT 92", "UG North", "Hazardous Environments", "CD Project Rekt"] OR process.exe_file.description IIN ["UACMe main module", "Pentesting utility"] OR process.name IIN ["Akagi.exe", "Akagi64.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\Akagi64\.exe$|.*\\Akagi\.exe$)/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=767637C23BB42CD5D7397CF58B0BE688", "IMPHASH=14C4E4C72BA075E9069EE67F39188AD8", "IMPHASH=3C782813D4AFCE07BBFC5A9772ACDBDC", "IMPHASH=7D010C6BB6A3726F327F7E239166D127", "IMPHASH=89159BA4DD04E4CE5559F132A9964EB3", "IMPHASH=6F33F4A5FC42B8CEC7314947BD13F30F", "IMPHASH=5834ED4291BDEB928270428EBBAF7604", "IMPHASH=5A8A8A43F25485E7EE1B201EDCBC7A38", "IMPHASH=DC7D30B90B2D8ABF664FBED2B1B59894", "IMPHASH=41923EA1F824FE63EA5BEB84DB7A3E74", "IMPHASH=3DE09703C8E79ED2CA3F01074719906B"])
description: HackTool - UACMe Akagi Execution: Detects the execution of UACMe, a tool used for UAC bypasses, via default PE metadata

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\WCE\.exe$|.*\\WCE64\.exe$)/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=136F0A8572C058A96436C82E541E4C41", "IMPHASH=589657C64DDE88533186C39F82FA1F50", "IMPHASH=6BFE09EFCB4FFDE061EBDBAFC4DB84CF", "IMPHASH=7D490037BF450877E6D0287BDCFF8D2E", "IMPHASH=8AB93B061287C79F3088C5BC7E7D97ED", "IMPHASH=A53A02B997935FD8EEDCB5F7ABAB9B9F", "IMPHASH=BA434A7A729EEC20E136CA4C32D6C740", "IMPHASH=BD1D1547DA13C0FCB6C15E86217D5EB8", "IMPHASH=E96A73C7BF33A464C510EDE582318BF2"])
description:
HackTool - Windows Credential Editor (WCE) Execution: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE), a popular post-exploitation tool used to extract plaintext passwords, hash, PIN code and Kerberos tickets from memory.
It is often used by threat actors for credential dumping and lateral movement within compromised networks.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("winPEAS.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\winPEASany_ofs\.exe$|.*\\winPEASany\.exe$|.*\\winPEASx64_ofs\.exe$|.*\\winPEASx64\.exe$|.*\\winPEASx86_ofs\.exe$|.*\\winPEASx86\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" applicationsinfo", " browserinfo", " eventsinfo", " fileanalysis", " filesinfo", " processinfo", " servicesinfo", " windowscreds"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "https://github.com/carlospolop/PEASS-ng/releases/latest/download/" OR parent_process.cmd_line=/.*\ \-linpeas$/i OR process.cmd_line=/.*\ \-linpeas$/i)
description: HackTool - winPEAS Execution: WinPEAS is a script that search for possible paths to escalate privileges on Windows hosts. The checks are explained on book.hacktricks.xyz

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Offline_Winpwn", "WinPwn ", "WinPwn.exe", "WinPwn.ps1"])
description: HackTool - WinPwn Execution: Detects commandline keywords indicative of potential usge of the tool WinPwn. A tool for Windows and Active Directory reconnaissance and exploitation.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-NoP -NoL -sta -NonI -W Hidden -Exec Bypass -Enc")
description: HackTool - Wmiexec Default Powershell Command: Detects the execution of PowerShell with a specific flag sequence that is used by the Wmiexec script

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\wsass\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS "IMPHASH=32F5095C9BBDCACF28FD4060EB4DFC42" OR process.cmd_line=/(?i)\.exe[\"\']?\s+.{12,64}[\"\']?\s+\d{2,10}/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "werfaultsecure")
description:
HackTool - WSASS Execution: Detects execution of WSASS, a tool used to dump LSASS memory on Windows systems by leveraging WER's
(Windows Error Reporting) WerFaultSecure.EXE to bypass PPL (Protected Process Light) protections.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\xordump\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -process lsass.exe ", " -m comsvcs ", " -m dbghelp ", " -m dbgcore "])
description: HackTool - XORDump Execution: Detects suspicious use of XORDump process memory dumping utility

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/generic:Microsoft_Windows_Shell_ZipFolder:filename=", ".zip", "/pass:", "/user:"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/delete", "Microsoft_Windows_Shell_ZipFolder:filename=", ".zip"])
description: Suspicious ZipExec Execution: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\HOSTNAME\.EXE$/i)
description: Suspicious Execution of Hostname: Use of hostname to get information

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "reg.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["add ", "New-ItemProperty ", "Set-ItemProperty ", "si "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\DeviceGuard" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["EnableVirtualizationBasedSecurity", "HypervisorEnforcedCodeIntegrity"]))
description:
Hypervisor-protected Code Integrity (HVCI) Related Registry Tampering Via CommandLine: Detects the tampering of Hypervisor-protected Code Integrity (HVCI) related registry values via command line tool reg.exe.
HVCI uses virtualization-based security to protect code integrity by ensuring that only trusted code can run in kernel mode.
Adversaries may tamper with HVCI to load malicious or unsigned drivers, which can be used to escalate privileges, maintain persistence, or evade security mechanisms.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Hwp\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\gbb\.exe$/i)
description: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\hxtsr\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\program files\windowsapps\microsoft.windowscommunicationsapps_" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\hxtsr\.exe$/i))
description:
Potential Fake Instance Of Hxtsr.EXE Executed: HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications.
HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden "WindowsApps" subfolder of "C:\Program Files".
Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("iCACLS.EXE") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\icacls\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/deny", "S-1-1-0:"])
description: Use Icacls to Hide File to Everyone: Detect use of icacls to deny access for everyone in Users folder sometimes used to hide malicious files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\IEExec\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("IEExec.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://"]))
description: File Download And Execution Via IEExec.EXE: Detects execution of the IEExec utility to download and execute files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\iexpress\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("IEXPRESS.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•n ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\"]))
description:
Self Extracting Package Creation Via Iexpress.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Location: Detects the use of iexpress.exe to create binaries via Self Extraction Directive (SED) files located in potentially suspicious locations.
This behavior has been observed in-the-wild by different threat actors.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\appcmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("appcmd.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["set", "config", "section:httplogging", "dontLog:true"])
description: Disable Windows IIS HTTP Logging: Disables HTTP logging on a Windows IIS web server as seen by Threat Group 3390 (Bronze Union)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\appcmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("appcmd.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "list " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /config", " \/xml", " -config", " -xml"] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" \/@t", " \/text", " \/show", " -@t", " -text", " -show"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\\", "password"])))
description: Microsoft IIS Service Account Password Dumped: Detects the Internet Information Services (IIS) command-line tool, AppCmd, being used to list passwords

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\appcmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("appcmd.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["install", "module"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-name:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/name:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“name:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”name:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•name:") AND NOT parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\inetsrv\iissetup.exe"))
description: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\appcmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("appcmd.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["set", "config", "section:system.webServer/rewrite/globalRules", "commit:"])
description: Suspicious IIS URL GlobalRules Rewrite Via AppCmd: Detects usage of "appcmd" to create new global URL rewrite rules. This behaviour has been observed being used by threat actors to add new rules so they can access their webshells.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\aspnet_regiis\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("aspnet_regiis.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["connectionStrings", " -pdf"])
description: Microsoft IIS Connection Strings Decryption: Detects use of aspnet_regiis to decrypt Microsoft IIS connection strings. An attacker with Microsoft IIS web server access via a webshell or alike can decrypt and dump any hardcoded connection strings, such as the MSSQL service account password using aspnet_regiis command.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["cmd.exe", "powershell.exe", "powershell_ise.exe", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["del ", "erase ", "rm ", "remove-item ", "rmdir "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\inetpub\logs\\")
description:
IIS WebServer Log Deletion via CommandLine Utilities: Detects attempts to delete Internet Information Services (IIS) log files via command line utilities, which is a common defense evasion technique used by attackers to cover their tracks.
Threat actors often abuse vulnerabilities in web applications hosted on IIS servers to gain initial access and later delete IIS logs to evade detection.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\w3wp\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "appcmd.exe add module" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " system.enterpriseservices.internal.publish" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["gacutil", " /I"]))
description: Suspicious IIS Module Registration: Detects a suspicious IIS module registration as described in Microsoft threat report on IIS backdoors

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ilasm\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ilasm.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /dll", " \/exe"]))
description: C# IL Code Compilation Via Ilasm.EXE: Detects the use of "Ilasm.EXE" in order to compile C# intermediate (IL) code to EXE or DLL.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\WmiPrvSE\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\ImagingDevices\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\ImagingDevices\.exe$/i)
description: ImagingDevices Unusual Parent/Child Processes: Detects unusual parent or children of the ImagingDevices.exe (Windows Contacts) process as seen being used with Bumblebee activity

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\IMEWDBLD\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("imewdbld.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://"]))
description: Arbitrary File Download Via IMEWDBLD.EXE: Detects usage of "IMEWDBLD.exe" to download arbitrary files

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["InfDefaultInstall.exe ", ".inf"])
description: InfDefaultInstall.exe .inf Execution: Executes SCT script using scrobj.dll from a command in entered into a specially prepared INF file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\InstallUtil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("InstallUtil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp://", "http://", "https://"]))
description: File Download Via InstallUtil.EXE: Detects use of .NET InstallUtil.exe in order to download arbitrary files. The files will be written to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE\"

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\InstallUtil\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path ICONTAINS "Microsoft.NET\Framework" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/logfile= ", "/LogToConsole=false"])
description: Suspicious Execution of InstallUtil Without Log: Uses the .NET InstallUtil.exe application in order to execute image without log

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\keytool\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\hh\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\systeminfo\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\query\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Shells Spawn by Java Utility Keytool: Detects suspicious shell spawn from Java utility keytool process (e.g. adselfservice plus exploitation)

query: where(parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["\ManageEngine\ServiceDesk\\", "\java.exe"] AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\query\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\systeminfo\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND NOT ((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " stop"))
description: Suspicious Child Process Of Manage Engine ServiceDesk: Detects suspicious child processes of the "Manage Engine ServiceDesk Plus" Java web service

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "transport=dt_socket,address=" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["jre1.", "jdk1."]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["address=127.0.0.1", "address=localhost"]))
description: Java Running with Remote Debugging: Detects a JAVA process running with remote debugging allowing more than just localhost to connect

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\java\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\hh\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\query\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\systeminfo\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Processes Spawned by Java.EXE: Detects suspicious processes spawned from a Java host process which could indicate a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j)

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\java\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "build" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "build"))
description: Shell Process Spawned by Java.EXE: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\java\.exe$|.*\\javaw\.exe$)/i) AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SysAidServer")
description: Suspicious SysAidServer Child: Detects suspicious child processes of SysAidServer (as seen in MERCURY threat actor intrusions)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\jsc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("jsc.exe"))
description:
JScript Compiler Execution: Detects the execution of the "jsc.exe" (JScript Compiler).
Attacker might abuse this in order to compile JScript files on the fly and bypassing application whitelisting.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " run run-cmd " AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cleanapi\.exe$|.*\\kavremover\.exe$)/i))
description: Kavremover Dropped Binary LOLBIN Usage: Detects the execution of a signed binary dropped by Kaspersky Lab Products Remover (kavremover) which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary commands and binaries.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\kd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("kd.exe"))
description: Windows Kernel Debugger Execution: Detects execution of the Windows Kernel Debugger "kd.exe".

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["UWhRCA", "BAAAA"])
description:
Attempts of Kerberos Coercion Via DNS SPN Spoofing: Detects the presence of "UWhRC....AAYBAAAA" pattern in command line.
The pattern "1UWhRCAAAAA..BAAAA" is a base64-encoded signature that corresponds to a marshaled CREDENTIAL_TARGET_INFORMATION structure.
Attackers can use this technique to coerce authentication from victim systems to attacker-controlled hosts.
It is one of the strong indicators of a Kerberos coercion attack, where adversaries manipulate DNS records
to spoof Service Principal Names (SPNs) and redirect authentication requests like in CVE-2025-33073.
If you see this pattern in the command line, it is likely an attempt to add spoofed Service Principal Names (SPNs) to DNS records,
or checking for the presence of such records through the `nslookup` command.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\KeyScrambler\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "cscript.exe", "mshta.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "regsvr32.exe", "RUNDLL32.EXE", "wscript.exe"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Child Process of KeyScrambler.exe: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of KeyScrambler.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ksetup\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ksetup.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /setcomputerpassword ")
description: Computer Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE: Detects password change for the computer's domain account or host principal via "ksetup.exe"

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ksetup\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ksetup.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /ChangePassword ")
description: Logged-On User Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE: Detects password change for the logged-on user's via "ksetup.exe"

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ldifde\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ldifde.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-f" AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -i")
description: Active Directory Structure Export Via Ldifde.EXE: Detects the execution of "ldifde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ldifde\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ldifde.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-i", "-f"])
description: Import LDAP Data Interchange Format File Via Ldifde.EXE: Detects the execution of "Ldifde.exe" with the import flag "-i". The can be abused to include HTTP-based arguments which will allow the arbitrary download of files from a remote server.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\link\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "LINK /" AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Microsoft Visual Studio\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio\\"]) AND (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\VC\bin\\", "\VC\Tools\\"])))
description:
Uncommon Link.EXE Parent Process: Detects an uncommon parent process of "LINK.EXE".
Link.EXE in Microsoft incremental linker. Its a utility usually bundled with Visual Studio installation.
Multiple utilities often found in the same folder (editbin.exe, dumpbin.exe, lib.exe, etc) have a hardcode call to the "LINK.EXE" binary without checking its validity.
This would allow an attacker to sideload any binary with the name "link.exe" if one of the aforementioned tools get executed from a different location.
By filtering the known locations of such utilities we can spot uncommon parent process of LINK.EXE that might be suspicious or malicious.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\lodctr\.exe$/i AND process.name = NOCASE("LODCTR.EXE") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”r" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•r"))
description: Rebuild Performance Counter Values Via Lodctr.EXE: Detects the execution of "lodctr.exe" to rebuild the performance counter registry values. This can be abused by attackers by providing a malicious config file to overwrite performance counter configuration to confuse and evade monitoring and security solutions.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\logman\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Logman.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["stop ", "delete "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Circular Kernel Context Logger", "EventLog-", "SYSMON TRACE", "SysmonDnsEtwSession"]))
description: Suspicious Windows Trace ETW Session Tamper Via Logman.EXE: Detects the execution of "logman" utility in order to disable or delete Windows trace sessions

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/in:", "/out:", "/uri:"]) AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\DataSvcUtil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("DataSvcUtil.exe")))
description: LOLBAS Data Exfiltration by DataSvcUtil.exe: Detects when a user performs data exfiltration by using DataSvcUtil.exe

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\devtoolslauncher\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "LaunchForDeploy")
description: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["diantz.exe", ".cab"] AND process.cmd_line=/:[^\\]/i)
description: Suspicious Diantz Alternate Data Stream Execution: Compress target file into a cab file stored in the Alternate Data Stream (ADS) of the target file.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["diantz.exe", " \\", ".cab"])
description: Suspicious Diantz Download and Compress Into a CAB File: Download and compress a remote file and store it in a cab file on local machine.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "extrac32.exe" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\extrac32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("extrac32.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".cab" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/C", "/Y", " \\"]))
description: Suspicious Extrac32 Execution: Download or Copy file with Extrac32

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["extrac32.exe", ".cab"] AND process.cmd_line=/:[^\\]/i)
description: Suspicious Extrac32 Alternate Data Stream Execution: Extract data from cab file and hide it in an alternate data stream

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["cscript.exe", "wscript.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "gatherNetworkInfo.vbs")
description: Potential Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\gpscript\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("GPSCRIPT.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /logon", " \/startup"]) AND NOT parent_process.cmd_line = NOCASE("C:\windows\system32\svchost.exe -k netsvcs -p -s gpsvc"))
description: Gpscript Execution: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN gpscript, which executes logon or startup scripts configured in Group Policy

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Launch-VsDevShell.ps1" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VsWherePath ", "VsInstallationPath "]))
description: Launch-VsDevShell.PS1 Proxy Execution: Detects the use of the 'Launch-VsDevShell.ps1' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\wscript\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wscript.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "manage-bde.wsf" OR (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "manage-bde.wsf" AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i)
description: Potential Manage-bde.wsf Abuse To Proxy Execution: Detects potential abuse of the "manage-bde.wsf" script as a LOLBIN to proxy execution

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /INJECTRUNNING " AND NOT parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\AppVClient.exe"))
description: Mavinject Inject DLL Into Running Process: Detects process injection using the signed Windows tool "Mavinject" via the "INJECTRUNNING" flag

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mpiexec\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS "IMPHASH=d8b52ef6aaa3a81501bdfff9dbb96217") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /n 1 ", " -n 1 "]))
description: MpiExec Lolbin: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by mpiexec.exe LOLBIN from HPC pack that can be used to execute any other binary

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["verb:sync", "-source:RunCommand", "-dest:runCommand"] AND process.exe_path=/.*\\msdeploy\.exe$/i)
description: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("OpenConsole.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\OpenConsole\.exe$/i) AND NOT process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.WindowsTerminal")
description: Use of OpenConsole: Detects usage of OpenConsole binary as a LOLBIN to launch other binaries to bypass application Whitelisting

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\OpenWith\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/c")
description: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\pcalua\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -a")
description: Use of Pcalua For Execution: Detects execition of commands and binaries from the context of The program compatibility assistant (Pcalua.exe). This can be used as a LOLBIN in order to bypass application whitelisting.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\pcwrun\.exe$/i)
description: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\pcwrun\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "../")
description: Execute Pcwrun.EXE To Leverage Follina: Detects indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant "pcwrun.exe" leveraging the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["pcwutl", "LaunchApplication"])
description: Code Execution via Pcwutl.dll: Detects launch of executable by calling the LaunchApplication function from pcwutl.dll library.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\Pester\\" AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["{ Invoke-Pester -EnableExit ;", '{ Get-Help "']))
description: Execute Code with Pester.bat as Parent: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Pester", "Get-Help"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["pester", ";"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["help", "\?"]))
description: Execute Code with Pester.bat: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\PrintBrm\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -f", ".zip"])
description: PrintBrm ZIP Creation of Extraction: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN PrintBrm.exe, which can be used to create or extract ZIP files. PrintBrm.exe should not be run on a normal workstation.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\pubprn.vbs", "script:"])
description: Pubprn.vbs Proxy Execution: Detects the use of the 'Pubprn.vbs' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rasautou\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("rasdlui.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -d ", " -p "])
description: DLL Execution via Rasautou.exe: Detects using Rasautou.exe for loading arbitrary .DLL specified in -d option and executes the export specified in -p.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\register_app.vbs", "-register"])
description: REGISTER_APP.VBS Proxy Execution: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script 'REGISTER_APP.VBS' to register a VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\remote\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("remote.exe"))
description: Use of Remote.exe: Remote.exe is part of WinDbg in the Windows SDK and can be used for AWL bypass and running remote files.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\replace\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•a"))
description: Replace.exe Usage: Detects the use of Replace.exe which can be used to replace file with another file

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\runexehelper\.exe$/i)
description: Lolbin Runexehelper Use As Proxy: Detect usage of the "runexehelper.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Runscripthelper\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "surfacecheck")
description: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ScriptRunner\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ScriptRunner.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -appvscript ")
description: Use of Scriptrunner.exe: The "ScriptRunner.exe" binary can be abused to proxy execution through it and bypass possible whitelisting

query: where(NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Windows\System32\\", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\\"]) AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cmd.exe /c", "RoamDiag.cmd", "-outputpath"])
description: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sftp\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -D ..", " -D C:\\"]))
description: Use Of The SFTP.EXE Binary As A LOLBIN: Detects the usage of the "sftp.exe" binary as a LOLBIN by abusing the "-D" flag

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-i", "/install", "-a", "/add-driver", ".inf"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\pnputil\.exe$/i)
description: Suspicious Driver Install by pnputil.exe: Detects when a possible suspicious driver is being installed via pnputil.exe lolbin

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["grpconv.exe -o", "grpconv -o"])
description: Suspicious GrpConv Execution: Detects the suspicious execution of a utility to convert Windows 3.x .grp files or for persistence purposes by malicious software or actors

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sqldumper\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["0x0110", "0x01100:40"]))
description: Dumping Process via Sqldumper.exe: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\SyncAppvPublishingServer\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("syncappvpublishingserver.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '"n; ')
description: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs", ";"])
description: SyncAppvPublishingServer VBS Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\tracker\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Tracker")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /d ", " \/c "]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/ERRORREPORT:PROMPT " OR parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\Msbuild\\Current\\Bin\\MSBuild\.exe$|.*\\Msbuild\\Current\\Bin\\amd64\\MSBuild\.exe$)/i))
description: Potential DLL Injection Or Execution Using Tracker.exe: Detects potential DLL injection and execution using "Tracker.exe"

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*ttdinject\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("TTDInject.EXE"))
description: Use of TTDInject.exe: Detects the executiob of TTDInject.exe, which is used by Windows 10 v1809 and newer to debug time travel (underlying call of tttracer.exe)

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\tttracer\.exe$/i)
description: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\unregmp2\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("unregmp2.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -HideWMP" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /HideWMP" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“HideWMP" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”HideWMP" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•HideWMP"))
description: Lolbin Unregmp2.exe Use As Proxy: Detect usage of the "unregmp2.exe" binary as a proxy to launch a custom version of "wmpnscfg.exe"

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["UtilityFunctions.ps1", "RegSnapin "])
description: UtilityFunctions.ps1 Proxy Dll: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script executing a managed DLL with PowerShell.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\vbc\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\cvtres\.exe$/i)
description: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\VisualUiaVerifyNative\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe"))
description: Use of VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe: VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe is a Windows SDK that can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\VSIISExeLauncher\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("VSIISExeLauncher.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -p ", " -a "]))
description: Use of VSIISExeLauncher.exe: The "VSIISExeLauncher.exe" binary part of the Visual Studio/VS Code can be used to execute arbitrary binaries

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\wfc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wfc.exe"))
description: Use of Wfc.exe: The Workflow Command-line Compiler can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["cscript.exe", "wscript.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".vbs -register ")
description: Potential Register_App.Vbs LOLScript Abuse: Detects potential abuse of the "register_app.vbs" script that is part of the Windows SDK. The script offers the capability to register new VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application. Attackers can use this to install malicious DLLs for persistence and execution.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Windows\\System32\\lsass\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\Windows\\System32\\lsass\.exe$/i)
description: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS Process Clone: Detects a suspicious LSASS process process clone that could be a sign of credential dumping activity

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\mftrace\.exe$/i)
description: Potential Mftrace.EXE Abuse: Detects child processes of the "Trace log generation tool for Media Foundation Tools" (Mftrace.exe) which can abused to execute arbitrary binaries.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mmc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MMC.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["gpme.msc", "gpobject:"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["31B2F340-016D-11D2-945F-00C04FB984F9", "6AC1786C-016F-11D2-945F-00C04FB984F9"]))
description:
Windows Default Domain GPO Modification via GPME: Detects the use of the Group Policy Management Editor (GPME) to modify Default Domain or Default Domain Controllers Group Policy Objects (GPOs).
Adversaries may leverage GPME to make stealthy changes in these default GPOs to deploy malicious GPOs configurations across the domain without raising suspicion.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\mmc\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-Embedding")
description: MMC20 Lateral Movement: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of "-Embedding" as a child of svchost.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mmc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MMC.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cod.msc", "fdp.msc", "ftr.msc", "lmth.msc", "slx.msc", "tdo.msc", "xcod.msc", "xslx.msc", "xtpp.msc"]))
description: MMC Executing Files with Reversed Extensions Using RTLO Abuse: Detects malicious behavior where the MMC utility (`mmc.exe`) executes files with reversed extensions caused by Right-to-Left Override (RLO) abuse, disguising them as document formats.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\mmc\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\BITSADMIN"))
description: MMC Spawning Windows Shell: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mode\.com$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MODE.COM")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" con ", " cp ", " select="] AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*=1251$|.*=866$)/i))
description:
CodePage Modification Via MODE.COM To Russian Language: Detects a CodePage modification using the "mode.com" utility to Russian language.
This behavior has been used by threat actors behind Dharma ransomware.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mofcomp\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mofcomp.exe")) AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp", "\Users\Public\\", "\WINDOWS\Temp\\", "%temp%", "%tmp%", "%appdata%"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\wbem\WmiPrvSE.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\Windows\TEMP\\" AND process.cmd_line=/.*\.mof$/i) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\Windows\TEMP\\" AND process.cmd_line=/.*\.mof$/i))
description:
Potential Suspicious Mofcomp Execution: Detects execution of the "mofcomp" utility as a child of a suspicious shell or script running utility or by having a suspicious path in the commandline.
The "mofcomp" utility parses a file containing MOF statements and adds the classes and class instances defined in the file to the WMI repository.
Attackers abuse this utility to install malicious MOF scripts

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\MpCmdRun\.exe$|.*\\NisSrv\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Defender\\", "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Security Client\\", "C:\Program Files\Windows Defender\\", "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Platform\\", "C:\Windows\WinSxS\\"]))
description: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via Defender Binaries: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("MpCmdRun.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\MpCmdRun\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "MpCmdRun.exe" OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Microsoft Malware Protection Command Line Utility")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["DownloadFile", "url"])
description: File Download Via Windows Defender MpCmpRun.EXE: Detects the use of Windows Defender MpCmdRun.EXE to download files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\MpCmdRun\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MpCmdRun.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -RemoveDefinitions", " -All"])
description: Windows Defender Definition Files Removed: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\MSBuild\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSBuild.exe")) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\devenv\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\msbuild\.exe$|.*\\python\.exe$|.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\nuget\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Msbuild Execution By Uncommon Parent Process: Detects suspicious execution of 'Msbuild.exe' by a uncommon parent process

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\msdt\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\WINDOWS\diagnostics\index\PCWDiagnostic.xml" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•af ") AND NOT parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\pcwrun\.exe$/i)
description: MSDT Execution Via Answer File: Detects execution of "msdt.exe" using an answer file which is simulating the legitimate way of calling msdt via "pcwrun.exe" (For example from the compatibility tab).

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msdt\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("msdt.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "IT_BrowseForFile=" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " PCWDiagnostic" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”af " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•af ")))
description: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Using Msdt.EXE: Detects processes leveraging the "ms-msdt" handler or the "msdt.exe" binary to execute arbitrary commands as seen in the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msdt\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("msdt.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -cab " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /cab " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“cab " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”cab " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•cab "))
description: Suspicious Cabinet File Execution Via Msdt.EXE: Detects execution of msdt.exe using the "cab" flag which could indicates suspicious diagcab files with embedded answer files leveraging CVE-2022-30190

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\msdt\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("msdt.exe")))
description: Suspicious MSDT Parent Process: Detects msdt.exe executed by a suspicious parent as seen in CVE-2022-30190 / Follina exploitation

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msedge_proxy\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("msedge_proxy.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://"]))
description: Arbitrary File Download Via MSEDGE_PROXY.EXE: Detects usage of "msedge_proxy.exe" to download arbitrary files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSHTA.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://", "ftp://"]))
description: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE: Detects execution of the "mshta" utility with an argument containing the "http" keyword, which could indicate that an attacker is executing a remotely hosted malicious hta file

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Wscript.", ".Shell", ".Run"])
description: Wscript Shell Run In CommandLine: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSHTA.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "javascript")
description: Suspicious JavaScript Execution Via Mshta.EXE: Detects execution of javascript code using "mshta.exe".

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i)
description: Potential LethalHTA Technique Execution: Detects potential LethalHTA technique where the "mshta.exe" is spawned by an "svchost.exe" process

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "wscript.exe", "cscript.exe", "Bash.exe", "reg.exe", "REGSVR32.EXE", "bitsadmin.exe"]))
description: Suspicious MSHTA Child Process: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an "mshta.exe" process, which could be indicative of a malicious HTA script execution

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mshta.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".7z", ".avi", ".bat", ".bmp", ".conf", ".csv", ".dll", ".doc", ".gif", ".gz", ".ini", ".jpe", ".jpg", ".json", ".lnk", ".log", ".mkv", ".mp3", ".mp4", ".pdf", ".png", ".ppt", ".rar", ".rtf", ".svg", ".tar", ".tmp", ".txt", ".xls", ".xml", ".yaml", ".yml", ".zip", "vbscript"]))
description:
MSHTA Execution with Suspicious File Extensions: Detects execution of mshta.exe with file types that looks like they do not typically represent HTA (HTML Application) content,
such as .png, .jpg, .zip, .pdf, and others, which are often polyglots. MSHTA is a legitimate Windows utility for executing HTML Applications
containing VBScript or JScript. Threat actors often abuse this lolbin utility to download and
execute malicious scripts disguised as benign files or hosted under misleading extensions to evade detection.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSHTA.EXE")) AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\\", "C:\ProgramData\\", "C:\Users\Public\\", "C:\Windows\Temp\\"]) OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\mshta\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSHTA.EXE")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Windows\System32\\", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".htm", ".hta"] OR process.cmd_line=/(.*mshta\.exe$|.*mshta$)/i))
description: Suspicious Mshta.EXE Execution Patterns: Detects suspicious mshta process execution patterns

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\msiexec.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -z " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /z " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“z " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”z " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•z ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".dll")
description: DllUnregisterServer Function Call Via Msiexec.EXE: Detects MsiExec loading a DLL and calling its DllUnregisterServer function

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$)/i) AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["MsiExec.exe", "-Embedding "] AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*:\\Windows\\System32\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\Program Files\SplunkUniversalForwarder\bin\\" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\DismFoDInstall.cmd" OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\MsiExec.exe -Embedding ", "Global\MSI0000"]))
description: Suspicious MsiExec Embedding Parent: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy the execution of malicious payloads

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -y" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /y" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“y" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”y" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•y") AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['\MsiExec.exe" \/Y "C:\Program Files\Bonjour\mdnsNSP.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" \/Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Bonjour\mdnsNSP.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" \/Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Apple Software Update\ScriptingObjectModel.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" \/Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Apple Software Update\SoftwareUpdateAdmin.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" \/Y "C:\Windows\CCM\\', '\MsiExec.exe" \/Y C:\Windows\CCM\\', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y "C:\Program Files\Bonjour\mdnsNSP.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Bonjour\mdnsNSP.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Apple Software Update\ScriptingObjectModel.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y "C:\Program Files (x86)\Apple Software Update\SoftwareUpdateAdmin.dll', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y "C:\Windows\CCM\\', '\MsiExec.exe" -Y C:\Windows\CCM\\']))
description:
Suspicious Msiexec Execute Arbitrary DLL: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("msiexec.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-i" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/i" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“i" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”i" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•i" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-package" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/package" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“package" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”package" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•package" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•a" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-j" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/j" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“j" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”j" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•j") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”q" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•q") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http", "\\"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\AppData\Local\Temp\OpenOffice", "Installation Files\openoffice"]))
description: Suspicious Msiexec Quiet Install From Remote Location: Detects usage of Msiexec.exe to install packages hosted remotely quietly

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\msiexec.exe")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Windows\System32\\", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\\", "C:\Windows\WinSxS\\"]))
description: Potential MsiExec Masquerading: Detects the execution of msiexec.exe from an uncommon directory

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" msiexec", "://"])
description: MsiExec Web Install: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\AI_STUBS\\AiStubX64Elevated\.exe$|.*\\AI_STUBS\\AiStubX86Elevated\.exe$|.*\\AI_STUBS\\AiStubX64\.exe$|.*\\AI_STUBS\\AiStubX86\.exe$)/i) AND process.name = NOCASE("popupwrapper.exe"))
description:
Windows MSIX Package Support Framework AI_STUBS Execution: Detects execution of Advanced Installer MSIX Package Support Framework (PSF) components, specifically AI_STUBS executables with original filename 'popupwrapper.exe'.
This activity may indicate malicious MSIX packages build with Advanced Installer leveraging the Package Support Framework to bypass application control restrictions.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\MSOHTMED\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MsoHtmEd.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp://", "http://", "https://"]))
description: Arbitrary File Download Via MSOHTMED.EXE: Detects usage of "MSOHTMED" to download arbitrary files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\MSPUB\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("MSPUB.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp://", "http://", "https://"]))
description: Arbitrary File Download Via MSPUB.EXE: Detects usage of "MSPUB" (Microsoft Publisher) to download arbitrary files

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\msra\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line=/.*msra\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\arp\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\netstat\.exe$|.*\\nslookup\.exe$|.*\\route\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$)/i))
description: Potential Process Injection Via Msra.EXE: Detects potential process injection via Microsoft Remote Asssistance (Msra.exe) by looking at suspicious child processes spawned from the aforementioned process. It has been a target used by many threat actors and used for discovery and persistence tactics

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlps\.exe$/i OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlps\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sqlps.exe")) AND NOT parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlagent\.exe$/i)
description:
Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sqltoolsps\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sqltoolsps\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\sqltoolsps.exe")) AND NOT parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\smss\.exe$/i)
description:
SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection: This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlservr\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\netstat\.exe$|.*\\nltest\.exe$|.*\\ping\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\systeminfo\.exe$|.*\\tasklist\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\\" AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*DATEV_DBENGINE\\MSSQL\\Binn\\sqlservr\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe") AND process.cmd_line ISTARTS-WITH '"C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" '))
description: Suspicious Child Process Of SQL Server: Detects suspicious child processes of the SQLServer process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlservr\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "VEEAMSQL" AND ((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$|.*\\wt\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-ex ", "bypass", "cscript", "DownloadString", "http://", "https://", "mshta", "regsvr32", "rundll32", "wscript", "copy "]) OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\netstat\.exe$|.*\\nltest\.exe$|.*\\ping\.exe$|.*\\tasklist\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Child Process Of Veeam Dabatase: Detects suspicious child processes of the Veeam service process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["noconsentprompt", "shadow:"])
description: Potential MSTSC Shadowing Activity: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mstsc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mstsc.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -v:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /v:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“v:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”v:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•v:") AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\lxss\wslhost.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\WSL\wslg.rdp"))
description:
New Remote Desktop Connection Initiated Via Mstsc.EXE: Detects the usage of "mstsc.exe" with the "/v" flag to initiate a connection to a remote server.
Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mstsc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mstsc.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.rdp$|.*\.rdp"$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\lxss\wslhost.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\WSL\wslg.rdp"))
description: Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\mstsc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mstsc.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.rdp$|.*\.rdp"$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\color", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks_Migrated ", ":\Windows\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Tracing\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Downloads\\"]))
description: Suspicious Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\CCleanerBrowser\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\chromium\.exe$|.*\\firefox\.exe$|.*\\iexplore\.exe$|.*\\microsoftedge\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$|.*\\whale\.exe$|.*\\outlook\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\mstsc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("mstsc.exe")))
description: Mstsc.EXE Execution From Uncommon Parent: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\msxsl\.exe$/i)
description:
Msxsl.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of the MSXSL utility. This can be used to execute Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files. These files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files.
Adversaries can abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\msxsl\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http")
description: Remote XSL Execution Via Msxsl.EXE: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" group ", " localgroup "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["domain admins", " administrator", " administrateur", "enterprise admins", "Exchange Trusted Subsystem", "Remote Desktop Users", "Utilisateurs du Bureau Ã  distance", "Usuarios de escritorio remoto", " /do"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/add" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" accounts ", " \/do"]))
description:
Suspicious Group And Account Reconnaissance Activity Using Net.EXE: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using Net.EXE
Check if the user that executed the commands is suspicious (e.g. service accounts, LOCAL_SYSTEM)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["share", "/delete"])
description: Unmount Share Via Net.EXE: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " start ")
description: Start Windows Service Via Net.EXE: Detects the usage of the "net.exe" command to start a service using the "start" flag

query: where((process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " stop ")
description: Stop Windows Service Via Net.EXE: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "net" utility.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" use ", " \\*\*$"])
description: Windows Admin Share Mount Via Net.EXE: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" use ", " http"])
description: Windows Internet Hosted WebDav Share Mount Via Net.EXE: Detects when an internet hosted webdav share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" use ", " \\"]))
description: Windows Share Mount Via Net.EXE: Detects when a share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\ use$|.*\ sessions$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" use ", " sessions "]))
description: System Network Connections Discovery Via Net.EXE: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" use ", ":*\\", "/USER:* "] AND NOT process.cmd_line=/.*\ $/i)
description: Password Provided In Command Line Of Net.EXE: Detects a when net.exe is called with a password in the command line

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["user", "add"])
description: New User Created Via Net.EXE: Identifies the creation of local users via the net.exe command.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["user", "add", "expires:never"])
description: New User Created Via Net.EXE With Never Expire Option: Detects creation of local users via the net.exe command with the option "never expire"

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " user " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" JÃ¤rjestelmÃ¤nvalvoja ", " Rendszergazda ", " ÐÐ´Ð¼Ð¸Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€ ", " Administrateur ", " Administrador ", " AdministratÃ¶r ", " Administrator ", " guest ", " DefaultAccount ", ' "JÃ¤rjestelmÃ¤nvalvoja" ', ' "Rendszergazda" ', ' "ÐÐ´Ð¼Ð¸Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€" ', ' "Administrateur" ', ' "Administrador" ', ' "AdministratÃ¶r" ', ' "Administrator" ', ' "guest" ', ' "DefaultAccount" ', """ 'JÃ¤rjestelmÃ¤nvalvoja' """, """ 'Rendszergazda' """, """ 'ÐÐ´Ð¼Ð¸Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ€' """, """ 'Administrateur' """, """ 'Administrador' """, """ 'AdministratÃ¶r' """, """ 'Administrator' """, """ 'guest' """, """ 'DefaultAccount' """]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["guest", "/active no"]))
description: Suspicious Manipulation Of Default Accounts Via Net.EXE: Detects suspicious manipulations of default accounts such as 'administrator' and 'guest'. For example 'enable' or 'disable' accounts or change the password...etc

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["net.exe", "net1.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "view" AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\\")
description: Share And Session Enumeration Using Net.EXE: Detects attempts to enumerate file shares, printer shares and sessions using "net.exe" with the "view" flag.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" firewall ", " add "] AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['advfirewall firewall add rule name=Dropbox dir=in action=allow "program=?:\Program Files (x86)\Dropbox\Client\Dropbox.exe" enable=yes profile=Any', 'advfirewall firewall add rule name=Dropbox dir=in action=allow "program=?:\Program Files\Dropbox\Client\Dropbox.exe" enable=yes profile=Any']))
description: New Firewall Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["firewall", "add", "allowedprogram"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["advfirewall", "firewall", "add", "rule", "action=allow", "program="]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\$Recycle.bin\\", ":\RECYCLER.BIN\\", ":\RECYCLERS.BIN\\", ":\SystemVolumeInformation\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Default\\", ":\Users\Desktop\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\addins\\", ":\Windows\cursors\\", ":\Windows\debug\\", ":\Windows\drivers\\", ":\Windows\fonts\\", ":\Windows\help\\", ":\Windows\system32\tasks\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Local Settings\Temporary Internet Files\\", "\Temporary Internet Files\Content.Outlook\\", "%Public%\\", "%TEMP%", "%TMP%"]))
description: Suspicious Program Location Whitelisted In Firewall Via Netsh.EXE: Detects Netsh command execution that whitelists a program located in a suspicious location in the Windows Firewall

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["firewall ", "add ", "tcp ", "3389"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["portopening", "allow"]))
description: RDP Connection Allowed Via Netsh.EXE: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["firewall", "delete "] AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Dropbox\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "name=Dropbox" OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\instup\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS 'advfirewall firewall delete rule name="Avast Antivirus Admin Client"'))
description: Firewall Rule Deleted Via Netsh.EXE: Detects the removal of a port or application rule in the Windows Firewall configuration using netsh

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["firewall", "set", "opmode", "disable"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["advfirewall", "set", "state", "off"]))
description: Firewall Disabled via Netsh.EXE: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["advfirewall", "firewall", "set", "rule", "group=", "new", "enable=Yes"])
description: Netsh Allow Group Policy on Microsoft Defender Firewall: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["netsh", "show ", "firewall "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["config ", "state ", "rule ", "name=all"]))
description: Firewall Configuration Discovery Via Netsh.EXE: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" firewall ", " set "])
description: Firewall Rule Update Via Netsh.EXE: Detects execution of netsh with the "advfirewall" and the "set" option in order to set new values for properties of a existing rule

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["add", "helper"])
description: Potential Persistence Via Netsh Helper DLL: Detects the execution of netsh with "add helper" flag in order to add a custom helper DLL. This technique can be abused to add a malicious helper DLL that can be used as a persistence proxy that gets called when netsh.exe is executed.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["trace", "start"])
description: New Network Trace Capture Started Via Netsh.EXE: Detects the execution of netsh with the "trace" flag in order to start a network capture

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["interface", "portproxy", "add", "v4tov4"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["i ", "p ", "a ", "v "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["connectp", "listena", "c="]))
description: New Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE: Detects the execution of netsh commands that configure a new port forwarding (PortProxy) rule

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" i", " p", "=3389", " c"])
description: RDP Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE: Detects the execution of netsh to configure a port forwarding of port 3389 (RDP) rule

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\netsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("netsh.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["wlan", " s", " p", " k", "=clear"])
description: Harvesting Of Wifi Credentials Via Netsh.EXE: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\nltest\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("nltestrk.exe"))
description: Nltest.EXE Execution: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\nltest\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("nltestrk.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["server", "query"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/user", "all_trusts", "dclist:", "dnsgetdc:", "domain_trusts", "dsgetdc:", "parentdomain", "trusted_domains"]))
description: Potential Recon Activity Via Nltest.EXE: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\node\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -e ", " --eval "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [".exec(", "net.socket", ".connect", "child_process"])
description: Potential Arbitrary Code Execution Via Node.EXE: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Adobe\ Creative\ Cloud\ Experience\\libs\\node\.exe$/i AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Adobe Creative Cloud Experience\js")
description: Node Process Executions: Detects the execution of other scripts using the Node executable packaged with Adobe Creative Cloud

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\notepad\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*password\*\.txt$|.*password\*\.csv$|.*password\*\.doc$|.*password\*\.xls$)/i))
description: Notepad Password Files Discovery: Detects the execution of Notepad to open a file that has the string "password" which may indicate unauthorized access to credentials or suspicious activity.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["nslookup", "_ldap._tcp.dc._msdcs."])
description: Network Reconnaissance Activity: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\nslookup.exe" OR process.name = NOCASE("\nslookup.exe")) AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -q=txt ", " -querytype=txt "]))
