description: Nslookup PowerShell Download Cradle - ProcessCreation: Detects suspicious powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ntdsutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ntdsutil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["snapshot", "mount "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ac", " i", " ntds"]))
description: Suspicious Usage Of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe): Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe to perform different actions such as restoring snapshots...etc.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ntdsutil\.exe$/i)
description: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe): Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["INSTALLDRIVER ", ".dll"])
description: Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "INSTALLDRIVER" which installs a new ODBC driver. Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "INSTALLDRIVER " AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".dll")
description: Suspicious Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "INSTALLDRIVER" action where the driver doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. This is often used as a defense evasion method.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Registration\CRMLog", ":\Windows\System32\com\dmp\\", ":\Windows\System32\FxsTmp\\", ":\Windows\System32\Microsoft\Crypto\RSA\MachineKeys\\", ":\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\color\\", ":\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\\", ":\Windows\System32\spool\SERVERS\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks_Migrated\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\SyncCenter\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\com\dmp\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\FxsTmp\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\PLA\System\\", ":\Windows\SysWOW64\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\SyncCenter\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", ":\Windows\Tracing\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\"]))
description: Odbcconf.EXE Suspicious DLL Location: Detects execution of "odbcconf" where the path of the DLL being registered is located in a potentially suspicious location.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["REGSVR ", ".dll"])
description: New DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "REGSVR" in order to register a new DLL (equivalent to running regsvr32). Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "REGSVR " AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".dll")
description: Potentially Suspicious DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•f ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".rsp")
description: Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file which might contain a malicious action.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("odbcconf.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”f " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•f ") AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".rsp" OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\runonce.exe") AND process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\odbcconf.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS '.exe \/E \/F "C:\WINDOWS\system32\odbcconf.tmp"'))
description: Suspicious Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file with a non-".rsp" extension.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\odbcconf\.exe$/i)
description: Uncommon Child Process Spawned By Odbcconf.EXE: Detects an uncommon child process of "odbcconf.exe" binary which normally shouldn't have any child processes.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\EXCEL\.EXE$|.*\\POWERPNT\.EXE$|.*\\WINWORD\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Excel.exe", "POWERPNT.EXE", "WinWord.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://"]))
description: Potential Arbitrary File Download Using Office Application: Detects potential arbitrary file download using a Microsoft Office application

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\excel\.exe$/i AND (process.name IIN ["foxprow.exe", "schdplus.exe", "winproj.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\foxprow\.exe$|.*\\schdplus\.exe$|.*\\winproj\.exe$)/i))
description: Potential Excel.EXE DCOM Lateral Movement Via ActivateMicrosoftApp: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\dopus\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\EXCEL\.EXE$|.*\\POWERPNT\.EXE$|.*\\WINWORD\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Excel.exe", "POWERPNT.EXE", "WinWord.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Templates", "\AppData\Roaming\Microsoft\Word\Startup\\", "\Microsoft Office\root\Templates\\", "\Microsoft Office\Templates\\"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.dotx$|.*\.xltx$|.*\.potx$)/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Office Document Executed From Trusted Location: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\onenote\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\exported\\", "\onenoteofflinecache_files\\"]))
description:
OneNote.EXE Execution of Malicious Embedded Scripts: Detects the execution of malicious OneNote documents that contain embedded scripts.
When a user clicks on a OneNote attachment and then on the malicious link inside the ".one" file, it exports and executes the malicious embedded script from specific directories.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\onenote\.exe$/i AND (process.name IIN ["bitsadmin.exe", "CertOC.exe", "CertUtil.exe", "Cmd.Exe", "CMSTP.EXE", "cscript.exe", "curl.exe", "HH.exe", "IEExec.exe", "InstallUtil.exe", "javaw.exe", "Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe", "msdt.exe", "MSHTA.EXE", "msiexec.exe", "Msxsl.exe", "odbcconf.exe", "pcalua.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "RegAsm.exe", "RegSvcs.exe", "REGSVR32.exe", "RUNDLL32.exe", "schtasks.exe", "ScriptRunner.exe", "wmic.exe", "WorkFolders.exe", "wscript.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\certoc\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cmstp\.exe$|.*\\control\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\hh\.exe$|.*\\ieexec\.exe$|.*\\installutil\.exe$|.*\\javaw\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\Microsoft\.Workflow\.Compiler\.exe$|.*\\msbuild\.exe$|.*\\msdt\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msidb\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\msxsl\.exe$|.*\\odbcconf\.exe$|.*\\pcalua\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regasm\.exe$|.*\\regsvcs\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\verclsid\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\workfolders\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".hta", ".vb", ".wsh", ".js", ".ps", ".scr", ".pif", ".bat", ".cmd"]) OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\ProgramData\\", "\Windows\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Temp\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks\\"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\AppData\\Local\\Microsoft\\Teams\\current\\Teams\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*\-Embedding$/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\OneDrive\\" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\FileCoAuth\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*\-Embedding$/i))
description: Suspicious Microsoft OneNote Child Process: Detects suspicious child processes of the Microsoft OneNote application. This may indicate an attempt to execute malicious embedded objects from a .one file.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\Outlook\Security\EnableUnsafeClientMailRules")
description: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Temporary Internet Files\Content.Outlook\\")
description: Suspicious Execution From Outlook Temporary Folder: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\OUTLOOK\.EXE$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\hh\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\msbuild\.exe$|.*\\msdt\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Outlook Child Process: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an Outlook process.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\outlook\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "\\")
description: Suspicious Remote Child Process From Outlook: Detects a suspicious child process spawning from Outlook where the image is located in a remote location (SMB/WebDav shares).

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\WINWORD\.EXE$|.*\\EXCEL\.EXE$|.*\\POWERPNT\.exe$|.*\\MSPUB\.exe$|.*\\VISIO\.exe$|.*\\MSACCESS\.exe$|.*\\EQNEDT32\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\users\\" AND process.exe_path=/.*\.exe$/i AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\Teams\.exe$/i)
description: Suspicious Binary In User Directory Spawned From Office Application: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\EQNEDT32\.EXE$|.*\\EXCEL\.EXE$|.*\\MSACCESS\.EXE$|.*\\MSPUB\.exe$|.*\\ONENOTE\.EXE$|.*\\POWERPNT\.exe$|.*\\VISIO\.exe$|.*\\WINWORD\.EXE$|.*\\wordpad\.exe$|.*\\wordview\.exe$)/i) AND (process.name IIN ["bitsadmin.exe", "CertOC.exe", "CertUtil.exe", "Cmd.Exe", "CMSTP.EXE", "cscript.exe", "curl.exe", "HH.exe", "IEExec.exe", "InstallUtil.exe", "javaw.exe", "Microsoft.Workflow.Compiler.exe", "msdt.exe", "MSHTA.EXE", "msiexec.exe", "Msxsl.exe", "odbcconf.exe", "pcalua.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "RegAsm.exe", "RegSvcs.exe", "REGSVR32.exe", "RUNDLL32.exe", "schtasks.exe", "ScriptRunner.exe", "wmic.exe", "WorkFolders.exe", "wscript.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\AppVLP\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\certoc\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cmstp\.exe$|.*\\control\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\hh\.exe$|.*\\ieexec\.exe$|.*\\installutil\.exe$|.*\\javaw\.exe$|.*\\mftrace\.exe$|.*\\Microsoft\.Workflow\.Compiler\.exe$|.*\\msbuild\.exe$|.*\\msdt\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msidb\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\msxsl\.exe$|.*\\odbcconf\.exe$|.*\\pcalua\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regasm\.exe$|.*\\regsvcs\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\scrcons\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\verclsid\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\workfolders\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\ProgramData\\", "\Windows\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Temp\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks\\"]))
description: Suspicious Microsoft Office Child Process: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\WINWORD\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("WinWord.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/l ", ".dll"])
description: Potential Arbitrary DLL Load Using Winword: Detects potential DLL sideloading using the Microsoft Office winword process via the '/l' flag.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("PDQ Deploy Console") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("PDQ Deploy") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("PDQ.com") OR process.name = NOCASE("PDQDeployConsole.exe"))
description: PDQ Deploy Remote Adminstartion Tool Execution: Detect use of PDQ Deploy remote admin tool

query: where(parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\PDQDeployRunner-" AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\csc\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\ProgramData\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\TEMP\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -decode ", " -enc ", " -encodedcommand ", " -w hidden", "DownloadString", "FromBase64String", "http", "iex ", "Invoke-"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of PDQDeployRunner: Detects suspicious execution of "PDQDeployRunner" which is part of the PDQDeploy service stack that is responsible for executing commands and packages on a remote machines

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\perl\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("perl.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e")
description: Perl Inline Command Execution: Detects execution of perl using the "-e"/"-E" flags. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live perl code.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\php\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("php.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -r")
description: Php Inline Command Execution: Detects execution of php using the "-r" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live php code.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ping\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/0x[a-fA-F0-9]{8}/i)
description: Ping Hex IP: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\pktmon\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PktMon.exe"))
description: PktMon.EXE Execution: Detects execution of PktMon, a tool that captures network packets.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Command-line SSH, Telnet, and Rlogin client") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -R ")
description: Suspicious Plink Port Forwarding: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\plink\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":127.0.0.1:3389" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\plink\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":3389" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -P 443", " -P 22"]))
description: Potential RDP Tunneling Via Plink: Execution of plink to perform data exfiltration and tunneling

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\powercfg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PowerCfg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/setacvalueindex ", "SCHEME_CURRENT", "SUB_VIDEO", "VIDEOCONLOCK"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-change ", "-standby-timeout-"]))
description: Suspicious Powercfg Execution To Change Lock Screen Timeout: Detects suspicious execution of 'Powercfg.exe' to change lock screen timeout

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.Exe", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Add-AADInt", "ConvertTo-AADInt", "Disable-AADInt", "Enable-AADInt", "Export-AADInt", "Find-AADInt", "Get-AADInt", "Grant-AADInt", "Initialize-AADInt", "Install-AADInt", "Invoke-AADInt", "Join-AADInt", "New-AADInt", "Open-AADInt", "Read-AADInt", "Register-AADInt", "Remove-AADInt", "Reset-AADInt", "Resolve-AADInt", "Restore-AADInt", "Save-AADInt", "Search-AADInt", "Send-AADInt", "Set-AADInt", "Start-AADInt", "Unprotect-AADInt", "Update-AADInt"]))
description: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - ProccessCreation: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Import-Module ", "ipmo "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dll")
description: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - ProcCreation: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Add-WindowsCapability" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "OpenSSH.")
description: Add Windows Capability Via PowerShell Cmdlet: Detects usage of the "Add-WindowsCapability" cmdlet to add Windows capabilities. Notable capabilities could be "OpenSSH" and others.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["System.Management.Automation.AmsiUtils", "amsiInitFailed"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["[Ref].Assembly.GetType", "SetValue($null,$true)", "NonPublic,Static"])
description: Potential AMSI Bypass Via .NET Reflection: Detects Request to "amsiInitFailed" that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["""if(0){{{0}}}' -f $(0 -as [char]) +""", "#<NULL>"])
description: Potential AMSI Bypass Using NULL Bits: Detects usage of special strings/null bits in order to potentially bypass AMSI functionalities

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["WindowsAudioDevice-Powershell-Cmdlet", "Toggle-AudioDevice", "Get-AudioDevice ", "Set-AudioDevice ", "Write-AudioDevice "])
description: Audio Capture via PowerShell: Detects audio capture via PowerShell Cmdlet.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" JAB", " SUVYI", " SQBFAFgA", " aQBlAHgA", " aWV4I", " IAA", " IAB", " UwB", " cwB"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe -ENCOD ", " BA^J e-"]) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -ExecutionPolicy remotesigned ")
description: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.Exe", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -e ", " -en ", " -enc ", " -enco"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" JAB", " SUVYI", " SQBFAFgA", " aWV4I", " IAB", " PAA", " aQBlAHgA"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Packages\Plugins\Microsoft.GuestConfiguration.ConfigurationforWindows\\", "\gc_worker.exe"]))
description: Suspicious PowerShell Encoded Command Patterns: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["IAAtAGIAeABvAHIAIAAwAHgA", "AALQBiAHgAbwByACAAMAB4A", "gAC0AYgB4AG8AcgAgADAAeA", "AC4ASQBuAHYAbwBrAGUAKAApACAAfAAg", "AuAEkAbgB2AG8AawBlACgAKQAgAHwAI", "ALgBJAG4AdgBvAGsAZQAoACkAIAB8AC", "AHsAMQB9AHsAMAB9ACIAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADEAfQB7ADAAfQAiACAALQBmAC", "AewAxAH0AewAwAH0AIgAgAC0AZgAg", "AHsAMAB9AHsAMwB9ACIAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADAAfQB7ADMAfQAiACAALQBmAC", "AewAwAH0AewAzAH0AIgAgAC0AZgAg", "AHsAMgB9AHsAMAB9ACIAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADIAfQB7ADAAfQAiACAALQBmAC", "AewAyAH0AewAwAH0AIgAgAC0AZgAg", "AHsAMQB9AHsAMAB9ACcAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADEAfQB7ADAAfQAnACAALQBmAC", "AewAxAH0AewAwAH0AJwAgAC0AZgAg", "AHsAMAB9AHsAMwB9ACcAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADAAfQB7ADMAfQAnACAALQBmAC", "AewAwAH0AewAzAH0AJwAgAC0AZgAg", "AHsAMgB9AHsAMAB9ACcAIAAtAGYAI", "B7ADIAfQB7ADAAfQAnACAALQBmAC", "AewAyAH0AewAwAH0AJwAgAC0AZgAg"])
description: Suspicious Obfuscated PowerShell Code: Detects suspicious UTF16 and base64 encoded and often obfuscated PowerShell code often used in command lines

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "OjpGcm9tQmFzZTY0U3RyaW5n" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "o6RnJvbUJhc2U2NFN0cmluZ" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "6OkZyb21CYXNlNjRTdHJpbm" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["OgA6AEYAcgBvAG0AQgBhAHMAZQA2ADQAUwB0AHIAaQBuAGcA", "oAOgBGAHIAbwBtAEIAYQBzAGUANgA0AFMAdAByAGkAbgBnA", "6ADoARgByAG8AbQBCAGEAcwBlADYANABTAHQAcgBpAG4AZw"])

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " hidden " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["AGkAdABzAGEAZABtAGkAbgAgAC8AdAByAGEAbgBzAGYAZQByA", "aXRzYWRtaW4gL3RyYW5zZmVy", "IAaQB0AHMAYQBkAG0AaQBuACAALwB0AHIAYQBuAHMAZgBlAHIA", "JpdHNhZG1pbiAvdHJhbnNmZX", "YgBpAHQAcwBhAGQAbQBpAG4AIAAvAHQAcgBhAG4AcwBmAGUAcg", "Yml0c2FkbWluIC90cmFuc2Zlc", "AGMAaAB1AG4AawBfAHMAaQB6AGUA", "JABjAGgAdQBuAGsAXwBzAGkAegBlA", "JGNodW5rX3Npem", "QAYwBoAHUAbgBrAF8AcwBpAHoAZQ", "RjaHVua19zaXpl", "Y2h1bmtfc2l6Z", "AE8ALgBDAG8AbQBwAHIAZQBzAHMAaQBvAG4A", "kATwAuAEMAbwBtAHAAcgBlAHMAcwBpAG8Abg", "lPLkNvbXByZXNzaW9u", "SQBPAC4AQwBvAG0AcAByAGUAcwBzAGkAbwBuA", "SU8uQ29tcHJlc3Npb2", "Ty5Db21wcmVzc2lvb", "AE8ALgBNAGUAbQBvAHIAeQBTAHQAcgBlAGEAbQ", "kATwAuAE0AZQBtAG8AcgB5AFMAdAByAGUAYQBtA", "lPLk1lbW9yeVN0cmVhb", "SQBPAC4ATQBlAG0AbwByAHkAUwB0AHIAZQBhAG0A", "SU8uTWVtb3J5U3RyZWFt", "Ty5NZW1vcnlTdHJlYW", "4ARwBlAHQAQwBoAHUAbgBrA", "5HZXRDaHVua", "AEcAZQB0AEMAaAB1AG4Aaw", "LgBHAGUAdABDAGgAdQBuAGsA", "LkdldENodW5r", "R2V0Q2h1bm", "AEgAUgBFAEEARABfAEkATgBGAE8ANgA0A", "QASABSAEUAQQBEAF8ASQBOAEYATwA2ADQA", "RIUkVBRF9JTkZPNj", "SFJFQURfSU5GTzY0", "VABIAFIARQBBAEQAXwBJAE4ARgBPADYANA", "VEhSRUFEX0lORk82N", "AHIAZQBhAHQAZQBSAGUAbQBvAHQAZQBUAGgAcgBlAGEAZA", "cmVhdGVSZW1vdGVUaHJlYW", "MAcgBlAGEAdABlAFIAZQBtAG8AdABlAFQAaAByAGUAYQBkA", "NyZWF0ZVJlbW90ZVRocmVhZ", "Q3JlYXRlUmVtb3RlVGhyZWFk", "QwByAGUAYQB0AGUAUgBlAG0AbwB0AGUAVABoAHIAZQBhAGQA", "0AZQBtAG0AbwB2AGUA", "1lbW1vdm", "AGUAbQBtAG8AdgBlA", "bQBlAG0AbQBvAHYAZQ", "bWVtbW92Z", "ZW1tb3Zl"]))

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SUVYIChb" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lFWCAoW" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "JRVggKF" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "aWV4IChb" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lleCAoW" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "pZXggKF" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "aWV4IChOZX" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lleCAoTmV3" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "pZXggKE5ld" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SUVYIChOZX" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lFWCAoTmV3" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "JRVggKE5ld" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SUVYKF" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lFWChb" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "JRVgoW" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "aWV4KF" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lleChb" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "pZXgoW" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "aWV4KE5ld" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lleChOZX" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "pZXgoTmV3" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SUVYKE5ld" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lFWChOZX" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "JRVgoTmV3" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SUVYKCgn" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lFWCgoJ" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "JRVgoKC" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "aWV4KCgn" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "lleCgoJ" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "pZXgoKC" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["SQBFAFgAIAAoAFsA", "kARQBYACAAKABbA", "JAEUAWAAgACgAWw", "aQBlAHgAIAAoAFsA", "kAZQB4ACAAKABbA", "pAGUAeAAgACgAWw", "aQBlAHgAIAAoAE4AZQB3A", "kAZQB4ACAAKABOAGUAdw", "pAGUAeAAgACgATgBlAHcA", "SQBFAFgAIAAoAE4AZQB3A", "kARQBYACAAKABOAGUAdw", "JAEUAWAAgACgATgBlAHcA"])

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["SQBuAHYAbwBrAGUALQ", "kAbgB2AG8AawBlAC0A", "JAG4AdgBvAGsAZQAtA", "SW52b2tlL", "ludm9rZS", "JbnZva2Ut"]))

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "QWRkLU1wUHJlZmVyZW5jZS" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "FkZC1NcFByZWZlcmVuY2Ug" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "BZGQtTXBQcmVmZXJlbmNlI" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "U2V0LU1wUHJlZmVyZW5jZS" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "NldC1NcFByZWZlcmVuY2Ug" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "TZXQtTXBQcmVmZXJlbmNlI" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "YWRkLW1wcHJlZmVyZW5jZS" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "FkZC1tcHByZWZlcmVuY2Ug" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "hZGQtbXBwcmVmZXJlbmNlI" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "c2V0LW1wcHJlZmVyZW5jZS" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "NldC1tcHByZWZlcmVuY2Ug" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "zZXQtbXBwcmVmZXJlbmNlI" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["QQBkAGQALQBNAHAAUAByAGUAZgBlAHIAZQBuAGMAZQAgA", "EAZABkAC0ATQBwAFAAcgBlAGYAZQByAGUAbgBjAGUAIA", "BAGQAZAAtAE0AcABQAHIAZQBmAGUAcgBlAG4AYwBlACAA", "UwBlAHQALQBNAHAAUAByAGUAZgBlAHIAZQBuAGMAZQAgA", "MAZQB0AC0ATQBwAFAAcgBlAGYAZQByAGUAbgBjAGUAIA", "TAGUAdAAtAE0AcABQAHIAZQBmAGUAcgBlAG4AYwBlACAA", "YQBkAGQALQBtAHAAcAByAGUAZgBlAHIAZQBuAGMAZQAgA", "EAZABkAC0AbQBwAHAAcgBlAGYAZQByAGUAbgBjAGUAIA", "hAGQAZAAtAG0AcABwAHIAZQBmAGUAcgBlAG4AYwBlACAA", "cwBlAHQALQBtAHAAcAByAGUAZgBlAHIAZQBuAGMAZQAgA", "MAZQB0AC0AbQBwAHAAcgBlAGYAZQByAGUAbgBjAGUAIA", "zAGUAdAAtAG0AcABwAHIAZQBmAGUAcgBlAG4AYwBlACAA"])

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["WwBSAGUAZgBsAGUAYwB0AGkAbwBuAC4AQQBzAHMAZQBtAGIAbAB5AF0AOgA6AEwAbwBhAGQAKA", "sAUgBlAGYAbABlAGMAdABpAG8AbgAuAEEAcwBzAGUAbQBiAGwAeQBdADoAOgBMAG8AYQBkACgA", "bAFIAZQBmAGwAZQBjAHQAaQBvAG4ALgBBAHMAcwBlAG0AYgBsAHkAXQA6ADoATABvAGEAZAAoA", "AFsAcgBlAGYAbABlAGMAdABpAG8AbgAuAGEAcwBzAGUAbQBiAGwAeQBdADoAOgAoACIATABvAGEAZAAiAC", "BbAHIAZQBmAGwAZQBjAHQAaQBvAG4ALgBhAHMAcwBlAG0AYgBsAHkAXQA6ADoAKAAiAEwAbwBhAGQAIgAp", "AWwByAGUAZgBsAGUAYwB0AGkAbwBuAC4AYQBzAHMAZQBtAGIAbAB5AF0AOgA6ACgAIgBMAG8AYQBkACIAK", "WwBSAGUAZgBsAGUAYwB0AGkAbwBuAC4AQQBzAHMAZQBtAGIAbAB5AF0AOgA6ACgAIgBMAG8AYQBkACIAKQ", "sAUgBlAGYAbABlAGMAdABpAG8AbgAuAEEAcwBzAGUAbQBiAGwAeQBdADoAOgAoACIATABvAGEAZAAiACkA", "bAFIAZQBmAGwAZQBjAHQAaQBvAG4ALgBBAHMAcwBlAG0AYgBsAHkAXQA6ADoAKAAiAEwAbwBhAGQAIgApA", "WwByAGUAZgBsAGUAYwB0AGkAbwBuAC4AYQBzAHMAZQBtAGIAbAB5AF0AOgA6AEwAbwBhAGQAKA", "sAcgBlAGYAbABlAGMAdABpAG8AbgAuAGEAcwBzAGUAbQBiAGwAeQBdADoAOgBMAG8AYQBkACgA", "bAHIAZQBmAGwAZQBjAHQAaQBvAG4ALgBhAHMAcwBlAG0AYgBsAHkAXQA6ADoATABvAGEAZAAoA"])

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["OgA6ACgAIgBMACIAKwAiAG8AYQBkACIAKQ", "oAOgAoACIATAAiACsAIgBvAGEAZAAiACkA", "6ADoAKAAiAEwAIgArACIAbwBhAGQAIgApA", "OgA6ACgAIgBMAG8AIgArACIAYQBkACIAKQ", "oAOgAoACIATABvACIAKwAiAGEAZAAiACkA", "6ADoAKAAiAEwAbwAiACsAIgBhAGQAIgApA", "OgA6ACgAIgBMAG8AYQAiACsAIgBkACIAKQ", "oAOgAoACIATABvAGEAIgArACIAZAAiACkA", "6ADoAKAAiAEwAbwBhACIAKwAiAGQAIgApA", "OgA6ACgAJwBMACcAKwAnAG8AYQBkACcAKQ", "oAOgAoACcATAAnACsAJwBvAGEAZAAnACkA", "6ADoAKAAnAEwAJwArACcAbwBhAGQAJwApA", "OgA6ACgAJwBMAG8AJwArACcAYQBkACcAKQ", "oAOgAoACcATABvACcAKwAnAGEAZAAnACkA", "6ADoAKAAnAEwAbwAnACsAJwBhAGQAJwApA", "OgA6ACgAJwBMAG8AYQAnACsAJwBkACcAKQ", "oAOgAoACcATABvAGEAJwArACcAZAAnACkA", "6ADoAKAAnAEwAbwBhACcAKwAnAGQAJwApA"])
description: Suspicious Encoded And Obfuscated Reflection Assembly Load Function Call: Detects suspicious base64 encoded and obfuscated "LOAD" keyword used in .NET "reflection.assembly"

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VwBpAG4AMwAyAF8AUwBoAGEAZABvAHcAYwBvAHAAeQ", "cAaQBuADMAMgBfAFMAaABhAGQAbwB3AGMAbwBwAHkA", "XAGkAbgAzADIAXwBTAGgAYQBkAG8AdwBjAG8AcAB5A", "V2luMzJfU2hhZG93Y29we", "dpbjMyX1NoYWRvd2NvcH", "XaW4zMl9TaGFkb3djb3B5"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VwBpAG4AMwAyAF8AUwBjAGgAZQBkAHUAbABlAGQASgBvAGIA", "cAaQBuADMAMgBfAFMAYwBoAGUAZAB1AGwAZQBkAEoAbwBiA", "XAGkAbgAzADIAXwBTAGMAaABlAGQAdQBsAGUAZABKAG8AYg", "V2luMzJfU2NoZWR1bGVkSm9i", "dpbjMyX1NjaGVkdWxlZEpvY", "XaW4zMl9TY2hlZHVsZWRKb2"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VwBpAG4AMwAyAF8AUAByAG8AYwBlAHMAcw", "cAaQBuADMAMgBfAFAAcgBvAGMAZQBzAHMA", "XAGkAbgAzADIAXwBQAHIAbwBjAGUAcwBzA", "V2luMzJfUHJvY2Vzc", "dpbjMyX1Byb2Nlc3", "XaW4zMl9Qcm9jZXNz"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VwBpAG4AMwAyAF8AVQBzAGUAcgBBAGMAYwBvAHUAbgB0A", "cAaQBuADMAMgBfAFUAcwBlAHIAQQBjAGMAbwB1AG4AdA", "XAGkAbgAzADIAXwBVAHMAZQByAEEAYwBjAG8AdQBuAHQA", "V2luMzJfVXNlckFjY291bn", "dpbjMyX1VzZXJBY2NvdW50", "XaW4zMl9Vc2VyQWNjb3Vud"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["VwBpAG4AMwAyAF8ATABvAGcAZwBlAGQATwBuAFUAcwBlAHIA", "cAaQBuADMAMgBfAEwAbwBnAGcAZQBkAE8AbgBVAHMAZQByA", "XAGkAbgAzADIAXwBMAG8AZwBnAGUAZABPAG4AVQBzAGUAcg", "V2luMzJfTG9nZ2VkT25Vc2Vy", "dpbjMyX0xvZ2dlZE9uVXNlc", "XaW4zMl9Mb2dnZWRPblVzZX"]))
description: PowerShell Base64 Encoded WMI Classes: Detects calls to base64 encoded WMI class such as "Win32_ShadowCopy", "Win32_ScheduledJob", etc.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SyncInvoke ")
description: Potential Process Execution Proxy Via CL_Invocation.ps1: Detects calls to "SyncInvoke" that is part of the "CL_Invocation.ps1" script to proxy execution using "System.Diagnostics.Process"

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["LoadAssemblyFromPath ", "LoadAssemblyFromNS "])
description: Assembly Loading Via CL_LoadAssembly.ps1: Detects calls to "LoadAssemblyFromPath" or "LoadAssemblyFromNS" that are part of the "CL_LoadAssembly.ps1" script. This can be abused to load different assemblies and bypass App locker controls.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -nologo -windowstyle minimized -file " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Potential Script Proxy Execution Via CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1: Detects the use of the Microsoft signed script "CL_mutexverifiers" to proxy the execution of additional PowerShell script commands

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ConvertTo-SecureString")
description: ConvertTo-SecureString Cmdlet Usage Via CommandLine: Detects usage of the "ConvertTo-SecureString" cmdlet via the commandline. Which is fairly uncommon and could indicate potential suspicious activity

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["hctac", "kaerb", "dnammoc", "ekovn", "eliFd", "rahc", "etirw", "golon", "tninon", "eddih", "tpircS", "ssecorp", "llehsrewop", "esnopser", "daolnwod", "tneilCbeW", "tneilc", "ptth", "elifotevas", "46esab", "htaPpmeTteG", "tcejbO", "maerts", "hcaerof", "retupmoc"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -EncodedCommand ", " -enc "]))
description: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+.*\+/i OR process.cmd_line=/\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{.*\{/i OR process.cmd_line=/\^.*\^.*\^.*\^.*\^/i OR process.cmd_line=/`.*`.*`.*`.*`/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Program Files\Amazon\SSM\ssm-document-worker.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['new EventSource("Microsoft.Windows.Sense.Client.Management"', "public static extern bool InstallELAMCertificateInfo(SafeFileHandle handle);"]))
description: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell_ISE.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-ComObject", "InstallProduct(", ".Insert(", "UILevel"])
description:
Obfuscated PowerShell MSI Install via WindowsInstaller COM: Detects the execution of obfuscated PowerShell commands that attempt to install MSI packages via the Windows Installer COM object (`WindowsInstaller.Installer`).
The technique involves manipulating strings to hide functionality, such as constructing class names using string insertion (e.g., 'indowsInstaller.Installer'.Insert(0,'W')) and correcting
malformed URLs (e.g., converting 'htps://' to 'https://') at runtime. This behavior is commonly associated with malware loaders or droppers that aim to bypass static detection
by hiding intent in runtime-generated strings and using legitimate tools for code execution. The use of `InstallProduct` and COM object creation, particularly combined with
hidden window execution and suppressed UI, indicates an attempt to install software (likely malicious) without user interaction.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell_ISE.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-ComObject", "InstallProduct("] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http", "\\"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["://127.0.0.1", "://localhost"]))
description:
PowerShell MSI Install via WindowsInstaller COM From Remote Location: Detects the execution of PowerShell commands that attempt to install MSI packages via the
Windows Installer COM object (`WindowsInstaller.Installer`) hosted remotely.
This could be indication of malicious software deployment or lateral movement attempts using Windows Installer functionality.
And the usage of WindowsInstaller COM object rather than msiexec could be an attempt to bypass the detection.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Get-ADComputer ", " -Filter \\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" > ", " | Select ", "Out-File", "Set-Content", "Add-Content"]))
description: Computer Discovery And Export Via Get-ADComputer Cmdlet: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ConsoleHost_history.txt", "(Get-PSReadLineOption).HistorySavePath"])
description:
Potential PowerShell Console History Access Attempt via History File: Detects potential access attempts to the PowerShell console history directly via history file (ConsoleHost_history.txt).
This can give access to plaintext passwords used in PowerShell commands or used for general reconnaissance.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["New-Service", "-BinaryPathName"])

description: Powershell Defender Disable Scan Feature: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Add-MpPreference ", "Set-MpPreference "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -ExclusionPath ", " -ExclusionExtension ", " -ExclusionProcess ", " -ExclusionIpAddress "]))
description: Powershell Defender Exclusion: Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-DisableBehaviorMonitoring $true", "-DisableRuntimeMonitoring $true"]) OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["stop", "WinDefend"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["delete", "WinDefend"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["config", "WinDefend", "start=disabled"]))
description: Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-NetFirewallProfile ", " -Enabled ", " False"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -All ", "Public", "Domain", "Private"]))
description: Windows Firewall Disabled via PowerShell: Detects attempts to disable the Windows Firewall using PowerShell

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -name IEHarden ", " -value 0 "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -name DEPOff ", " -value 1 "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -name DisableFirstRunCustomize ", " -value 2 "])
description: Disabled IE Security Features: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -version 2 ", " -versio 2 ", " -versi 2 ", " -vers 2 ", " -ver 2 ", " -ve 2 ", " -v 2 "]))
description: Potential PowerShell Downgrade Attack: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0
Potential COM Objects Download Cradles Usage - Process Creation: Detects usage of COM objects that can be abused to download files in PowerShell by CLSID

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http://127.0.0.1", "%{(IRM $_)}", "Invoke"])
description: Obfuscated PowerShell OneLiner Execution: Detects the execution of a specific OneLiner to download and execute powershell modules in memory.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-RestMethod ", "Invoke-WebRequest ", "IRM ", "IWR "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http", "OutFile", ".dll"])
description: Potential DLL File Download Via PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest: Detects potential DLL files being downloaded using the PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest or Invoke-RestMethod cmdlets.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".DownloadString(", ".DownloadFile(", "Invoke-WebRequest ", "iwr ", "Invoke-RestMethod ", "irm "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [";iex $", "| IEX", "|IEX ", "I`E`X", "I`EX", "IE`X", "iex ", "IEX (", "IEX(", "Invoke-Expression"]))
description: PowerShell Download and Execution Cradles: Detects PowerShell download and execution cradles.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell_ISE.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["new-object", "net.webclient).", "download"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["string(", "file("]))
description: PowerShell Download Pattern: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["anonfiles.com", "cdn.discordapp.com", "ddns.net", "dl.dropboxusercontent.com", "ghostbin.co", "glitch.me", "gofile.io", "hastebin.com", "mediafire.com", "mega.nz", "onrender.com", "pages.dev", "paste.ee", "pastebin.com", "pastebin.pl", "pastetext.net", "pixeldrain.com", "privatlab.com", "privatlab.net", "send.exploit.in", "sendspace.com", "storage.googleapis.com", "storjshare.io", "supabase.co", "temp.sh", "transfer.sh", "trycloudflare.com", "ufile.io", "w3spaces.com", "workers.dev"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".DownloadString(", ".DownloadFile(", "Invoke-WebRequest ", "iwr ", "wget "]))
description: Potentially Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via PowerShell.EXE: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads from file sharing domains using PowerShell.exe

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Add-ADDBSidHistory", "Add-ADNgcKey", "Add-ADReplNgcKey", "ConvertFrom-ADManagedPasswordBlob", "ConvertFrom-GPPrefPassword", "ConvertFrom-ManagedPasswordBlob", "ConvertFrom-UnattendXmlPassword", "ConvertFrom-UnicodePassword", "ConvertTo-AADHash", "ConvertTo-GPPrefPassword", "ConvertTo-KerberosKey", "ConvertTo-LMHash", "ConvertTo-MsoPasswordHash", "ConvertTo-NTHash", "ConvertTo-OrgIdHash", "ConvertTo-UnicodePassword", "Disable-ADDBAccount", "Enable-ADDBAccount", "Get-ADDBAccount", "Get-ADDBBackupKey", "Get-ADDBDomainController", "Get-ADDBGroupManagedServiceAccount", "Get-ADDBKdsRootKey", "Get-ADDBSchemaAttribute", "Get-ADDBServiceAccount", "Get-ADDefaultPasswordPolicy", "Get-ADKeyCredential", "Get-ADPasswordPolicy", "Get-ADReplAccount", "Get-ADReplBackupKey", "Get-ADReplicationAccount", "Get-ADSIAccount", "Get-AzureADUserEx", "Get-BootKey", "Get-KeyCredential", "Get-LsaBackupKey", "Get-LsaPolicy", "Get-SamPasswordPolicy", "Get-SysKey", "Get-SystemKey", "New-ADDBRestoreFromMediaScript", "New-ADKeyCredential", "New-ADNgcKey", "New-NTHashSet", "Remove-ADDBObject", "Save-DPAPIBlob", "Set-ADAccountPasswordHash", "Set-ADDBAccountPassword", "Set-ADDBBootKey", "Set-ADDBDomainController", "Set-ADDBPrimaryGroup", "Set-ADDBSysKey", "Set-AzureADUserEx", "Set-LsaPolicy", "Set-SamAccountPasswordHash", "Set-WinUserPasswordHash", "Test-ADDBPasswordQuality", "Test-ADPasswordQuality", "Test-ADReplPasswordQuality", "Test-PasswordQuality", "Unlock-ADDBAccount", "Write-ADNgcKey", "Write-ADReplNgcKey"])
description:
DSInternals Suspicious PowerShell Cmdlets: Detects execution and usage of the DSInternals PowerShell module. Which can be used to perform what might be considered as suspicious activity such as dumping DPAPI backup keys or manipulating NTDS.DIT files.
The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Add-PSSnapin", "Get-Recipient", "-ExpandProperty", "EmailAddresses", "SmtpAddress", "-hidetableheaders"])
description: Email Exifiltration Via Powershell: Detects email exfiltration via powershell cmdlets

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature", "-Online", "-FeatureName"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["TelnetServer", "Internet-Explorer-Optional-amd64", "TFTP", "SMB1Protocol", "Client-ProjFS", "Microsoft-Windows-Subsystem-Linux"]))
description:
Potential Suspicious Windows Feature Enabled - ProcCreation: Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool.
Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -e ", " -en ", " -enc ", " -enco", " -ec "]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -Encoding " OR parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Packages\Plugins\Microsoft.GuestConfiguration.ConfigurationforWindows\\", "\gc_worker.exe"]))
description: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ToInt", "ToDecimal", "ToByte", "ToUint", "ToSingle", "ToSByte"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ToChar", "ToString", "String"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["char", "join"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["split", "join"]))
description: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["iex ", "Invoke-Expression ", "Invoke-Command ", "icm "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cat ", "get-content ", "type "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -raw")
description: Powershell Inline Execution From A File: Detects inline execution of PowerShell code from a file

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Export-PfxCertificate ", "Export-Certificate "])
description: Certificate Exported Via PowerShell: Detects calls to cmdlets that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "::FromBase64String(")
description: Base64 Encoded PowerShell Command Detected: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["FromBase64String", "MemoryStream", "H4sI"])
description: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Process Creation: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive via PowerShell. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Get-Clipboard")
description: PowerShell Get-Clipboard Cmdlet Via CLI: Detects usage of the 'Get-Clipboard' cmdlet via CLI

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Get-LocalGroupMember " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["domain admins", " administrator", " administrateur", "enterprise admins", "Exchange Trusted Subsystem", "Remote Desktop Users", "Utilisateurs du Bureau Ã  distance", "Usuarios de escritorio remoto"]))
description: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Using Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using the PowerShell Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-Process lsas", "ps lsas", "gps lsas"])
description: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS: Detects a "Get-Process" cmdlet and it's aliases on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\pwsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("pwsh.dll")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-Service ", "DCLCWPDTSD"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-SecurityDescriptorSddl ", "-sd "]))
description: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services Via Set-Service: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" | iex;", " | iex ", " | iex}", " | IEX ;", " | IEX -Error", " | IEX (new", ");IEX "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["::FromBase64String", ".GetString([System.Convert]::"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [")|iex;$", ");iex($", ");iex $", " | IEX | ", ' | iex\"'])
description: Suspicious PowerShell IEX Execution Patterns: Detects suspicious ways to run Invoke-Execution using IEX alias

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Import-Certificate", " -FilePath ", "Cert:\LocalMachine\Root"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp\\", ":\Windows\TEMP\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Perflogs\\", ":\Users\Public\\"]))
description: Root Certificate Installed From Susp Locations: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['Import-Module "$Env:Temp\\', """Import-Module '$Env:Temp\""", "Import-Module $Env:Temp\\", 'Import-Module "$Env:Appdata\\', """Import-Module '$Env:Appdata\""", "Import-Module $Env:Appdata\\", "Import-Module C:\Users\Public\\", 'ipmo "$Env:Temp\\', """ipmo '$Env:Temp\""", "ipmo $Env:Temp\\", 'ipmo "$Env:Appdata\\', """ipmo '$Env:Appdata\""", "ipmo $Env:Appdata\\", "ipmo C:\Users\Public\\"])
description: Import PowerShell Modules From Suspicious Directories - ProcCreation: Detects powershell scripts that import modules from suspicious directories

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Add-AppPackage ", "Add-AppxPackage "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -AllowUnsigned")
description: Unsigned AppX Installation Attempt Using Add-AppxPackage: Detects usage of the "Add-AppxPackage" or it's alias "Add-AppPackage" to install unsigned AppX packages

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-nop", " -w ", "hidden", " -c ", "[Convert]::FromBase64String"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -w ", "hidden", "-noni", "-nop", " -c ", "iex", "New-Object"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -w ", "hidden", "-ep", "bypass", "-Enc"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["powershell", "reg", "add", "\software\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["bypass", "-noprofile", "-windowstyle", "hidden", "new-object", "system.net.webclient", ".download"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["iex", "New-Object", "Net.WebClient", ".Download"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["""(New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadString('https://community.chocolatey.org/install.ps1""", "Write-ChocolateyWarning"]))
description: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - ProcessCreation: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["powershell_ise.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["curl ", "Invoke-RestMethod", "Invoke-WebRequest", " irm ", "iwr ", "wget "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["://1", "://2", "://3", "://4", "://5", "://6", "://7", "://8", "://9"]))
description: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution With DirectIP: Detects calls to PowerShell with Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet using direct IP access

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["powershell_ise.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["curl ", "Invoke-WebRequest", "iwr ", "wget "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -ur", " -o"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\", "%AppData%", "%Public%", "%Temp%", "%tmp%", ":\Windows\\"]))
description: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution: Detects a suspicious call to Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet where the and output is located in a suspicious location

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["powershell.exe", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken", ".GetRequest()"])
description:
Suspicious Kerberos Ticket Request via CLI: Detects suspicious Kerberos ticket requests via command line using System.IdentityModel.Tokens.KerberosRequestorSecurityToken class.
Threat actors may use command line interfaces to request Kerberos tickets for service accounts in order to
perform offline password cracking attacks commonly known as Kerberoasting or other Kerberos ticket abuse
techniques like silver ticket attacks.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["New-MailboxExportRequest", " -Mailbox ", " -FilePath \\"])
description: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations

description: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets - ProcessCreation: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Install-TransportAgent")
description: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*:\\Windows\\explorer\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\CompatTelRunner\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\explorer\.exe$)/i OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE(":\$WINDOWS.~BT\Sources\SetupHost.exe")) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\AppData\\Local\\Programs\\Microsoft\ VS\ Code\\Code\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " --ms-enable-electron-run-as-node " OR parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.WindowsTerminal_" AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\WindowsTerminal\.exe$/i))
description: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["[char]0x", "(WCHAR)0x"])
description: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via WCHAR/CHAR: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-f C:\Users\Public", '-f "C:\Users\Public', "-f %Public%", "-fi C:\Users\Public", '-fi "C:\Users\Public', "-fi %Public%", "-fil C:\Users\Public", '-fil "C:\Users\Public', "-fil %Public%", "-file C:\Users\Public", '-file "C:\Users\Public', "-file %Public%"]))
description: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand", "Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisableme"])
description: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement Abuse Via AtomicTestHarnesses: Detects calls to the AtomicTestHarnesses "Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand" which is designed to abuse the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary to run custom PowerShell code via module load-order hijacking.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Remove-MpPreference" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-ControlledFolderAccessProtectedFolders ", "-AttackSurfaceReductionRules_Ids ", "-AttackSurfaceReductionRules_Actions ", "-CheckForSignaturesBeforeRunningScan "]))
description: Tamper Windows Defender Remove-MpPreference: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configurations using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet

query: where((process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" Net.Sockets.TCPClient", ".GetStream(", ".Write("])
description: Potential Powershell ReverseShell Connection: Detects usage of the "TcpClient" class. Which can be abused to establish remote connections and reverse-shells. As seen used by the Nishang "Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine" reverse shell and other.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Get-Content", "-Stream"])
description: Run PowerShell Script from ADS: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line=/\s-\s*</i)
description: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\HarddiskVolumeShadowCopy", "System32\config\sam"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Copy-Item", "cp $_.", "cpi $_.", "copy $_.", ".File]::Copy("]))
description: PowerShell SAM Copy: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\pwsh\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("pwsh.dll")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-SecurityDescriptorSddl ", "-sd "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-Service ", "D;;"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [";;;IU", ";;;SU", ";;;BA", ";;;SY", ";;;WD"]))
description: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

query: where((process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-Acl ", "-AclObject ", "-Path "])
description: PowerShell Script Change Permission Via Set-Acl: Detects PowerShell execution to set the ACL of a file or a folder

query: where((process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-Acl ", "-AclObject "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['-Path "C:\Windows', """-Path 'C:\Windows""", "-Path %windir%", "-Path $env:windir"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["FullControl", "Allow"]))
description: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder

query: where((process.name IIN ["powershell_ise.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-executionpolicy ", " -ep ", " -exec "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Bypass", "Unrestricted"]) AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\SysWOW64\msiexec.exe", "C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\\', '-NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy Bypass -File "C:\Program Files (x86)\PowerShell\7\\'])) AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Avast Software\Avast\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Avast Software\Avast\\", "\instup.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['-ExecutionPolicy ByPass -File "C:\Program Files\Avast Software\Avast', '-ExecutionPolicy ByPass -File "C:\Program Files (x86)\Avast Software\Avast\\'])))
description: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PowerShell.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-Service", "-StartupType"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Disabled", "Manual"]))
description: Service StartupType Change Via PowerShell Set-Service: Detects the use of the PowerShell "Set-Service" cmdlet to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "manual"

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-WmiObject", "gwmi", "Get-CimInstance", "gcim"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Win32_ShadowCopy" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".Delete()", "Remove-WmiObject", "rwmi", "Remove-CimInstance", "rcim"]))
description: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Add-PSSnapin" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Microsoft.Exchange.Powershell.Snapin", "Microsoft.Exchange.Management.PowerShell.SnapIn"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "$exserver=Get-ExchangeServer ([Environment]::MachineName) -ErrorVariable exerr 2> $null"))
description: Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins Usage: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data. As seen used by HAFNIUM and APT27

query: where((process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Stop-Service ")
description: Stop Windows Service Via PowerShell Stop-Service: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the PowerShell Cmdlet "Stop-Service"

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["IEX ((New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString", "IEX (New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString", "IEX((New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString", "IEX(New-Object Net.WebClient).DownloadString", " -command (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile(", " -c (New-Object System.Net.WebClient).DownloadFile("])
description: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -windowstyle h ", " -windowstyl h", " -windowsty h", " -windowst h", " -windows h", " -windo h", " -wind h", " -win h", " -wi h", " -win h ", " -win hi ", " -win hid ", " -win hidd ", " -win hidde ", " -NoPr ", " -NoPro ", " -NoProf ", " -NoProfi ", " -NoProfil ", " -nonin ", " -nonint ", " -noninte ", " -noninter ", " -nonintera ", " -noninterac ", " -noninteract ", " -noninteracti ", " -noninteractiv ", " -ec ", " -encodedComman ", " -encodedComma ", " -encodedComm ", " -encodedCom ", " -encodedCo ", " -encodedC ", " -encoded ", " -encode ", " -encod ", " -enco ", " -en ", " -executionpolic ", " -executionpoli ", " -executionpol ", " -executionpo ", " -executionp ", " -execution bypass", " -executio bypass", " -executi bypass", " -execut bypass", " -execu bypass", " -exec bypass", " -exe bypass", " -ex bypass", " -ep bypass", " /windowstyle h ", " \/windowstyl h", " \/windowsty h", " \/windowst h", " \/windows h", " \/windo h", " \/wind h", " \/win h", " \/wi h", " \/win h ", " \/win hi ", " \/win hid ", " \/win hidd ", " \/win hidde ", " \/NoPr ", " \/NoPro ", " \/NoProf ", " \/NoProfi ", " \/NoProfil ", " \/nonin ", " \/nonint ", " \/noninte ", " \/noninter ", " \/nonintera ", " \/noninterac ", " \/noninteract ", " \/noninteracti ", " \/noninteractiv ", " \/ec ", " \/encodedComman ", " \/encodedComma ", " \/encodedComm ", " \/encodedCom ", " \/encodedCo ", " \/encodedC ", " \/encoded ", " \/encode ", " \/encod ", " \/enco ", " \/en ", " \/executionpolic ", " \/executionpoli ", " \/executionpol ", " \/executionpo ", " \/executionp ", " \/execution bypass", " \/executio bypass", " \/executi bypass", " \/execut bypass", " \/execu bypass", " \/exec bypass", " \/exe bypass", " \/ex bypass", " \/ep bypass"]))
description: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

query: where((parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "tomcat" OR parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\amigo\.exe$|.*\\browser\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\firefox\.exe$|.*\\httpd\.exe$|.*\\iexplore\.exe$|.*\\jbosssvc\.exe$|.*\\microsoftedge\.exe$|.*\\microsoftedgecp\.exe$|.*\\MicrosoftEdgeSH\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\nginx\.exe$|.*\\outlook\.exe$|.*\\php\-cgi\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\safari\.exe$|.*\\services\.exe$|.*\\sqlagent\.exe$|.*\\sqlserver\.exe$|.*\\sqlservr\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$|.*\\w3wp\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/c powershell", "/c pwsh"] OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Windows PowerShell") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("PowerShell Core 6") OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]))
description: Suspicious PowerShell Parent Process: Detects a suspicious or uncommon parent processes of PowerShell

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["powershell.exe", "\powershell", "\pwsh", "pwsh.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/c ", "\AppData\\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Local\\", "Roaming\\"]))
description: PowerShell Script Run in AppData: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder

query: where((process.cmd_line=/\w+`(\w+|-|.)`[\w+|\s]/i OR process.cmd_line=/"(\{\d\})+"\s*-f/i OR process.cmd_line=/(?i)\$\{`?e`?n`?v`?:`?p`?a`?t`?h`?\}/i) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "${env:path}")
description: Powershell Token Obfuscation - Process Creation: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell_ISE.EXE", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Uninstall-WindowsFeature", "Remove-WindowsFeature"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Windows-Defender")
description: Suspicious Uninstall of Windows Defender Feature via PowerShell: Detects the use of PowerShell with Uninstall-WindowsFeature or Remove-WindowsFeature cmdlets to disable or remove the Windows Defender GUI feature, a common technique used by adversaries to evade defenses.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Get-ADUser ", " -Filter \\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" > ", " | Select ", "Out-File", "Set-Content", "Add-Content"]))
description: User Discovery And Export Via Get-ADUser Cmdlet: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file
