"4ARQB0AC4AdwBFAEIA", "uAEUAdAAuAHcARQBCA", "TgBFAHQALgB3AEUAQg", "OAEUAdAAuAHcARQBCA", "bgBlAFQALgB3AEUAQg", "uAGUAVAAuAHcARQBCA", "bgBFAFQALgB3AEUAQg", "4ARQBUAC4AdwBFAEIA", "uAEUAVAAuAHcARQBCA", "TgBFAFQALgB3AEUAQg", "OAEUAVAAuAHcARQBCA", "TgBlAHQALgBXAEUAQg", "4AZQB0AC4AVwBFAEIA", "OAGUAdAAuAFcARQBCA", "bgBFAHQALgBXAEUAQg", "4ARQB0AC4AVwBFAEIA", "uAEUAdAAuAFcARQBCA", "TgBFAHQALgBXAEUAQg", "OAEUAdAAuAFcARQBCA", "bgBlAFQALgBXAEUAQg", "4AZQBUAC4AVwBFAEIA", "uAGUAVAAuAFcARQBCA", "TgBlAFQALgBXAEUAQg", "OAGUAVAAuAFcARQBCA", "bgBFAFQALgBXAEUAQg", "4ARQBUAC4AVwBFAEIA", "uAEUAVAAuAFcARQBCA"]))
description: Net WebClient Casing Anomalies: Detects PowerShell command line contents that include a suspicious abnormal casing in the Net.Webclient (e.g. nEt.WEbCliEnT) string as used in obfuscation techniques

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["X509Enrollment.CBinaryConverter", "884e2002-217d-11da-b2a4-000e7bbb2b09"])
description: Suspicious X509Enrollment - Process Creation: Detect use of X509Enrollment

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"] OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Windows PowerShell") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("PowerShell Core 6")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "bxor" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ForEach", "for(", "for ", "-join ", """-join'""", '-join"', "-join`", "::Join", "[char]"]))
description: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command: Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Compress-Archive -Path*-DestinationPath $env:TEMP", "Compress-Archive -Path*-DestinationPath*\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "Compress-Archive -Path*-DestinationPath*:\Windows\Temp\\"])
description:
Folder Compress To Potentially Suspicious Output Via Compress-Archive Cmdlet: Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\presentationhost\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PresentationHost.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://", "https://", "ftp://"]))
description: Arbitrary File Download Via PresentationHost.EXE: Detects usage of "PresentationHost" which is a utility that runs ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files to download arbitrary files

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\presentationhost\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PresentationHost.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".xbap" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" C:\Windows\\", " C:\Program Files"]))
description: XBAP Execution From Uncommon Locations Via PresentationHost.EXE: Detects the execution of ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files via PresentationHost.EXE from an uncommon location. These files can be abused to run malicious ".xbap" files any bypass AWL

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Microsoft\.NodejsTools\.PressAnyKey\.exe$/i)
description: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Arbitrary Binary Execution: Detects child processes of Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe that can be used to execute any other binary

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\print\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ISTARTS-WITH "print" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/D", ".exe"] AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "print.exe")
description: Abusing Print Executable: Attackers can use print.exe for remote file copy

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\protocolhandler\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ProtocolHandler.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp://", "http://", "https://"]))
description: File Download Using ProtocolHandler.exe: Detects usage of "ProtocolHandler" to download files. Downloaded files will be located in the cache folder (for example - %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE)

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\provlaunch\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Temp\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Potential Provlaunch.EXE Binary Proxy Execution Abuse: Detects child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\provlaunch\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Temp\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Suspicious Provlaunch.EXE Child Process: Detects suspicious child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Psr\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/start", "-start"]))
description: Screen Capture Activity Via Psr.EXE: Detects execution of Windows Problem Steps Recorder (psr.exe), a utility used to record the user screen and clicks.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\3proxy\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("3proxy - tiny proxy server") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".exe -i127.0.0.1 -p")
description: PUA - 3Proxy Execution: Detects the use of 3proxy, a tiny free proxy server

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["lockoutduration", "lockoutthreshold", "lockoutobservationwindow", "maxpwdage", "minpwdage", "minpwdlength", "pwdhistorylength", "pwdproperties"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-sc admincountdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-sc exchaddresses")
description: PUA - Suspicious ActiveDirectory Enumeration Via AdFind.EXE: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\AdFind\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AdFind.exe") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=d144de8117df2beceaba2201ad304764", "IMPHASH=12ce1c0f3f5837ecc18a3782408fa975", "IMPHASH=bca5675746d13a1f246e2da3c2217492", "IMPHASH=4fbf3f084fbbb2470b80b2013134df35", "IMPHASH=49b639b4acbecc49d72a01f357aa4930", "IMPHASH=53e117a96057eaf19c41380d0e87f1c2", "IMPHASH=680dad9e300346e05a85023965867201", "IMPHASH=21aa085d54992511b9f115355e468782"])
description: PUA - AdFind.EXE Execution: Detects execution of Adfind.exe utility, which can be used for reconnaissance in an Active Directory environment

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["domainlist", "trustdmp", "dcmodes", "adinfo", "-sc dclist", "computer_pwdnotreqd", "objectcategory=", "-subnets -f", 'name="Domain Admins"', "-sc u:", "domainncs", "dompol", " oudmp ", "subnetdmp", "gpodmp", "fspdmp", "users_noexpire", "computers_active", "computers_pwdnotreqd"])
description: PUA - AdFind Suspicious Execution: Detects AdFind execution with common flags seen used during attacks

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\advanced_ip_scanner" OR process.name ICONTAINS "advanced_ip_scanner" OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Advanced IP Scanner" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/portable", "/lng"])
description: PUA - Advanced IP Scanner Execution: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\advanced_port_scanner" OR process.name ICONTAINS "advanced_port_scanner" OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Advanced Port Scanner" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/portable", "/lng"])
description: PUA - Advanced Port Scanner Execution: Detects the use of Advanced Port Scanner.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("AdvancedRun.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /EXEFilename ", " \/Run"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" \/WindowState 0", " \/RunAs ", " \/CommandLine "])
description: PUA - AdvancedRun Execution: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/EXEFilename", "/CommandLine"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /RunAs 8 ", " \/RunAs 4 ", " \/RunAs 10 ", " \/RunAs 11 "] OR process.cmd_line=/(.*\/RunAs\ 8$|.*\/RunAs\ 4$|.*\/RunAs\ 10$|.*\/RunAs\ 11$)/i))
description: PUA - AdvancedRun Suspicious Execution: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility in the context of the TrustedInstaller, SYSTEM, Local Service or Network Service accounts

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\chisel\.exe$/i OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["exe client ", "exe server "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-socks5", "-reverse", " r:", ":127.0.0.1:", "-tls-skip-verify ", ":socks"]))
description: PUA - Chisel Tunneling Tool Execution: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SepRemovalToolNative_x64\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\CATClean\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--uninstall" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\NetInstaller\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-r" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\WFPUnins\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/uninstall", "/enterprise"])
description: PUA - CleanWipe Execution: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Crassus\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Crassus.exe") OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Crassus")
description: PUA - Crassus Execution: Detects Crassus, a Windows privilege escalation discovery tool, based on PE metadata characteristics.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\csexec\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("csexec"))
description: PUA - CsExec Execution: Detects the use of the lesser known remote execution tool named CsExec a PsExec alternative

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\DefenderCheck\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("DefenderCheck"))
description: PUA - DefenderCheck Execution: Detects the use of DefenderCheck, a tool to evaluate the signatures used in Microsoft Defender. It can be used to figure out the strings / byte chains used in Microsoft Defender to detect a tool and thus used for AV evasion.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ditsnap\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ditsnap.exe")
description: PUA - DIT Snapshot Viewer: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool, an inspection tool for Active Directory database, ntds.dit.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\frpc\.exe$|.*\\frps\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\frpc.ini" OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=7D9C233B8C9E3F0EA290D2B84593C842", "SHA1=06DDC9280E1F1810677935A2477012960905942F", "SHA256=57B0936B8D336D8E981C169466A15A5FD21A7D5A2C7DAF62D5E142EE860E387C"])
description: PUA - Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) Execution: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\iox\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe fwd -l ", ".exe fwd -r ", ".exe proxy -l ", ".exe proxy -r "] OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=9DB2D314DD3F704A02051EF5EA210993", "SHA1=039130337E28A6623ECF9A0A3DA7D92C5964D8DD", "SHA256=C6CF82919B809967D9D90EA73772A8AA1C1EB3BC59252D977500F64F1A0D6731"])
description: PUA- IOX Tunneling Tool Execution: Detects the use of IOX - a tool for port forwarding and intranet proxy purposes

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\kdu\.exe$|.*\\hamakaze\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("hamakaze.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-map ", "-prv ", "-dse ", "-ps "]))
description:
PUA - Kernel Driver Utility (KDU) Execution: Detects execution of the Kernel Driver Utility (KDU) tool.
KDU can be used to bypass driver signature enforcement and load unsigned or malicious drivers into the Windows kernel.
Potentially allowing for privilege escalation, persistence, or evasion of security controls.

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "Mouse Lock" OR process.exe_file.author ICONTAINS "Misc314" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Mouse Lock_")
description: PUA - Mouse Lock Execution: In Kaspersky's 2020 Incident Response Analyst Report they listed legitimate tool "Mouse Lock" as being used for both credential access and collection in security incidents.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\nc\.exe$|.*\\ncat\.exe$|.*\\netcat\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -lvp ", " -lvnp", " -l -v -p ", " -lv -p ", " -l --proxy-type http ", " -vnl --exec ", " -vnl -e ", " --lua-exec ", " --sh-exec "])
description: PUA - Netcat Suspicious Execution: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\netscan\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Network Scanner") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Application for scanning networks"))
description:
PUA - SoftPerfect Netscan Execution: Detects usage of SoftPerfect's "netscan.exe". An application for scanning networks.
It is actively used in-the-wild by threat actors to inspect and understand the network architecture of a victim.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" tcp 139", " tcp 445", " tcp 3389", " tcp 5985", " tcp 5986"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" start ", "--all", "--config", ".yml"] OR process.exe_path=/.*ngrok\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" tcp ", " http ", " authtoken "]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe authtoken ", ".exe start --all"])
description:
PUA - Ngrok Execution: Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available.
Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\nimgrab\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=2DD44C3C29D667F5C0EF5F9D7C7FFB8B", "SHA256=F266609E91985F0FE3E31C5E8FAEEEC4FFA5E0322D8B6F15FE69F4C5165B9559", "IMPHASH=C07FDDD21D123EA9B3A08EEF44AAAC45"])
description: PUA - Nimgrab Execution: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\NimScan\.exe$/i OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=41BB1C7571B3A724EB83A1D2B96DBB8C", "IMPHASH=B1B6ADACB172795480179EFD18A29549", "IMPHASH=0D1F896DC7642AD8384F9042F30279C2"])
description:
PUA - NimScan Execution: Detects usage of NimScan, a portscanner utility.
In early 2025, adversaries were observed using this utility to scan for open ports on remote hosts in a compromised environment.
This rule identifies the execution of NimScan based on the process image name and specific hash values associated with different versions of the tool.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\NirCmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("NirCmd.exe") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" execmd ", ".exe script ", ".exe shexec ", " runinteractive "] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" exec ", " exec2 "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" show ", " hide "]))
description: PUA - NirCmd Execution: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " runassystem ")
description: PUA - NirCmd Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\nmap\.exe$|.*\\zennmap\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["nmap.exe", "zennmap.exe"])
description: PUA - Nmap/Zenmap Execution: Detects usage of namp/zenmap. Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\npc\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -server=", " -vkey=", " -password="] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -config=npc" OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=AE8ACF66BFE3A44148964048B826D005", "SHA1=CEA49E9B9B67F3A13AD0BE1C2655293EA3C18181", "SHA256=5A456283392FFCEEEACA3D3426C306EB470304637520D72FED1CC1FEBBBD6856"])
description: PUA - NPS Tunneling Tool Execution: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\NSudo\.exe$|.*\\NSudoLC\.exe$|.*\\NSudoLG\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["NSudo.exe", "NSudoLC.exe", "NSudoLG.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-U:S ", "-U:T ", "-U:E ", "-P:E ", "-M:S ", "-M:H ", "-U=S ", "-U=T ", "-U=E ", "-P=E ", "-M=S ", "-M=H ", "-ShowWindowMode:Hide"]))
description: PUA - NSudo Execution: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution

query: where(Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=f741f25ac909ee434e50812d436c73ff", "MD5=d40acbfc29ee24388262e3d8be16f622", "MD5=01bb2c16fadb992fa66228cd02d45c60", "MD5=9e1b18e62e42b5444fc55b51e640355b", "SHA256=d654f870436d63c9d8e4390d9d4d898abdf0456736c7654d71cdf81a299c3f87", "SHA256=63fbfabd4d8afb497dee47d112eb9d683671b75a8bf6407c4bd5027fd211b892", "SHA256=47028053f05188e6a366fff19bedbcad2bc4daba8ff9e4df724b77d0181b7054", "SHA256=7c1b1e8c880a30c43b3a52ee245f963a977e1f40284f4b83f4b9afe3821753dd"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\PingCastle\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PingCastle.exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Ping Castle") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--scanner aclcheck", "--scanner antivirus", "--scanner computerversion", "--scanner foreignusers", "--scanner laps_bitlocker", "--scanner localadmin", "--scanner nullsession", "--scanner nullsession-trust", "--scanner oxidbindings", "--scanner remote", "--scanner share", "--scanner smb", "--scanner smb3querynetwork", "--scanner spooler", "--scanner startup", "--scanner zerologon"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--no-enum-limit" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--level Full"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--server "])
description: PUA - PingCastle Execution: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level.

query: where((parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".bat", ".chm", ".cmd", ".hta", ".htm", ".html", ".js", ".lnk", ".ps1", ".vbe", ".vbs", ".wsf"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\Temporary Internet"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favorites\\"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favourites\\"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Contacts\\"]) AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".bat", ".chm", ".cmd", ".hta", ".htm", ".html", ".js", ".lnk", ".ps1", ".vbe", ".vbs", ".wsf"]) AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\PingCastle\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("PingCastle.exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Ping Castle") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--scanner aclcheck", "--scanner antivirus", "--scanner computerversion", "--scanner foreignusers", "--scanner laps_bitlocker", "--scanner localadmin", "--scanner nullsession", "--scanner nullsession-trust", "--scanner oxidbindings", "--scanner remote", "--scanner share", "--scanner smb", "--scanner smb3querynetwork", "--scanner spooler", "--scanner startup", "--scanner zerologon"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--no-enum-limit" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--level Full"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--server "]))
description: PUA - PingCastle Execution From Potentially Suspicious Parent: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level via a script located in a potentially suspicious or uncommon location.

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\ProcessHacker_" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\ProcessHacker\.exe$/i OR process.name IIN ["ProcessHacker.exe", "Process Hacker"] OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Process Hacker") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Process Hacker") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=68F9B52895F4D34E74112F3129B3B00D", "MD5=B365AF317AE730A67C936F21432B9C71", "SHA1=A0BDFAC3CE1880B32FF9B696458327CE352E3B1D", "SHA1=C5E2018BF7C0F314FED4FD7FE7E69FA2E648359E", "SHA256=D4A0FE56316A2C45B9BA9AC1005363309A3EDC7ACF9E4DF64D326A0FF273E80F", "SHA256=BD2C2CF0631D881ED382817AFCCE2B093F4E412FFB170A719E2762F250ABFEA4", "IMPHASH=3695333C60DEDECDCAFF1590409AA462", "IMPHASH=04DE0AD9C37EB7BD52043D2ECAC958DF"])
description:
PUA - Process Hacker Execution: Detects the execution of Process Hacker based on binary metadata information (Image, Hash, Imphash, etc).
Process Hacker is a tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level options.
Threat actors abused older vulnerable versions to manipulate system processes.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Radmin Viewer") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Radmin Viewer") OR process.name = NOCASE("Radmin.exe"))
description: PUA - Radmin Viewer Utility Execution: Detects the execution of Radmin which can be abused by an adversary to remotely control Windows machines

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\rcedit\-x64\.exe$|.*\\rcedit\-x86\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Edit resources of exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("rcedit")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--set-" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["OriginalFileName", "CompanyName", "FileDescription", "ProductName", "ProductVersion", "LegalCopyright"]))
description: PUA - Potential PE Metadata Tamper Using Rcedit: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--config ", "--no-check-certificate ", " copy "] OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\rclone\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Rsync for cloud storage")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["pass", "user", "copy", "sync", "config", "lsd", "remote", "ls", "mega", "pcloud", "ftp", "ignore-existing", "auto-confirm", "transfers", "multi-thread-streams", "no-check-certificate "]))
description: PUA - Rclone Execution: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--password-file", "init", " -r "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--use-fs-snapshot", "backup", " -r "] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["sftp:", "rest:http", "s3:s3.", "s3.http", "azure:", " gs:", "rclone:", "swift:", " b2:"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" init ", " -r "])
description:
PUA - Restic Backup Tool Execution: Detects the execution of the Restic backup tool, which can be used for data exfiltration.
Threat actors may leverage Restic to back up and exfiltrate sensitive data to remote storage locations, including cloud services.
If not legitimately used in the enterprise environment, its presence may indicate malicious activity.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /account=system ", " \/account=ti "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\/exec=")
description: PUA - RunXCmd Execution: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\Seatbelt\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Seatbelt.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Seatbelt") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" DpapiMasterKeys", " InterestingProcesses", " InterestingFiles", " CertificateThumbprints", " ChromiumBookmarks", " ChromiumHistory", " ChromiumPresence", " CloudCredentials", " CredEnum", " CredGuard", " FirefoxHistory", " ProcessCreationEvents"] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -group=misc", " -group=remote", " -group=chromium", " -group=slack", " -group=system", " -group=user", " -group=all"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -outputfile=")
description: PUA - Seatbelt Execution: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SystemInformer\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SystemInformer.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("System Informer") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("System Informer") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["MD5=19426363A37C03C3ED6FEDF57B6696EC", "SHA1=8B12C6DA8FAC0D5E8AB999C31E5EA04AF32D53DC", "SHA256=8EE9D84DE50803545937A63C686822388A3338497CDDB660D5D69CF68B68F287", "IMPHASH=B68908ADAEB5D662F87F2528AF318F12"])
description: PUA - System Informer Execution: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\trufflehog\.exe$/i OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" docker --image ", " Git ", " GitHub ", " Jira ", " Slack ", " Confluence ", " SharePoint ", " s3 ", " gcs "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " --results=verified")
description:
PUA - TruffleHog Execution: Detects execution of TruffleHog, a tool used to search for secrets in different platforms like Git, Jira, Slack, SharePoint, etc. that could be used maliciously.
While it is a legitimate tool, intended for use in CI pipelines and security assessments,
It was observed in the Shai-Hulud malware campaign targeting npm packages to steal sensitive information.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Web Browser Password Viewer") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\WebBrowserPassView\.exe$/i)
description: PUA - WebBrowserPassView Execution: Detects the execution of WebBrowserPassView.exe. A password recovery tool that reveals the passwords stored by the following Web browsers, Internet Explorer (Version 4.0 - 11.0), Mozilla Firefox (All Versions), Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\wsudo\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wsudo.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Windows sudo utility") OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\wsudo\-bridge\.exe$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-u System", "-uSystem", "-u TrustedInstaller", "-uTrustedInstaller", " --ti "])
description: PUA - Wsudo Suspicious Execution: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\python\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "adidnsdump")
description:
PUA - Adidnsdump Execution: This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed,
Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("python.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*python\.exe$|.*python3\.exe$|.*python2\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c" AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Python", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Python"]) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\python\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-E -s -m ensurepip -U --default-pip" OR (parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Python", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Python"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-W ignore::DeprecationWarning", """['install', '--no-cache-dir', '--no-index', '--find-links',""", """'--upgrade', 'pip'"""]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\AppData\\Local\\Programs\\Microsoft\ VS\ Code\\Code\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Program Files\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["<pip-setuptools-caller>", "exec(compile("]))
description: Python Inline Command Execution: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*python\.exe$|.*python3\.exe$|.*python2\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["import pty", ".spawn("] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "from pty import spawn"))
description: Python Spawning Pretty TTY on Windows: Detects python spawning a pretty tty

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-m 1M", "-m 2M", "-m 3M"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["restrict=off", "-netdev ", "connect=", "-nographic"] AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -cdrom ", " type=virt ", " -blockdev "]))
description:
Potentially Suspicious Usage Of Qemu: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Qemu utility in a Windows environment.
Threat actors have leveraged this utility and this technique for achieving network access as reported by Kaspersky.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*:\\Windows\\System32\\query\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["session >", "process >"]))
description: Query Usage To Exfil Data: Detects usage of "query.exe" a system binary to exfil information such as "sessions" and "processes" for later use

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\QuickAssist\.exe$/i)
description: QuickAssist Execution: Detects the execution of Microsoft Quick Assist tool "QuickAssist.exe". This utility can be used by attackers to gain remote access.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\rar\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " a ")
description: Files Added To An Archive Using Rar.EXE: Detects usage of "rar" to add files to an archive for potential compression. An adversary may compress data (e.g. sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -hp" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -m", " a "]))
description: Rar Usage with Password and Compression Level: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rar\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Command line RAR") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".exe a ", " a -m"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -hp", " -r "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" ?:\\*.", " ?:\\\*.", " ?:\$Recycle.bin\\", " ?:\PerfLogs\\", " ?:\Temp", " ?:\Users\Public\\", " ?:\Windows\\", " %public%"]))
description: Suspicious Greedy Compression Using Rar.EXE: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*rasdial\.exe$/i)
description: Suspicious RASdial Activity: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["wmic.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["rdtoggle", "Win32_TerminalServiceSetting"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SetAllowTSConnections")
description:
RDP Enable or Disable via Win32_TerminalServiceSetting WMI Class: Detects enabling or disabling of Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) using alternate methods such as WMIC or PowerShell.
In PowerShell one-liner commands, the "SetAllowTSConnections" method of the "Win32_TerminalServiceSetting" class may be used to enable or disable RDP.
In WMIC, the "rdtoggle" alias or "Win32_TerminalServiceSetting" class may be used for the same purpose.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rdrleakdiag\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RdrLeakDiag.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-memdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/memdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“memdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”memdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•memdmp" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "fullmemdmp") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -o " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /o " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“o " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”o " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•o " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -p " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/p " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“p " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”p " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•p "))
description: Process Memory Dump via RdrLeakDiag.EXE: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reagentc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reagentc.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-disable" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/disable" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“disable" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”disable" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•disable"))
description:
Windows Recovery Environment Disabled Via Reagentc: Detects attempts to disable windows recovery environment using Reagentc.
ReAgentc.exe is a command-line tool in Windows used to manage the Windows Recovery Environment (WinRE).
It allows users to enable, disable, and configure WinRE, which is used for troubleshooting and repairing common boot issues.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg", " add "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\Software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run"]))
description: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SafeBoot" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" copy ", " add "]))
description: Add SafeBoot Keys Via Reg Utility: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["REG", "ADD", "\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\FVE", "/v", "/f"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["EnableBDEWithNoTPM", "UseAdvancedStartup", "UseTPM", "UseTPMKey", "UseTPMKeyPIN", "RecoveryKeyMessageSource", "UseTPMPIN", "RecoveryKeyMessage"]))
description: Suspicious Reg Add BitLocker: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa", "scecli\0", "reg add"])
description: Dropping Of Password Filter DLL: Detects dropping of dll files in system32 that may be used to retrieve user credentials from LSASS

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender\Exclusions\Paths", "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Antimalware\Exclusions\Paths"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ADD ", "/t ", "REG_DWORD ", "/v ", "/d ", "0"])
description: Suspicious Windows Defender Folder Exclusion Added Via Reg.EXE: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to add Defender folder exclusions. Qbot has been seen using this technique to add exclusions for folders within AppData and ProgramData.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" del", "\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\RunMRU"])
description:
RunMRU Registry Key Deletion: Detects deletion of the RunMRU registry key, which stores the history of commands executed via the Run dialog.
In the clickfix techniques, the phishing lures instruct users to open a run dialog through (Win + R) and execute malicious commands.
Adversaries may delete this key to cover their tracks after executing commands.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" delete ", "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SafeBoot"])
description: SafeBoot Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " delete " AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\\")
description: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "add" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Control Panel\Desktop", "CurrentVersion\Policies\ActiveDesktop", "CurrentVersion\Policies\System"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v NoChangingWallpaper", "/d 1"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v Wallpaper", "/t REG_SZ"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v WallpaperStyle", "/d 2"]))
description:
Potentially Suspicious Desktop Background Change Using Reg.EXE: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" to alter registry keys that would replace the user's desktop background.
This is a common technique used by malware to change the desktop background to a ransom note or other image.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "add" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\software\WOW6432Node\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run", "\software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer\Run", "\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Userinit", "\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\Shell", "\software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows", "\system\CurrentControlSet\Control\SafeBoot\AlternateShell"]))
description: Direct Autorun Keys Modification: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Control\WMI\Autologger\DefenderApiLogger\Start", "\Control\WMI\Autologger\DefenderAuditLogger\Start"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["add", "0"] AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "0x00000001")
description:
Disabling Windows Defender WMI Autologger Session via Reg.exe: Detects the use of reg.exe to disable the Event Tracing for Windows (ETW) Autologger session for Windows Defender API and Audit events.
By setting the 'Start' value to '0' for the 'DefenderApiLogger' or 'DefenderAuditLogger' session, an attacker can prevent these critical security events
from being logged, effectively blinding monitoring tools that rely on this data. This is a powerful defense evasion technique.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg", "add"] AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["d 4", "v Start"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppIDSvc", "\MsMpSvc", "\NisSrv", "\SecurityHealthService", "\Sense", "\UsoSvc", "\WdBoot", "\WdFilter", "\WdNisDrv", "\WdNisSvc", "\WinDefend", "\wscsvc", "\wuauserv"]))
description: Security Service Disabled Via Reg.EXE: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" save ", " export ", " Ë¢ave ", " eË£port "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["hklm", "hkËªm", "hkey_local_machine", "hkey_Ëªocal_machine", "hkey_locaËª_machine", "hkey_ËªocaËª_machine"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\system", "\sam", "\security", "\Ë¢ystem", "\syË¢tem", "\Ë¢yË¢tem", "\Ë¢am", "\Ë¢ecurity"]))
description: Dumping of Sensitive Hives Via Reg.EXE: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives. This includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY hives.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Microsoft\Windows\WindowsAI", "DisableAIDataAnalysis"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["add", "0"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "delete"))
description:
Windows Recall Feature Enabled Via Reg.EXE: Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation.
Windows Recall can be enabled by deleting the existing "DisableAIDataAnalysis" value, or setting it to 0.
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" query ", "/t ", "REG_SZ", "/s"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/f ", "HKLM"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/f ", "HKCU"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "HKCU\Software\SimonTatham\PuTTY\Sessions"))
description:
Enumeration for Credentials in Registry: Adversaries may search the Registry on compromised systems for insecurely stored credentials.
The Windows Registry stores configuration information that can be used by the system or other programs.
Adversaries may query the Registry looking for credentials and passwords that have been stored for use by other programs or services

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " import " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Users\\", "%temp%", "%tmp%", "%appdata%", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "C:\Windows\Temp\\", "C:\ProgramData\\"]))
description: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa", "DisableRestrictedAdmin"])
description:
RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering - ProcCreation: Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", " /d 0", " \/v RunAsPPL "])
description: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Cryptography", "/v ", "MachineGuid"])
description: Suspicious Query of MachineGUID: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["GroupPolicyRefreshTimeDC", "GroupPolicyRefreshTimeOffsetDC", "GroupPolicyRefreshTime", "GroupPolicyRefreshTimeOffset", "EnableSmartScreen", "ShellSmartScreenLevel"]))
description: Modify Group Policy Settings: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\System\CurrentControlSet\Control\Lsa", "NoLMHash", " 0"])
description:
Enable LM Hash Storage - ProcCreation: Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes.
By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "query" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["currentVersion\windows", "winlogon\\", "currentVersion\shellServiceObjectDelayLoad", "currentVersion\run", "currentVersion\policies\explorer\run", "currentcontrolset\services"]))
description: Potential Configuration And Service Reconnaissance Via Reg.EXE: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to query reconnaissance information from the registry. Adversaries may interact with the Windows registry to gather information about credentials, the system, configuration, and installed software.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", "\CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server", "REG_DWORD", " /f"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Licensing Core", "EnableConcurrentSessions"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["AllowTSConnections", "fDenyTSConnections", "fEnableWinStation", "fSingleSessionPerUser", "IdleWinStationPoolCount", "MaxInstanceCount", "SecurityLayer", "TSAdvertise", "TSAppCompat", "TSEnabled", "TSUserEnabled", "WinStations\RDP-Tcp"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["SecurityLayer", "02"]))
description: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop", "HKCU\Control Panel\Desktop"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v ScreenSaveActive", "/t REG_SZ", "/d 1", "/f"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v ScreenSaveTimeout", "/t REG_SZ", "/d ", "/f"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v ScreenSaverIsSecure", "/t REG_SZ", "/d 0", "/f"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/v SCRNSAVE.EXE", "/t REG_SZ", "/d ", ".scr", "/f"]))
description:
Suspicious ScreenSave Change by Reg.exe: Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["add ", "SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\\", " ImagePath "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -d " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /d " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“d " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”d " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•d "))
description:
Changing Existing Service ImagePath Value Via Reg.EXE: Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start.
Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["query", "\software\\", "/v", "svcversion"])
description: Detected Windows Software Discovery: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppDataLow\Software\Microsoft\\", "\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\OOBE", "\Policies\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon", "\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\Currentversion\Winlogon", "\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest", "\Microsoft\Windows Defender\\"]))
description: Reg Add Suspicious Paths: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Services\VSS\Diag", "/d Disabled"])
description: Disabled Volume Snapshots: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows Defender\\", "SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender Security Center", "SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows Defender\\"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", "d 0"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["DisallowExploitProtectionOverride", "EnableControlledFolderAccess", "MpEnablePus", "PUAProtection", "SpynetReporting", "SubmitSamplesConsent", "TamperProtection"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" add ", "d 1"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["DisableAccess", "DisableAntiSpyware", "DisableAntiSpywareRealtimeProtection", "DisableAntiVirus", "DisableAntiVirusSignatures", "DisableArchiveScanning", "DisableBehaviorMonitoring", "DisableBlockAtFirstSeen", "DisableCloudProtection", "DisableConfig", "DisableEnhancedNotifications", "DisableIntrusionPreventionSystem", "DisableIOAVProtection", "DisableNetworkProtection", "DisableOnAccessProtection", "DisablePrivacyMode", "DisableRealtimeMonitoring", "DisableRoutinelyTakingAction", "DisableScanOnRealtimeEnable", "DisableScriptScanning", "DisableSecurityCenter", "Notification_Suppress", "SignatureDisableUpdateOnStartupWithoutEngine"])))
description: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\System\CurrentControlSet\Control", "Write Protection", "0", "storage"])
description:
Write Protect For Storage Disabled: Detects applications trying to modify the registry in order to disable any write-protect property for storage devices.
This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\RegAsm\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RegAsm.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*RegAsm$|.*RegAsm\.exe$|.*RegAsm\.exe"$|.*RegAsm\.exe'$)/i))
description:
RegAsm.EXE Execution Without CommandLine Flags or Files: Detects the execution of "RegAsm.exe" without a commandline flag or file, which might indicate potential process injection activity.
Usually "RegAsm.exe" should point to a dedicated DLL file or call the help with the "/?" flag.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\Regsvcs\.exe$|.*\\Regasm\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["RegSvcs.exe", "RegAsm.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".dat", ".gif", ".jpeg", ".jpg", ".png", ".txt"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs With Uncommon Extension: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities with an uncommon extension.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\Regsvcs\.exe$|.*\\Regasm\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["RegSvcs.exe", "RegAsm.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\\", "\PerfLogs\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs From Uncommon Location: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities from a potentially suspicious location

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGEDIT.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•E ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["hklm", "hkey_local_machine"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\\system$|.*\\sam$|.*\\security$)/i))
description: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGEDIT.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”E " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•E ") AND NOT ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["hklm", "hkey_local_machine"]) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\\system$|.*\\sam$|.*\\security$)/i)))
description: Exports Registry Key To a File: Detects the export of the target Registry key to a file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGEDIT.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /i ", " /s ", ".reg"]) AND NOT ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c ") AND process.cmd_line=/:[^ \\]/i))
description: Imports Registry Key From a File: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGEDIT.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /i ", ".reg"]) AND process.cmd_line=/:[^ \\]/i AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•e " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•a " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c "))
description: Imports Registry Key From an ADS: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\regedit\.exe$/i AND (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\TrustedInstaller\.exe$|.*\\ProcessHacker\.exe$)/i))
description: Regedit as Trusted Installer: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regini\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGINI.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line=/:[^ \\]/i)
description: Suspicious Registry Modification From ADS Via Regini.EXE: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regini\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGINI.EXE")) AND NOT process.cmd_line=/:[^ \\]/i)
description: Registry Modification Via Regini.EXE: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\register\-cimprovider\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-path", "dll"])
description: DLL Execution Via Register-cimprovider.exe: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Software\Aerofox\Foxmail\V3.1", "\Software\Aerofox\FoxmailPreview", "\Software\DownloadManager\Passwords", "\Software\FTPWare\COREFTP\Sites", "\Software\IncrediMail\Identities", "\Software\Martin Prikryl\WinSCP 2\Sessions", "\Software\Mobatek\MobaXterm\\", "\Software\OpenSSH\Agent\Keys", "\Software\OpenVPN-GUI\configs", "\Software\ORL\WinVNC3\Password", "\Software\Qualcomm\Eudora\CommandLine", "\Software\RealVNC\WinVNC4", "\Software\RimArts\B2\Settings", "\Software\SimonTatham\PuTTY\Sessions", "\Software\SimonTatham\PuTTY\SshHostKeys\\", "\Software\Sota\FFFTP", "\Software\TightVNC\Server", "\Software\WOW6432Node\Radmin\v3.0\Server\Parameters\Radmin"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*reg\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["export", "save"])))
description: Enumeration for 3rd Party Creds From CLI: Detects processes that query known 3rd party registry keys that holds credentials via commandline

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["save", "export"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Software\Aerofox\Foxmail\V3.1", "\Software\Aerofox\FoxmailPreview", "\Software\DownloadManager\Passwords", "\Software\FTPWare\COREFTP\Sites", "\Software\IncrediMail\Identities", "\Software\Martin Prikryl\WinSCP 2\Sessions", "\Software\Mobatek\MobaXterm", "\Software\OpenSSH\Agent\Keys", "\Software\OpenVPN-GUI\configs", "\Software\ORL\WinVNC3\Password", "\Software\Qualcomm\Eudora\CommandLine", "\Software\RealVNC\WinVNC4", "\Software\RimArts\B2\Settings", "\Software\SimonTatham\PuTTY\Sessions", "\Software\SimonTatham\PuTTY\SshHostKeys", "\Software\Sota\FFFTP", "\Software\TightVNC\Server", "\Software\WOW6432Node\Radmin\v3.0\Server\Parameters\Radmin"]))
description:
Registry Export of Third-Party Credentials: Detects the use of reg.exe to export registry paths associated with third-party credentials.
Credential stealers have been known to use this technique to extract sensitive information from the registry.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ZoneMap\ProtocolDefaults", "http", " 0"])
description: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols Via CLI: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\CurrentVersion\Image File Execution Options\\" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["sethc.exe", "utilman.exe", "osk.exe", "magnify.exe", "narrator.exe", "displayswitch.exe", "atbroker.exe", "HelpPane.exe"]))
description: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "UserInitMprLogonScript")
description: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - CommandLine: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\System\CurrentControlSet\Services\\", "\NetworkProvider"])
description: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - CLI: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Microsoft\Office\\", "\Excel\Security", "PythonFunctionWarnings"] AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " 0")
description:
Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel: Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Provisioning\Commands\\")
description: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\ShellIds\Microsoft.PowerShell\ExecutionPolicy", "\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\PowerShell\ExecutionPolicy"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Bypass", "RemoteSigned", "Unrestricted"]))
description: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\UserList", "add", "/v", "/d 0"])
description: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key - CommandLine: Detects changes to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Explorer\TypedPaths")
description: Persistence Via TypedPaths - CommandLine: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry via the commandline. Which might indicate persistence attempt

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -i:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /i:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“i:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”i:" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•i:") AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”n " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•n ")
description: Potential Regsvr32 Commandline Flag Anomaly: Detects a potential command line flag anomaly related to "regsvr32" in which the "/i" flag is used without the "/n" which should be uncommon.
Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGSVR32.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /i", " -i"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ftp", "http"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP/FTP Pattern: Detects regsvr32 execution to download/install/register new DLLs that are hosted on Web or FTP servers.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\REGSVR32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \\")
description: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution From Remote Share: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\explorer\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\nltest\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\werfault\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\werfault\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -u -p "))
description: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of Regsvr32: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGSVR32.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\"]))
description: Regsvr32 Execution From Potential Suspicious Location: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a potentially suspicious location.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGSVR32.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\PerfLogs\\", ":\Temp\\", "\Windows\Registration\CRMLog", "\Windows\System32\com\dmp\\", "\Windows\System32\FxsTmp\\", "\Windows\System32\Microsoft\Crypto\RSA\MachineKeys\\", "\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\color\\", "\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS\\", "\Windows\System32\spool\SERVERS\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks_Migrated\\", "\Windows\System32\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\SyncCenter\\", "\Windows\SysWOW64\com\dmp\\", "\Windows\SysWOW64\FxsTmp\\", "\Windows\SysWOW64\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\PLA\System\\", "\Windows\SysWOW64\Tasks\Microsoft\Windows\SyncCenter\\", "\Windows\Tasks\\", "\Windows\Tracing\\"] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [' "C:\\', " C:\\", """ 'C:\""", "D:\\"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\\", "C:\Program Files\\", "C:\ProgramData\\", "C:\Users\\", " C:\Windows\\", ' "C:\Windows\\', """ 'C:\Windows\"""])) AND NOT (process.cmd_line = NOCASE("") OR process.cmd_line = null))
description: Regsvr32 Execution From Highly Suspicious Location: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGSVR32.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\.bin$|.*\.bmp$|.*\.cr2$|.*\.dat$|.*\.eps$|.*\.gif$|.*\.ico$|.*\.jpeg$|.*\.jpg$|.*\.log$|.*\.nef$|.*\.orf$|.*\.png$|.*\.raw$|.*\.rtf$|.*\.sr2$|.*\.temp$|.*\.tif$|.*\.tiff$|.*\.tmp$|.*\.txt$)/i))
description: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Suspicious File Extension: Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe") AND process.cmd_line=/.*\ \/s\ C:\\Windows\\System32\\RpcProxy\\RpcProxy\.dll$/i))
description: Scripting/CommandLine Process Spawned Regsvr32: Detects various command line and scripting engines/processes such as "PowerShell", "Wscript", "Cmd", etc. spawning a "regsvr32" instance.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("REGSVR32.EXE")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".ax", ".cpl", ".dll", ".ocx"] OR process.cmd_line = null OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".ppl", ".bav"]))
description: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Uncommon Extension: Detects a "regsvr32" execution where the DLL doesn't contain a common file extension.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\AnyDesk\.exe$|.*\\AnyDeskMSI\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("AnyDesk Software GmbH"))
description:
Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/c ", "echo ", ".exe --set-password"])
description: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Piped Password Via CLI: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\AnyDesk\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("AnyDesk Software GmbH")) AND (process.exe_file.version ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["7.0.", "7.1.", "8.0.1", "8.0.2", "8.0.3", "8.0.4", "8.0.5", "8.0.6", "8.0.7"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" --remove", " --uninstall"]))
description:
Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution With Known Revoked Signing Certificate: Detects the execution of an AnyDesk binary with a version prior to 8.0.8.
Prior to version 8.0.8, the Anydesk application used a signing certificate that got compromised by threat actors.
Use this rule to detect instances of older versions of Anydesk using the compromised certificate
This is recommended in order to avoid attackers leveraging the certificate and signing their binaries to bypass detections.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--install", "--start-with-win", "--silent"])
description: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\AnyDesk\.exe$|.*\\AnyDeskMSI\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("AnyDesk") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("AnyDesk Software GmbH")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\\", "Program Files (x86)\AnyDesk", "Program Files\AnyDesk"]))
description:
Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("GoTo Opener") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("GoTo Opener") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("LogMeIn, Inc."))
description:
Remote Access Tool - GoToAssist Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("LMIGuardianSvc") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("LMIGuardianSvc") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("LogMeIn, Inc."))
description:
Remote Access Tool - LogMeIn Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--meshServiceName")
description:
Remote Access Tool - Potential MeshAgent Execution - Windows: Detects potential execution of MeshAgent which is a tool used for remote access.
Historical data shows that threat actors rename MeshAgent binary to evade detection.
Matching command lines with the '--meshServiceName' argument can indicate that the MeshAgent is being used for remote access.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\meshagent\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i))
description:
Remote Access Tool - MeshAgent Command Execution via MeshCentral: Detects the use of MeshAgent to execute commands on the target host, particularly when threat actors might abuse it to execute commands directly.
MeshAgent can execute commands on the target host by leveraging win-console to obscure their activities and win-dispatcher to run malicious code through IPC with child processes.

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("NetSupport Client Configurator") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("NetSupport Remote Control") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("NetSupport Ltd") OR process.name = NOCASE("PCICFGUI.EXE"))
description:
Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\client32\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "NetSupport Remote Control" OR process.name ICONTAINS "client32.exe" OR Hashes ICONTAINS "IMPHASH=a9d50692e95b79723f3e76fcf70d023e") AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\\"]))
description: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--meshServiceName" OR process.name ICONTAINS "meshagent") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\meshagent\.exe$/i)
description:
Remote Access Tool - Renamed MeshAgent Execution - Windows: Detects the execution of a renamed instance of the Remote Monitoring and Management (RMM) tool, MeshAgent.
RMM tools such as MeshAgent are commonly utilized by IT administrators for legitimate remote support and system management.
However, malicious actors may exploit these tools by renaming them to bypass detection mechanisms, enabling unauthorized access and control over compromised systems.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\rutserv\.exe$|.*\\rfusclient\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Remote Utilities")) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Remote Utilities", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Remote Utilities"]))
description: Remote Access Tool - RURAT Execution From Unusual Location: Detects execution of Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

query: where(process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("ScreenConnect Service") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("ScreenConnect") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("ScreenConnect Software"))
description:
Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["e=Access&", "y=Guest&", "&p=", "&c=", "&k="])
description: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Installation Execution: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to a system.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\ScreenConnect\.ClientService\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\TEMP\ScreenConnect\\")
description: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Remote Command Execution: Detects the execution of a system command via the ScreenConnect RMM service.

query: where(parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Windows\TEMP\ScreenConnect\\", "run.cmd"] AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\nltest\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wevtutil\.exe$)/i))
description: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Potential Suspicious Remote Command Execution: Detects potentially suspicious child processes launched via the ScreenConnect client service.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\ScreenConnect\.Service\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\csc\.exe$)/i))
description: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Server Web Shell Execution: Detects potential web shell execution from the ScreenConnect server process.

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\JWrapper-Remote Access\\", "\JWrapper-Remote Support\\"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\SimpleService\.exe$/i)
description:
Remote Access Tool - Simple Help Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
