query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\TacticalAgent\tacticalrmm.exe" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--api", "--auth", "--client-id", "--site-id", "--agent-type"])
description:
Remote Access Tool - TacticalRMM Agent Registration to Potentially Attacker-Controlled Server: Detects TacticalRMM agent installations where the --api, --auth, and related flags are used on the command line.
These parameters configure the agent to connect to a specific RMM server with authentication, client ID, and site ID.
This technique could indicate a threat actor attempting to register the agent with an attacker-controlled RMM infrastructure silently.

query: where(process.exe_path = NOCASE("TeamViewer_Desktop.exe") AND parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("TeamViewer_Service.exe") AND process.cmd_line=/.*TeamViewer_Desktop\.exe\ \-\-IPCport\ 5939\ \-\-Module\ 1$/i)
description:
Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On Windows Host: Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host.
Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("UltraViewer") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("DucFabulous Co,ltd") OR process.name = NOCASE("UltraViewer_Desktop.exe"))
description:
Remote Access Tool - UltraViewer Execution: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "time" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\w32tm\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "tz")
description: Discovery of a System Time: Identifies use of various commands to query a systems time. This technique may be used before executing a scheduled task or to discover the time zone of a target system.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["domainlist", "trustdmp", "dcmodes", "adinfo", " dclist ", "computer_pwdnotreqd", "objectcategory=", "-subnets -f", 'name="Domain Admins"', "-sc u:", "domainncs", "dompol", " oudmp ", "subnetdmp", "gpodmp", "fspdmp", "users_noexpire", "computers_active", "computers_pwdnotreqd"] OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=BCA5675746D13A1F246E2DA3C2217492", "IMPHASH=53E117A96057EAF19C41380D0E87F1C2", "IMPHASH=d144de8117df2beceaba2201ad304764", "IMPHASH=12ce1c0f3f5837ecc18a3782408fa975", "IMPHASH=4fbf3f084fbbb2470b80b2013134df35", "IMPHASH=49b639b4acbecc49d72a01f357aa4930", "IMPHASH=680dad9e300346e05a85023965867201", "IMPHASH=21aa085d54992511b9f115355e468782"] OR process.name = NOCASE("AdFind.exe")) AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\AdFind\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed AdFind Execution: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.

query: where((process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "AutoHotkey" OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "AutoHotkey" OR process.name IIN ["AutoHotkey.exe", "AutoHotkey.rc"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AutoHotkey\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkey32\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkey32_UIA\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkey64\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkey64_UIA\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyA32\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyA32_UIA\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyU32\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyU32_UIA\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyU64\.exe$|.*\\AutoHotkeyU64_UIA\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\AutoHotkey"))
description: Renamed AutoHotkey.EXE Execution: Detects execution of a renamed autohotkey.exe binary based on PE metadata fields

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /AutoIt3ExecuteScript", " \/ErrorStdOut"] OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=FDC554B3A8683918D731685855683DDF", "IMPHASH=CD30A61B60B3D60CECDB034C8C83C290", "IMPHASH=F8A00C72F2D667D2EDBB234D0C0AE000"] OR process.name IIN ["AutoIt3.exe", "AutoIt2.exe", "AutoIt.exe"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\AutoIt\.exe$|.*\\AutoIt2\.exe$|.*\\AutoIt3_x64\.exe$|.*\\AutoIt3\.exe$)/i))
description:
Renamed AutoIt Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe.
AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks.
Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.

query: where((process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "CONHOST.EXE", "7z.exe", "7za.exe", "WinRAR.exe", "wevtutil.exe", "net.exe", "net1.exe", "netsh.exe", "InstallUtil.exe"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\conhost\.exe$|.*\\7z\.exe$|.*\\7za\.exe$|.*\\WinRAR\.exe$|.*\\wevtutil\.exe$|.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$|.*\\netsh\.exe$|.*\\InstallUtil\.exe$)/i))
description: Potential Defense Evasion Via Binary Rename: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

query: where((process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Execute processes remotely") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Sysinternals PsExec") OR process.exe_file.description ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["Windows PowerShell", "pwsh"] OR process.name IIN ["certutil.exe", "cmstp.exe", "cscript.exe", "IE4UINIT.EXE", "mshta.exe", "msiexec.exe", "msxsl.exe", "powershell_ise.exe", "powershell.exe", "psexec.c", "psexec.exe", "psexesvc.exe", "pwsh.dll", "reg.exe", "regsvr32.exe", "rundll32.exe", "WerMgr", "wmic.exe", "wscript.exe"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmstp\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\ie4uinit\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\msxsl\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\psexec\.exe$|.*\\psexec64\.exe$|.*\\PSEXESVC\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\reg\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wermgr\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("BOINC.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\BOINC\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed BOINC Client Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed BOINC binary.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("BrowserCore.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\BrowserCore\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed BrowserCore.EXE Execution: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)

"SHA256=d14c52d9220b606f428a8fe9f7c108b0d6f14cf71e7384749e98e6a95962e68f", "SHA256=d3a0e1a79158f3985cd49607ebe0cdfcc49cb9af96b8f43aefd0cdfe2f22e663", "SHA256=2fbbfc8299537ff80cadf9d0e27c223fe0ccb9052bf9d8763ad717bbfa521c77", "SHA256=19074674c6fbdaa573b3081745e5e26144fdf7a086d14e0e220d1814f1f13078"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cloudflared\.exe$|.*\\cloudflared\-windows\-386\.exe$|.*\\cloudflared\-windows\-amd64\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Cloudflared.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "cloudflared" binary.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("FX_VER_INTERNALNAME_STR") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -u ", " -f ", ".dmp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" --full ", " --name ", ".dmp"]) AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\createdump\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed CreateDump Utility Execution: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("curl.exe") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("The curl executable")) AND NOT process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\curl")
description: Renamed CURL.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "CURL.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields

query: where((Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=6834B1B94E49701D77CCB3C0895E1AFD", "IMPHASH=1BB6F93B129F398C7C4A76BB97450BBA", "IMPHASH=FAA2AC19875FADE461C8D89DCF2710A3", "IMPHASH=F1039CED4B91572AB7847D26032E6BBF"]) AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\dctask64\.exe$/i)
description:
Renamed ZOHO Dctask64 Execution: Detects a renamed "dctask64.exe" execution, a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("ftp.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\ftp\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed FTP.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "ftp.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("gpg.exe") AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\gpg\.exe$|.*\\gpg2\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Gpg.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "gpg.exe". Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

query: where((process.exe_file.description IIN ["Java Update Scheduler", "Java(TM) Update Scheduler"]) AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\jusched\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed Jusched.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "jusched.exe" as seen used by the cobalt group

query: where((process.name IIN ["mavinject32.exe", "mavinject64.exe"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\mavinject32\.exe$|.*\\mavinject64\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Mavinject.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the "Mavinject" process. Which can be abused to perform process injection using the "/INJECTRUNNING" flag

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("megasync.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\megasync\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed MegaSync Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed MegaSync.exe as seen used by ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("msdt.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\msdt\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed Msdt.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "Msdt.exe" binary

query: where((process.name IIN ["msteams.exe", "teams.exe"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\msteams\.exe$|.*\\teams\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Microsoft Teams Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed Microsoft Teams binary.

query: where((process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "NetSupport Remote Control" OR process.name ICONTAINS "client32.exe" OR Hashes ICONTAINS "IMPHASH=A9D50692E95B79723F3E76FCF70D023E") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\client32\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed NetSupport RAT Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "client32.exe" (NetSupport RAT) via Imphash, Product and OriginalFileName strings

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("NirCmd.exe") AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\nircmd\.exe$|.*\\nircmdc\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed NirCmd.EXE Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "NirCmd.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields.

query: where((process.name IIN ["Excel.exe", "MSACCESS.EXE", "MSPUB.EXE", "OneNote.exe", "OneNoteM.exe", "OUTLOOK.EXE", "POWERPNT.EXE", "WinWord.exe", "Olk.exe"] OR process.exe_file.description IIN ["Microsoft Access", "Microsoft Excel", "Microsoft OneNote", "Microsoft Outlook", "Microsoft PowerPoint", "Microsoft Publisher", "Microsoft Word", "Sent to OneNote Tool"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\EXCEL\.exe$|.*\\excelcnv\.exe$|.*\\MSACCESS\.exe$|.*\\MSPUB\.EXE$|.*\\ONENOTE\.EXE$|.*\\ONENOTEM\.EXE$|.*\\OUTLOOK\.EXE$|.*\\POWERPNT\.EXE$|.*\\WINWORD\.exe$|.*\\OLK\.EXE$)/i))
description: Renamed Office Binary Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed office binary

query: where((process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("PAExec Application") OR process.name = NOCASE("PAExec.exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name ICONTAINS "PAExec" OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=11D40A7B7876288F919AB819CC2D9802", "IMPHASH=6444f8a34e99b8f7d9647de66aabe516", "IMPHASH=dfd6aa3f7b2b1035b76b718f1ddc689f", "IMPHASH=1a6cca4d5460b1710a12dea39e4a592c"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\paexec\.exe$|.*C:\\Windows\\PAExec\-$)/i))
description: Renamed PAExec Execution: Detects execution of renamed version of PAExec. Often used by attackers

query: where((process.name IIN ["PingCastleReporting.exe", "PingCastleCloud.exe", "PingCastle.exe"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--scanner aclcheck", "--scanner antivirus", "--scanner computerversion", "--scanner foreignusers", "--scanner laps_bitlocker", "--scanner localadmin", "--scanner nullsession", "--scanner nullsession-trust", "--scanner oxidbindings", "--scanner remote", "--scanner share", "--scanner smb", "--scanner smb3querynetwork", "--scanner spooler", "--scanner startup", "--scanner zerologon"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--no-enum-limit" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--level Full"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["--healthcheck", "--server "]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\PingCastleReporting\.exe$|.*\\PingCastleCloud\.exe$|.*\\PingCastle\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed PingCastle Binary Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed "PingCastle" binary based on the PE metadata fields.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("Plink") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -l forward", " -P ", " -R "]) AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\plink\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed Plink Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the Plink binary

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\Microsoft\.NodejsTools\.PressAnyKey\.exe$/i)
description: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Renamed Execution: Detects renamed execution of "Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary binaries

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "DllRegisterServer" AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i)
description: Potential Renamed Rundll32 Execution: Detects when 'DllRegisterServer' is called in the commandline and the image is not rundll32. This could mean that the 'rundll32' utility has been renamed in order to avoid detection

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Remote Utilities") AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\rutserv\.exe$|.*\\rfusclient\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) Execution: Detects execution of renamed Remote Utilities (RURAT) via Product PE header field

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -delete " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/delete " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“delete " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”delete " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•delete " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -query " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/query " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“query " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”query " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•query " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -change " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/change " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“change " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”change " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•change " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -run " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/run " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“run " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”run " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•run " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -end " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/end " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“end " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”end " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•end ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -tn " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/tn " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“tn " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”tn " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•tn " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -tr " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/tr " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“tr " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”tr " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•tr " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -sc " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/sc " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“sc " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”sc " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•sc " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -st " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/st " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“st " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”st " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•st " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -ru " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/ru " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“ru " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”ru " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•ru " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -fo " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/fo " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“fo " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”fo " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•fo ") AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "schtasks" OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i)
description:
Renamed Schtasks Execution: Detects the execution of renamed schtasks.exe binary, which is a legitimate Windows utility used for scheduling tasks.
One of the very common persistence techniques is schedule malicious tasks using schtasks.exe.
Since, it is heavily abused, it is also heavily monitored by security products. To evade detection, threat actors may rename the schtasks.exe binary to schedule their malicious tasks.

query: where(process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Sysinternals DebugView") AND NOT (process.name = NOCASE("Dbgview.exe") AND process.exe_path=/.*\\Dbgview\.exe$/i))
description: Renamed SysInternals DebugView Execution: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("procdump") OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•mp ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•accepteula")) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\procdump\.exe$|.*\\procdump64\.exe$)/i))
description:
Renamed ProcDump Execution: Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable.
This often done by attackers or malware in order to evade defensive mechanisms.

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("psexesvc.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\PSEXESVC.exe"))
description: Renamed PsExec Service Execution: Detects suspicious launch of a renamed version of the PSEXESVC service with, which is not often used by legitimate administrators

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("sdelete.exe") AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\sdelete\.exe$|.*\\sdelete64\.exe$)/i))
description: Renamed Sysinternals Sdelete Execution: Detects the use of a renamed SysInternals Sdelete, which is something an administrator shouldn't do (the renaming)

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("vmnat.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*vmnat\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed Vmnat.exe Execution: Detects renamed vmnat.exe or portable version that can be used for DLL side-loading

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("whoami.exe") AND NOT process.exe_path=/.*\\whoami\.exe$/i)
description: Renamed Whoami Execution: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\RpcPing\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\RpcPing.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•s") AND ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”u" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•u") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "NTLM" OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-t" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/t" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“t" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”t" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•t") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ncacn_np"))
description: Capture Credentials with Rpcping.exe: Detects using Rpcping.exe to send a RPC test connection to the target server (-s) and force the NTLM hash to be sent in the process.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\ruby\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("ruby.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -e")
description: Ruby Inline Command Execution: Detects execution of ruby using the "-e" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live ruby code.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line=/[Rr][Uu][Nn][Dd][Ll][Ll]32(\.[Ee][Xx][Ee])? \S+?\w:\S+?:/i)
description: Potential Rundll32 Execution With DLL Stored In ADS: Detects execution of rundll32 where the DLL being called is stored in an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rundll32") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "advpack" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["#+", "12"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "#-"))
description: Suspicious Advpack Call Via Rundll32.EXE: Detects execution of "rundll32" calling "advpack.dll" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls in order to leverage the "RegisterOCX" function

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["rundll32.exe", "Execute", "RegRead", "window.close"])
description: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "InstallScreenSaver")
description: Rundll32 InstallScreenSaver Execution: An attacker may execute an application as a SCR File using rundll32.exe desk.cpl,InstallScreenSaver

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["keymgr", "KRShowKeyMgr"])
description: Suspicious Key Manager Access: Detects the invocation of the Stored User Names and Passwords dialogue (Key Manager)

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\..\\", "mshtml"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["#135", "RunHTMLApplication"]))
description: Mshtml.DLL RunHTMLApplication Suspicious Usage: Detects execution of commands that leverage the "mshtml.dll" RunHTMLApplication export to run arbitrary code via different protocol handlers (vbscript, javascript, file, http...)

query: where((process.cmd_line=/(.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe"$|.*\\rundll32$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\\", "\Microsoft\Edge\\"]))
description: Rundll32 Execution Without CommandLine Parameters: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie", "http"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["spoolss", "srvsvc", "/print/pipe/"]))
description: Suspicious NTLM Authentication on the Printer Spooler Service: Detects a privilege elevation attempt by coercing NTLM authentication on the Printer Spooler service

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rundll32") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["#+", "#-", "#0", "#655", "#656"]))
description: Potential Obfuscated Ordinal Call Via Rundll32: Detects execution of "rundll32" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " C:\Windows\System32\\" OR process.cmd_line=/.*\ \-localserver\ 22d8c27b\-47a1\-48d1\-ad08\-7da7abd79617$/i))
description: Rundll32 Spawned Via Explorer.EXE: Detects execution of "rundll32.exe" with a parent process of Explorer.exe. This has been observed by variants of Raspberry Robin, as first reported by Red Canary.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rundll32") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["comsvcs", "full"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["#-", "#+", "#24", "24 ", "MiniDump", "#65560"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["24", "comsvcs", "full"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" #", ",#", ", #", '"#']))
description: Process Memory Dump Via Comsvcs.DLL: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-sta ", "-localserver "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["{", "}"])
description: Rundll32 Registered COM Objects: load malicious registered COM objects

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\RECYCLER\\", ":\SystemVolumeInformation\\"] OR process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Windows\Tasks\\", "C:\Windows\debug\\", "C:\Windows\fonts\\", "C:\Windows\help\\", "C:\Windows\drivers\\", "C:\Windows\addins\\", "C:\Windows\cursors\\", "C:\Windows\system32\tasks\\"])
description: Suspicious Process Start Locations: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\runonce\.exe$/i AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["setupapi.dll", "InstallHinfSection"])
description: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shell32.dll", "Control_RunDLL"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["%AppData%", "%LocalAppData%", "%Temp%", "%tmp%", "\AppData\\", "\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\"]))
description: Shell32 DLL Execution in Suspicious Directory: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "RunDll_ShellExecuteW")
description: Potential ShellDispatch.DLL Functionality Abuse: Detects potential "ShellDispatch.dll" functionality abuse to execute arbitrary binaries via "ShellExecute"

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND NOT parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\shell32.dll,Control_RunDLL")
description: RunDLL32 Spawning Explorer: Detects RunDLL32.exe spawning explorer.exe as child, which is very uncommon, often observes Gamarue spawning the explorer.exe process in an unusual way

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["javascript:", ".RegisterXLL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["url.dll", "OpenURL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["url.dll", "OpenURLA"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["url.dll", "FileProtocolHandler"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["zipfldr.dll", "RouteTheCall"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shell32.dll", "Control_RunDLL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shell32.dll", "ShellExec_RunDLL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["mshtml.dll", "PrintHTML"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["advpack.dll", "LaunchINFSection"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["advpack.dll", "RegisterOCX"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ieadvpack.dll", "LaunchINFSection"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ieadvpack.dll", "RegisterOCX"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ieframe.dll", "OpenURL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shdocvw.dll", "OpenURL"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["syssetup.dll", "SetupInfObjectInstallAction"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["setupapi.dll", "InstallHinfSection"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["pcwutl.dll", "LaunchApplication"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["dfshim.dll", "ShOpenVerbApplication"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["dfshim.dll", "ShOpenVerbShortcut"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["scrobj.dll", "GenerateTypeLib", "http"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shimgvw.dll", "ImageView_Fullscreen", "http"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["comsvcs.dll", "MiniDump"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "shell32.dll,Control_RunDLL desk.cpl,screensaver,@screensaver" OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\control.exe") AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".cpl" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Shell32.dll", "Control_RunDLL", ".cpl"] OR parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\control.exe") AND process.cmd_line ISTARTS-WITH '"C:\Windows\system32\rundll32.exe" Shell32.dll,Control_RunDLL "C:\Windows\System32\\' AND process.cmd_line=/.*\.cpl",$/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32 Activity: Detects suspicious execution of rundll32, with specific calls to some DLLs with known LOLBIN functionalities

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\System32\\control\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Shell32.dll")
description: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".bmp", ".cr2", ".eps", ".gif", ".ico", ".jpeg", ".jpg", ".nef", ".orf", ".png", ".raw", ".sr2", ".tif", ".tiff"]))
description: Suspicious Rundll32 Execution With Image Extension: Detects the execution of Rundll32.exe with DLL files masquerading as image files

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ShellExec_RunDLL" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Desktop\\", "\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\", "comspec", "iex", "Invoke-", "msiexec", "odbcconf", "regsvr32"]))
description: Suspicious Usage Of ShellExec_RunDLL: Detects suspicious usage of the ShellExec_RunDLL function to launch other commands as seen in the the raspberry-robin attack

query: where(parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "SHELL32.DLL" AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["#568", "#570", "#572", "#576"]) AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["comspec", "iex", "Invoke-", "msiexec", "odbcconf", "regsvr32"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Desktop\\", "\ProgramData\\", "\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\msxsl\.exe$|.*\\odbcconf\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description:
Suspicious ShellExec_RunDLL Call Via Ordinal: Detects suspicious call to the "ShellExec_RunDLL" exported function of SHELL32.DLL through the ordinal number to launch other commands.
Adversary might only use the ordinal number in order to bypass existing detection that alert on usage of ShellExec_RunDLL on CommandLine.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["rundll32", "apphelp.dll"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["ShimFlushCache", "#250"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["rundll32", "kernel32.dll"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["BaseFlushAppcompatCache", "#46"]))
description: ShimCache Flush: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rundll32.exe" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".sys,", ".sys "]))
description: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["oledb32.dll", ",OpenDSLFile ", "\Users\*\Downloads\\"] AND process.cmd_line=/.*\.udl$/i)
description:
Potentially Suspicious Rundll32.EXE Execution of UDL File: Detects the execution of rundll32.exe with the oledb32.dll library to open a UDL file.
Threat actors can abuse this technique as a phishing vector to capture authentication credentials or other sensitive data.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "rundll32") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \\")
description: Rundll32 UNC Path Execution: Detects rundll32 execution where the DLL is located on a remote location (share)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line = null OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("") OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".cpl ", ".cpl,", '.cpl"', """.cpl'""", ".dll ", ".dll,", '.dll"', """.dll'""", ".inf ", ".inf,", '.inf"', """.inf'"""] OR process.cmd_line=/(.*\.cpl$|.*\.dll$|.*\.inf$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -localserver " OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Windows\Installer\\", ".tmp", "zzzzInvokeManagedCustomActionOutOfProc"]) AND NOT (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\EdgeUpdate\Install\{", "\EDGEMITMP_", ".tmp\setup.exe", "--install-archive=", "--previous-version=", "--msedgewebview --verbose-logging --do-not-launch-msedge --user-level"]))
description: Rundll32 Execution With Uncommon DLL Extension: Detects the execution of rundll32 with a command line that doesn't contain a common extension

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "user32.dll," AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "LockWorkStation")
description: Suspicious Workstation Locking via Rundll32: Detects a suspicious call to the user32.dll function that locks the user workstation

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("RUNDLL32.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie")
description:
WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like "C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie".
This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on a WebDav server).

Suspicious WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397

query: where(process.cmd_line IIN ["rundll32.exe", "rundll32"])
description: Rundll32 Execution Without Parameters: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\runonce\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Run Once Wrapper")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/AlternateShellStartup" OR process.cmd_line=/.*\/r$/i))
description: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["create", "binPath"] AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files (x86)\Dropbox\Client\\", "C:\Program Files\Dropbox\Client\\"]) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Dropbox\.exe$/i))
description: New Service Creation Using Sc.EXE: Detects the creation of a new service using the "sc.exe" utility.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" config ", "start"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["disabled", "demand"]))
description: Service StartupType Change Via Sc.EXE: Detect the use of "sc.exe" to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "demand"

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["create", "config"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["binPath", "type", "kernel"] AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["create netprotection_network_filter", "type= kernel start= ", "binPath= System32\drivers\netprotection_network_filter", "DisplayName= netprotection_network_filter", "group= PNP_TDI tag= yes"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["create avelam binpath=C:\Windows\system32\drivers\avelam.sys", "type=kernel start=boot error=critical group=Early-Launch"]))
description: New Kernel Driver Via SC.EXE: Detects creation of a new service (kernel driver) with the type "kernel"

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "query" AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "termservice")
description:
Interesting Service Enumeration Via Sc.EXE: Detects the enumeration and query of interesting and in some cases sensitive services on the system via "sc.exe".
Attackers often try to enumerate the services currently running on a system in order to find different attack vectors.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sdset", "A;"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [";IU", ";SU", ";BA", ";SY", ";WD"]) AND NOT parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Hexnode\Hexnode Agent\Current\HexnodeAgent.exe"))
description: Allow Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sdset", "D;"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [";IU", ";SU", ";BA", ";SY", ";WD"]))
description: Deny Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to deny access to a service that affects critical trustees. This can be used to hide services or make them unstoppable.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sdset", "DCLCWPDTSD"])
description: Service DACL Abuse To Hide Services Via Sc.EXE: Detects usage of the "sc.exe" utility adding a new service with special permission seen used by threat actors which makes the service hidden and unremovable.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "sdset")
description: Service Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE: Detection of sc.exe utility adding a new service with special permission which hides that service.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["config", "binPath"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["powershell", "cmd ", "mshta", "wscript", "cscript", "rundll32", "svchost", "dllhost", "cmd.exe /c", "cmd.exe \/k", "cmd.exe \/r", "cmd \/c", "cmd \/k", "cmd \/r", "C:\Users\Public", "\Downloads\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Startup\\", "C:\Windows\TEMP\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp"]))
description: Suspicious Service Path Modification: Detects service path modification via the "sc" binary to a suspicious command or path

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sc ", "config ", "binpath="] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sc ", "failure", "command="] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg ", "add ", "FailureCommand"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg ", "add ", "ImagePath"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".sh", ".exe", ".dll", ".bin$", ".bat", ".cmd", ".js", ".msh$", ".reg$", ".scr", ".ps", ".vb", ".jar", ".pl"]))
description: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Existing Service Tampering: Detects the modification of an existing service in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a potential method for persistence.

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("sc.exe") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\sc\.exe$/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " stop ")
description: Stop Windows Service Via Sc.EXE: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "sc.exe" utility

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/Create", "/RU", "/TR", "C:\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\\"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["NT AUT", " SYSTEM "]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "TeamViewer_.exe"] AND process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/TN TVInstallRestore"))
description: Suspicious Schtasks Execution AppData Folder: Detects the creation of a schtask that executes a file from C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /Change ", " \/TN "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\Temp", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\WINDOWS\Temp\\", "\Desktop\\", "\Downloads\\", "\Temporary Internet", "C:\ProgramData\\", "C:\Perflogs\\", "%ProgramData%", "%appdata%", "%comspec%", "%localappdata%"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["regsvr32", "rundll32", "cmd \/c ", "cmd \/k ", "cmd \/r ", "cmd.exe \/c ", "cmd.exe \/k ", "cmd.exe \/r ", "powershell", "mshta", "wscript", "cscript", "certutil", "bitsadmin", "bash.exe", "bash ", "scrcons", "wmic ", "wmic.exe", "forfiles", "scriptrunner", "hh.exe", "hh "]))
description:
Suspicious Modification Of Scheduled Tasks: Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location
Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on
Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " AND NOT (process.username ICONTAINS-ANY ["AUTHORI", "AUTORI"]) AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Program Files\Microsoft Office\root\integration\integrator.exe", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Office\root\integration\integrator.exe"]) AND (process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\System32\schtasks.exe", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\schtasks.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Microsoft\Office\Office Performance Monitor"))
description: Scheduled Task Creation Via Schtasks.EXE: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /create ", " \/sc once ", "\Temp\\"])
description: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•create ") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["curl ", "http", "-o"] AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "powershell")
description:
Scheduled Task Creation with Curl and PowerShell Execution Combo: Detects the creation of a scheduled task using schtasks.exe, potentially in combination with curl for downloading payloads and PowerShell for executing them.
This facilitates executing malicious payloads or connecting with C&C server persistently without dropping the malware sample on the host.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/delete", "/tn"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Windows\BitLocker", "\Windows\ExploitGuard", "\Windows\SystemRestore\SR", "\Windows\UpdateOrchestrator\\", "\Windows\Windows Defender\\", "\Windows\WindowsBackup\\", "\Windows\WindowsUpdate\\"]))
description: Delete Important Scheduled Task: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /delete ", "\/tn \\", " \/f"])
description: Delete All Scheduled Tasks: Detects the usage of schtasks with the delete flag and the asterisk symbol to delete all tasks from the schedule of the local computer, including tasks scheduled by other users.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/Change", "/TN", "/disable"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Windows\BitLocker", "\Windows\ExploitGuard", "\Windows\ExploitGuard\ExploitGuard MDM policy Refresh", "\Windows\SystemRestore\SR", "\Windows\UpdateOrchestrator\\", "\Windows\Windows Defender\\", "\Windows\WindowsBackup\\", "\Windows\WindowsUpdate\\"]))
description: Disable Important Scheduled Task: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•create ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs", ":\Users\All Users\\", ":\Users\Default\\", ":\Users\Public", ":\Windows\Temp", "\AppData\Local\\", "\AppData\Roaming\\", "%AppData%", "%Public%"]) OR parent_process.cmd_line=/.*\\svchost\.exe\ \-k\ netsvcs\ \-p\ \-s\ Schedule$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs", ":\Windows\Temp", "\Users\Public", "%Public%"])) AND NOT (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "unattended.ini" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "update_task.xml" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Create /TN TVInstallRestore \/TR" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\/Create \/Xml ", "\Temp\.CR.", "\Avira_Security_Installation.xml"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\/Create \/F \/TN", "\/Xml ", "\Temp\\", "Avira_"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".tmp\UpdateFallbackTask.xml", ".tmp\WatchdogServiceControlManagerTimeout.xml", ".tmp\SystrayAutostart.xml", ".tmp\MaintenanceTask.xml"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Temp\\", '\/Create \/TN "klcp_update" \/XML ', "\klcp_update_task.xml"]))
description: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["powershell", "pwsh", "cmd \/c ", "cmd \/k ", "cmd \/r ", "cmd.exe \/c ", "cmd.exe \/k ", "cmd.exe \/r "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\ProgramData\\", "%ProgramData%"]))
description: Schtasks From Suspicious Folders: Detects scheduled task creations that have suspicious action command and folder combinations

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Create " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['/TN "{', """/TN '{""", "/TN {"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ['}"', """}'""", "} "]))
description: Suspicious Scheduled Task Name As GUID: Detects creation of a scheduled task with a GUID like name

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\schtasks.exe" OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["wscript", "vbscript", "cscript", "wmic ", "wmic.exe", "regsvr32.exe", "powershell", "\AppData\\"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["once", "00:00"])
description: Uncommon One Time Only Scheduled Task At 00:00: Detects scheduled task creation events that include suspicious actions, and is run once at 00:00

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /create ", "sshd.exe", "-f"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" \/create ", "ssh.exe", "-i"]))
description: Potential SSH Tunnel Persistence Install Using A Scheduled Task: Detects the creation of new scheduled tasks via commandline, using Schtasks.exe. This rule detects tasks creating that call OpenSSH, which may indicate the creation of reverse SSH tunnel to the attacker's server.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["run ", "\Application Experience\Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser"])
description:
Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser: Detects manual execution of the "Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser" task via schtasks.
In order to trigger persistence stored in the "\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController" registry key.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\WINDOWS\System32\svchost.exe") AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-k netsvcs", "-s Schedule"] AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\ \-windowstyle\ hidden$|.*\ \-w\ hidden$|.*\ \-ep\ bypass$|.*\ \-noni$)/i))
description: Potential Persistence Via Powershell Search Order Hijacking - Task: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Create" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-ItemProperty", " gp "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["HKCU:", "HKLM:", "registry::", "HKEY_"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["FromBase64String", "encodedcommand"]))
description: Scheduled Task Executing Payload from Registry: Detects the creation of a schtasks that potentially executes a payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Create" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["FromBase64String", "encodedcommand"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-ItemProperty", " gp "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["HKCU:", "HKLM:", "registry::", "HKEY_"]))
description: Scheduled Task Executing Encoded Payload from Registry: Detects the creation of a schtask that potentially executes a base64 encoded payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" ONLOGON ", " ONSTART ", " ONCE ", " ONIDLE "]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["NT AUT", " SYSTEM", "HIGHEST"]))
description: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Types: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" ONLOGON ", " ONSTART ", " ONCE ", " ONIDLE "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["NT AUT", " SYSTEM", "HIGHEST"]))
description: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/Create " AND ((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/sc minute ", "/ru system "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd /c", "cmd \/k", "cmd \/r", "cmd.exe \/c ", "cmd.exe \/k ", "cmd.exe \/r "]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -decode ", " -enc ", " -w hidden ", " bypass ", " IEX", ".DownloadData", ".DownloadFile", ".DownloadString", "\/c start \/min ", "FromBase64String", "mshta http", "mshta.exe http"] OR (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", ":\Tmp\\", ":\Users\Public\\", ":\Windows\Temp\\", "\AppData\\", "%AppData%", "%Temp%", "%tmp%"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cscript", "curl", "wscript"])))
description: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" /change ", " \/create "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\/ru " AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["NT AUT", " SYSTEM "]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/TN TVInstallRestore", "\TeamViewer_.exe"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Subscription Heartbeat", "\HeartbeatConfig.xml", "\Microsoft Shared\OFFICE"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/Create /F \/RU System \/SC WEEKLY \/TN AviraSystemSpeedupVerify \/TR ", ":\Program Files (x86)\Avira\System Speedup\setup\avira_speedup_setup.exe", '\/VERIFY \/VERYSILENT \/NOSTART \/NODOTNET \/NORESTART" \/RL HIGHEST']))
description: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\schtasks\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("schtasks.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”create " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•create ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" audiodg", " conhost", " dwm.exe", " explorer", " lsass", " lsm", " mmc", " msiexec", " regsvr32", " rundll32", " services", " spoolsv", " svchost", " taskeng", " taskhost", " wininit", " winlogon"]))
description: Scheduled Task Creation Masquerading as System Processes: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involve system processes, which may indicate malicious actors masquerading as or abusing these processes to execute payloads or maintain persistence.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\scrcons\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\msbuild\.exe$)/i))
description: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sdbinst\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sdbinst.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".sdb" AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\msiexec\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Program Files (x86)\IIS Express\iisexpressshim.sdb", ":\Program Files\IIS Express\iisexpressshim.sdb"])))
description:
Potential Shim Database Persistence via Sdbinst.EXE: Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\sdbinst\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("sdbinst.exe")) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".sdb" OR process.cmd_line=/(.*\ \-c$|.*\ \-f$|.*\ \-mm$|.*\ \-t$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -m -bg" OR process.cmd_line = null OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("")))
description:
Uncommon Extension Shim Database Installation Via Sdbinst.EXE: Detects installation of a potentially suspicious new shim with an uncommon extension using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sdclt\.exe$/i)
description: Sdclt Child Processes: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sdiagnhost\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\taskkill\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\calc\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "bits" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\powershell\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line=/(.*\-noprofile\ \-$|.*\-noprofile$)/i)))
description: Sdiagnhost Calling Suspicious Child Process: Detects sdiagnhost.exe calling a suspicious child process (e.g. used in exploits for Follina / CVE-2022-30190)

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\secedit\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("SeCEdit")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/export", "/cfg"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/configure", "/db"]))
description: Potential Suspicious Activity Using SeCEdit: Detects potential suspicious behaviour using secedit.exe. Such as exporting or modifying the security policy

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\node\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("node.exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Node.js")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".js")
description:
NodeJS Execution of JavaScript File: Detects execution of JavaScript or JSC files using NodeJs binary node.exe, that could be potentially suspicious.
Node.js is a popular open-source JavaScript runtime that runs code outside browsers and is widely used for both frontend and backend development.
Adversaries have been observed abusing Node.js to disguise malware as legitimate processes, evade security defenses, and maintain persistence within target systems.
Because Node.js is commonly used, this rule may generate false positives in some environments. However, if such activity is unusual in your environment, it is highly suspicious and warrants immediate investigation.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Serv\-U\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\sh\.exe$|.*\\bash\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\forfiles\.exe$|.*\\scriptrunner\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\setres\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\choice" AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*C:\\Windows\\System32\\choice\.exe$|.*C:\\Windows\\SysWOW64\\choice\.exe$)/i))
description:
Uncommon Child Process Of Setres.EXE: Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE.
Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution.
It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\setspn\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("setspn.exe") OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS-ALL ["Query or reset the computer", "SPN attribute"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -q ", " /q "]))
description: Potential SPN Enumeration Via Setspn.EXE: Detects service principal name (SPN) enumeration used for Kerberoasting

query: where(parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\SysWOW64\setup16.exe") AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -m " AND NOT process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\~MSSETUP.T\\")
description:
Setup16.EXE Execution With Custom .Lst File: Detects the execution of "Setup16.EXE" and old installation utility with a custom ".lst" file.
These ".lst" file can contain references to external program that "Setup16.EXE" will execute.
Attackers and adversaries might leverage this as a living of the land utility.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\shutdown\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/r ", "/s "]))
description: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown: Use of the commandline to shutdown or reboot windows

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\shutdown\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/l")
description: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown to Log Out: Detects the rare use of the command line tool shutdown to logoff a user

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\sigverif\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\System32\WerFault.exe", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\WerFault.exe"]))
description: Uncommon Sigverif.EXE Child Process: Detects uncommon child processes spawning from "sigverif.exe", which could indicate potential abuse of the latter as a living of the land binary in order to proxy execution.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\SndVol\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " shell32.dll,Control_RunDLL "))
description: Uncommon Child Processes Of SndVol.exe: Detects potentially uncommon child processes of SndVol.exe (the Windows volume mixer)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\SoundRecorder\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/FILE")
description: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\SpeechRuntime\.exe$/i)
description:
Suspicious Speech Runtime Binary Child Process: Detects suspicious Speech Runtime Binary Execution by monitoring its child processes.
Child processes spawned by SpeechRuntime.exe could indicate an attempt for lateral movement via COM & DCOM hijacking.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\splwow64\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*splwow64\.exe$/i)
description: Suspicious Splwow64 Without Params: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlcmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["VeeamBackup", "From "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["BackupRepositories", "Backups", "Credentials", "HostCreds", "SmbFileShares", "Ssh_creds", "VSphereInfo"]))
description: Veeam Backup Database Suspicious Query: Detects potentially suspicious SQL queries using SQLCmd targeting the Veeam backup databases in order to steal information.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\sqlcmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["SELECT", "TOP", "[VeeamBackup].[dbo].[Credentials]"])
description: VeeamBackup Database Credentials Dump Via Sqlcmd.EXE: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo

query: where((process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("SQLite") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\sqlite\.exe$|.*\\sqlite3\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\User Data\\", "\Opera Software\\", "\ChromiumViewer\\"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Login Data", "Cookies", "Web Data", "History", "Bookmarks"]))
description: SQLite Chromium Profile Data DB Access: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.

query: where((process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("SQLite") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\sqlite\.exe$|.*\\sqlite3\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cookies.sqlite", "places.sqlite"]))
description: SQLite Firefox Profile Data DB Access: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\squirrel\.exe$|.*\\update\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" --download ", " --update ", " --updateRollback="]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http")
description: Arbitrary File Download Via Squirrel.EXE: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" to download arbitrary files. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\squirrel\.exe$|.*\\update\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--processStart", "--processStartAndWait", "--createShortcut"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\Discord\Update.exe", "Discord.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--createShortcut", "--processStart"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\GitHubDesktop\Update.exe", "GitHubDesktop.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--createShortcut", "--processStartAndWait"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\Teams\Update.exe", "Teams.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--processStart", "--createShortcut"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\AppData\Local\yammerdesktop\Update.exe", "Yammer.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--processStart", "--createShortcut"])))
description: Process Proxy Execution Via Squirrel.EXE: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" binary to execute arbitrary processes. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ssh\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -R " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /R " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“R " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”R " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•R "))
description: Port Forwarding Activity Via SSH.EXE: Detects port forwarding activity via SSH.exe

query: where(parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\OpenSSH\sshd.exe") OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\ssh\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("OpenSSH for Windows") OR Hashes ICONTAINS-ANY ["IMPHASH=55b4964d29aad5438b9e950052dbbbc0", "IMPHASH=334d66c33503ccbf647c15b47c27eef4", "IMPHASH=27b0da080ef92afb37983d30d839141e", "IMPHASH=977eb4c263d384e47daa0712d34713ab", "IMPHASH=3eaadce9ae43d5a918bb082065815c3b", "IMPHASH=980fe6cf0d996ab1eedf877222e722aa", "IMPHASH=5f959422308ac3d721010d66647e100e", "IMPHASH=a49aaa3d03d1cd9c8dc7fca60f7f480b", "IMPHASH=dd335f759b6d5d6a8382b71dd9d65791"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ProxyCommand=" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["PermitLocalCommand=yes", " LocalCommand"]))
description: Program Executed Using Proxy/Local Command Via SSH.EXE: Detect usage of the "ssh.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\ssh\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":3389")
description: Potential RDP Tunneling Via SSH: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\amazon\-ssm\-agent\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["-register ", "-code ", "-id ", "-region "])
description: Potential Amazon SSM Agent Hijacking: Detects potential Amazon SSM agent hijack attempts as outlined in the Mitiga research report.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\stordiag\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\systeminfo\.exe$|.*\\fltmc\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["c:\windows\system32\\", "c:\windows\syswow64\\"]))
description: Execution via stordiag.exe: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\ntvdm\.exe$|.*\\csrstub\.exe$)/i)
description: Start of NT Virtual DOS Machine: Ntvdm.exe allows the execution of 16-bit Windows applications on 32-bit Windows operating systems, as well as the execution of both 16-bit and 32-bit DOS applications

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\winlogon\.exe$|.*\\services\.exe$|.*\\lsass\.exe$|.*\\csrss\.exe$|.*\\smss\.exe$|.*\\wininit\.exe$|.*\\spoolsv\.exe$|.*\\searchindexer\.exe$)/i) AND (process.username ICONTAINS-ANY ["AUTHORI", "AUTORI"]) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "Cmd.Exe"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" route ", " ADD "]))
description: Abused Debug Privilege by Arbitrary Parent Processes: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["localgroup ", " /add"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Add-LocalGroupMember ", " -Group "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" administrators ", " administrateur"]))
description: User Added to Local Administrators Group: Detects addition of users to the local administrator group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["localgroup ", " /add"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Add-LocalGroupMember ", " -Group "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Group Policy Creator Owners", "Schema Admins"]))
description: User Added To Highly Privileged Group: Detects addition of users to highly privileged groups via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["localgroup ", " /add"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Add-LocalGroupMember ", " -Group "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Remote Desktop Users", "Utilisateurs du Bureau Ã  distance", "Usuarios de escritorio remoto"]))
description: User Added to Remote Desktop Users Group: Detects addition of users to the local Remote Desktop Users group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "txt:" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["type ", " > "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["makecab ", ".cab"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg ", " export "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["regedit ", " /E "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["esentutl ", " \/y ", " \/d ", " \/o "]))
description: Execute From Alternate Data Streams: Detects execution from an Alternate Data Stream (ADS). Adversaries may use NTFS file attributes to hide their malicious data in order to evade detection

query: where(parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\\" AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["cmd /c", "Invoke-", "Base64"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.WindowsTerminal" AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\WindowsTerminal\.exe$/i AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) OR parent_process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.SysinternalsSuite" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i))
description: Potentially Suspicious Windows App Activity: Detects potentially suspicious child process of applications launched from inside the WindowsApps directory. This could be a sign of a rogue ".appx" package installation/execution

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".SettingContent-ms" AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "immersivecontrolpanel")
description: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\Winrar\.exe$|.*\\7zFM\.exe$|.*\\peazip\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\isoburn\.exe$|.*\\PowerISO\.exe$|.*\\ImgBurn\.exe$)/i))
description: Phishing Pattern ISO in Archive: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".doc", ".docx", ".xls", ".xlsx", ".ppt", ".pptx", ".rtf", ".pdf", ".txt"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["dir ", " /b ", " /s "] OR process.name = NOCASE("FINDSTR.EXE") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" \/e ", " /si "])))
description: Automated Collection Command Prompt: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\WerFault\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*WerFault\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*rundll32\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvcs\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*regsvcs\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\regasm\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*regasm\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path=/.*\\regsvr32\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*regsvr32\.exe$/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\EdgeUpdate\Install\{" AND process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*rundll32\.exe$/i OR (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\AppData\Local\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\Application\\", "\AppData\Local\Google\Chrome\Application\\"]) AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Installer\\setup\.exe$/i AND parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--uninstall " AND process.exe_path=/.*\\rundll32\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line=/.*rundll32\.exe$/i))
description:
Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments: Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.

query: where((parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["Acrobat Reader", "Microsoft Office", "PDF Reader"]) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\firefox\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\opera\.exe$|.*\\maxthon\.exe$|.*\\seamonkey\.exe$|.*\\vivaldi\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "http" AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["http://ad.foxitsoftware.com/adlog.php?", "https://globe-map.foxitservice.com/go.php?do=redirect"]))
description: Potential Suspicious Browser Launch From Document Reader Process: Detects when a browser process or browser tab is launched from an application that handles document files such as Adobe, Microsoft Office, etc. And connects to a web application over http(s), this could indicate a possible phishing attempt.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["h^t^t^p", 'h"t"t"p'])
description: Potential Commandline Obfuscation Using Escape Characters: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using known escape characters

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i) AND (process.name IIN ["Cmd.EXE", "cscript.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "PowerShell_ISE.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "wscript.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Ë£", "Ëª", "Ë¢", "âˆ•", "â„", "â€•", "â€”", "Â ", "Â¯", "Â®", "Â¶", "â €"]))
description:
Potential CommandLine Obfuscation Using Unicode Characters From Suspicious Image: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters.
Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "#" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["account", "anti-bot", "botcheck", "captcha", "challenge", "confirmation", "fraud", "human", "identification", "identificator", "identity", "robot", "validation", "verification", "verify"]))
description:
Suspicious ClickFix/FileFix Execution Pattern: Detects suspicious execution patterns where users are tricked into running malicious commands via clipboard manipulation, either through the Windows Run dialog (ClickFix) or File Explorer address bar (FileFix).
Attackers leverage social engineering campaignsâ€”such as fake CAPTCHA challenges or urgent alertsâ€”encouraging victims to paste clipboard contents, often executing mshta.exe, powershell.exe, or similar commands to infect systems.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "#" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€â€€", "â€â€â€â€â€â€â€â€â€â€â€â€", "â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚â€‚", "â€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒâ€ƒ", "â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„â€„", "â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…â€…", "â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†â€†", "â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡â€‡", "â€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆâ€ˆ", "â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰â€‰", "â€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Šâ€Š", "Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â ", "            "]))
description:
Suspicious Explorer Process with Whitespace Padding - ClickFix/FileFix: Detects process creation with suspicious whitespace padding followed by a '#' character, which may indicate ClickFix or FileFix techniques used to conceal malicious commands from visual inspection.
ClickFix and FileFix are social engineering attack techniques where adversaries distribute phishing documents or malicious links that deceive users into opening the Windows Run dialog box or File Explorer search bar.
The victims are then instructed to paste commands from their clipboard, which contain extensive whitespace padding using various Unicode space characters to push the actual malicious command far to the right, effectively hiding it from immediate view.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["for /f", "tokens=", "in (", "dir"] OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["for \/f", "tokens=", "in (", "dir"])
description:
Suspicious Usage of For Loop with Recursive Directory Search in CMD: Detects suspicious usage of the cmd.exe 'for /f' loop combined with the 'tokens=' parameter and a recursive directory listing.
This pattern may indicate an attempt to discover and execute system binaries dynamically, for example powershell, a technique sometimes used by attackers to evade detection.
This behavior has been observed in various malicious lnk files.

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Windows\\" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\..\Windows\\", "\..\System32\\", "\..\..\\"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".exe\..\\") AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Google\Drive\googledrivesync.exe\..\\", "\Citrix\Virtual Smart Card\Citrix.Authentication.VirtualSmartcard.Launcher.exe\..\\"]))
description: Potential Command Line Path Traversal Evasion Attempt: Detects potential evasion or obfuscation attempts using bogus path traversal via the commandline
