query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy-item", "copy ", "cpi ", " cp ", "move ", "move-item", " mi ", " mv "] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\esentutl\.exe$|.*\\xcopy\.exe$|.*\\robocopy\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["esentutl.exe", "XCOPY.EXE", "robocopy.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Amigo\User Data", "\BraveSoftware\Brave-Browser\User Data", "\CentBrowser\User Data", "\Chromium\User Data", "\CocCoc\Browser\User Data", "\Comodo\Dragon\User Data", "\Elements Browser\User Data", "\Epic Privacy Browser\User Data", "\Google\Chrome Beta\User Data", "\Google\Chrome SxS\User Data", "\Google\Chrome\User Data\\", "\Kometa\User Data", "\Maxthon5\Users", "\Microsoft\Edge\User Data", "\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles", "\Nichrome\User Data", "\Opera Software\Opera GX Stable\\", "\Opera Software\Opera Neon\User Data", "\Opera Software\Opera Stable\\", "\Orbitum\User Data", "\QIP Surf\User Data", "\Sputnik\User Data", "\Torch\User Data", "\uCozMedia\Uran\User Data", "\Vivaldi\User Data"]))
description:
Potential Browser Data Stealing: Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser.
Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future.
Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\\*\*$", "\Sysvol\\"]) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\robocopy\.exe$|.*\\xcopy\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["robocopy.exe", "XCOPY.EXE"] OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "copy" OR (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\powershell_ise.exe", "\powershell.exe", "\pwsh.exe"] OR process.name IIN ["powershell_ise.exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy-item", "copy ", "cpi ", " cp ", "move ", " move-item", " mi ", " mv "])))
description: Copy From Or To Admin Share Or Sysvol Folder: Detects a copy command or a copy utility execution to or from an Admin share or remote

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "copy " OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy-item", " copy ", "cpi ", " cp "]) OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\robocopy\.exe$|.*\\xcopy\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["robocopy.exe", "XCOPY.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line=/\s['"]?C:\\Windows\\(System32|SysWOW64|WinSxS)/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/c copy", "\Temp\\", "\avira_system_speedup.exe"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Program Files\Avira\\", "C:\Program Files (x86)\Avira\\"])))
description:
Suspicious Copy From or To System Directory: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a program from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk.
Often used to move LOLBINs such as 'certutil' or 'desktopimgdownldr' to a different location with a different name in order to bypass detections based on locations.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "copy " OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy-item", " copy ", "cpi ", " cp "]) OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\robocopy\.exe$|.*\\xcopy\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["robocopy.exe", "XCOPY.EXE"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\System32", "\SysWOW64", "\WinSxS"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\bitsadmin.exe", "\calc.exe", "\certutil.exe", "\cmdl32.exe", "\cscript.exe", "\mshta.exe", "\rundll32.exe", "\wscript.exe", "\ie4uinit.exe"]))
description: LOL-Binary Copied From System Directory: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a known LOLBIN from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk in order to bypass detections based on locations.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" --cpu-priority=", "--donate-level=0", " -o pool.", " --nicehash", " --algo=rx/0 ", "stratum+tcp://", "stratum+udp://", "LS1kb25hdGUtbGV2ZWw9", "0tZG9uYXRlLWxldmVsP", "tLWRvbmF0ZS1sZXZlbD", "c3RyYXR1bSt0Y3A6Ly", "N0cmF0dW0rdGNwOi8v", "zdHJhdHVtK3RjcDovL", "c3RyYXR1bSt1ZHA6Ly", "N0cmF0dW0rdWRwOi8v", "zdHJhdHVtK3VkcDovL"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" pool.c ", " pool.o ", "gcc -"]))
description: Potential Crypto Mining Activity: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

query: where(((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["curl ", "Invoke-RestMethod", "Invoke-WebRequest", "irm ", "iwr ", "wget "]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" -ur", " -me", " -b", " POST "] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\curl\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "--ur" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -d ", " --data "]) OR process.exe_path=/.*\\wget\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--post-data", "--post-file"])) AND (process.cmd_line=/net\s+view/i OR process.cmd_line=/sc\s+query/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-Content", "GetBytes", "hostname", "ifconfig", "ipconfig", "netstat", "nltest", "qprocess", "systeminfo", "tasklist", "ToBase64String", "whoami"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["type ", " > ", " C:\\"]))
description: Potential Data Exfiltration Activity Via CommandLine Tools: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["taskkill ", "RaccineSettings.exe"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["reg.exe", "delete", "Raccine Tray"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["schtasks", "/DELETE", "Raccine Rules Updater"])
description: Raccine Uninstall: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\ \ \ \ \ \ \.exe$|.*______\.exe$|.*\.doc\.exe$|.*\.doc\.js$|.*\.docx\.exe$|.*\.docx\.js$|.*\.gif\.exe$|.*\.jpeg\.exe$|.*\.jpg\.exe$|.*\.mkv\.exe$|.*\.mov\.exe$|.*\.mp3\.exe$|.*\.mp4\.exe$|.*\.pdf\.exe$|.*\.pdf\.js$|.*\.png\.exe$|.*\.ppt\.exe$|.*\.ppt\.js$|.*\.pptx\.exe$|.*\.pptx\.js$|.*\.rtf\.exe$|.*\.rtf\.js$|.*\.svg\.exe$|.*\.txt\.exe$|.*\.txt\.js$|.*\.xls\.exe$|.*\.xls\.js$|.*\.xlsx\.exe$|.*\.xlsx\.js$|.*â €â €â €â €â €â €\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["      .exe", "______.exe", ".doc.exe", ".doc.js", ".docx.exe", ".docx.js", ".gif.exe", ".jpeg.exe", ".jpg.exe", ".mkv.exe", ".mov.exe", ".mp3.exe", ".mp4.exe", ".pdf.exe", ".pdf.js", ".png.exe", ".ppt.exe", ".ppt.js", ".pptx.exe", ".pptx.js", ".rtf.exe", ".rtf.js", ".svg.exe", ".txt.exe", ".txt.js", ".xls.exe", ".xls.js", ".xlsx.exe", ".xlsx.js", "â €â €â €â €â €â €.exe"]))
description: Suspicious Double Extension File Execution: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\.doc\.lnk$|.*\.docx\.lnk$|.*\.xls\.lnk$|.*\.xlsx\.lnk$|.*\.ppt\.lnk$|.*\.pptx\.lnk$|.*\.rtf\.lnk$|.*\.pdf\.lnk$|.*\.txt\.lnk$|.*\.doc\.js$|.*\.docx\.js$|.*\.xls\.js$|.*\.xlsx\.js$|.*\.ppt\.js$|.*\.pptx\.js$|.*\.rtf\.js$|.*\.pdf\.js$|.*\.txt\.js$)/i OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".doc.lnk", ".docx.lnk", ".xls.lnk", ".xlsx.lnk", ".ppt.lnk", ".pptx.lnk", ".rtf.lnk", ".pdf.lnk", ".txt.lnk", ".doc.js", ".docx.js", ".xls.js", ".xlsx.js", ".ppt.js", ".pptx.js", ".rtf.js", ".pdf.js", ".txt.js"])
description: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\curl\.exe$|.*\\wget\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-WebRequest", "iwr ", "curl ", "wget ", "Start-BitsTransfer", ".DownloadFile(", ".DownloadString("]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["https://attachment.outlook.live.net/owa/", "https://onenoteonlinesync.onenote.com/onenoteonlinesync/"]))
description: Suspicious Download from Office Domain: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\DumpStack\.log$/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -o DumpStack.log")
description: DumpStack.log Defender Evasion: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["\Windows\Installer\\", "msi"] AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*tmp$/i)
description: Always Install Elevated MSI Spawned Cmd And Powershell: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\discord\.exe$|.*\\GitHubDesktop\.exe$|.*\\keybase\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\msedgewebview2\.exe$|.*\\msteams\.exe$|.*\\slack\.exe$|.*\\teams\.exe$)/i) AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\whoami\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\ProgramData\\", ":\Temp\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Discord\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\NVSMI\nvidia-smi.exe"))
description: Suspicious Electron Application Child Processes: Detects suspicious child processes of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a potential sign of ".asar" file tampering (See reference section for more information) or binary execution proxy through specific CLI arguments (see related rule)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\code\.exe$|.*\\discord\.exe$|.*\\GitHubDesktop\.exe$|.*\\keybase\.exe$|.*\\msedge_proxy\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$|.*\\msedgewebview2\.exe$|.*\\msteams\.exe$|.*\\slack\.exe$|.*\\Teams\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["chrome.exe", "code.exe", "discord.exe", "GitHubDesktop.exe", "keybase.exe", "msedge_proxy.exe", "msedge.exe", "msedgewebview2.exe", "msteams.exe", "slack.exe", "Teams.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["--browser-subprocess-path", "--gpu-launcher", "--renderer-cmd-prefix", "--utility-cmd-prefix"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Electron Application CommandLine: Detects potentially suspicious CommandLine of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a sign of abuse to proxy execution through a signed binary.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\explorer.exe") AND process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe") AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["powershell", ".lnk"])
description: Hidden Powershell in Link File Pattern: Detects events that appear when a user click on a link file with a powershell command in it

description: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 4: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["COMPlus_ETWEnabled", "COMPlus_ETWFlags"])
description:
ETW Logging Tamper In .NET Processes Via CommandLine: Detects changes to environment variables related to ETW logging via the CommandLine.
This could indicate potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["cl", "/Trace"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["clear-log", "/Trace"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["sl", "/e:false"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["set-log", "/e:false"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["logman", "update", "trace", "--p", "-ets"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Remove-EtwTraceProvider" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Set-EtwTraceProvider", "0x11"])
description: ETW Trace Evasion Activity: Detects command line activity that tries to clear or disable any ETW trace log which could be a sign of logging evasion.

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\wevtutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wevtutil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["clear-log ", " cl ", "set-log ", " sl ", "lfn:"]) OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Clear-EventLog ", "Remove-EventLog ", "Limit-EventLog ", "Clear-WinEvent "] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Eventing.Reader.EventLogSession", "ClearLog"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Diagnostics.EventLog", "Clear"]) OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ClearEventLog" AND NOT ((parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\SysWOW64\msiexec.exe", "C:\Windows\System32\msiexec.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " sl "))
description:
Suspicious Eventlog Clearing or Configuration Change Activity: Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic".
This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Microsoft-Windows-PowerShell", "Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing", "Microsoft-Windows-TerminalServices-LocalSessionManager", "Microsoft-Windows-TerminalServices-RemoteConnectionManager", "Microsoft-Windows-Windows Defender", "PowerShellCore", "Security", "Windows PowerShell"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["-InstanceId 462?", ".eventid -eq 462?", ".ID -eq 462?", "EventCode=?462?", "EventIdentifier=?462?", "System[EventID=462?]", "-InstanceId 4778", ".eventid -eq 4778", ".ID -eq 4778", "EventCode=?4778?", "EventIdentifier=?4778?", "System[EventID=4778]", "-InstanceId 25", ".eventid -eq 25", ".ID -eq 25", "EventCode=?25?", "EventIdentifier=?25?", "System[EventID=25]", "-InstanceId 1149", ".eventid -eq 1149", ".ID -eq 1149", "EventCode=?1149?", "EventIdentifier=?1149?", "System[EventID=1149]", "-InstanceId 21", ".eventid -eq 21", ".ID -eq 21", "EventCode=?21?", "EventIdentifier=?21?", "System[EventID=21]", "-InstanceId 22", ".eventid -eq 22", ".ID -eq 22", "EventCode=?22?", "EventIdentifier=?22?", "System[EventID=22]"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["Select", "Win32_NTLogEvent"] OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\wevtutil\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wevtutil.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" qe ", " query-events "]) OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\wmic\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("wmic.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " ntevent" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Get-WinEvent ", "get-eventlog "]))
description:
Potentially Suspicious EventLog Recon Activity Using Log Query Utilities: Detects execution of different log query utilities and commands to search and dump the content of specific event logs or look for specific event IDs.
This technique is used by threat actors in order to extract sensitive information from events logs such as usernames, IP addresses, hostnames, etc.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Users\Public\\" AND (process.exe_path=/(.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["bitsadmin", "certutil", "cscript", "mshta", "powershell", "regsvr32", "rundll32", "wscript"]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Parent Process In Public Folder: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\Users\All Users\\", ":\Users\Default\\", ":\Users\NetworkService\\", ":\Windows\addins\\", ":\Windows\debug\\", ":\Windows\Fonts\\", ":\Windows\Help\\", ":\Windows\IME\\", ":\Windows\Media\\", ":\Windows\repair\\", ":\Windows\security\\", ":\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", ":\Windows\Tasks\\", "$Recycle.bin", "\config\systemprofile\\", "\Intel\Logs\\", "\RSA\MachineKeys\\"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH "C:\Users\Public\IBM\ClientSolutions\Start_Programs\\" OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["C:\Windows\SysWOW64\config\systemprofile\Citrix\UpdaterBinaries\\", "\CitrixReceiverUpdater.exe"]))
description: Process Execution From A Potentially Suspicious Folder: Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.

query: where((process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("?") AND process.exe_file.version = NOCASE("?") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("?") AND process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("?") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("?") AND process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("?")) AND process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\Downloads\\")
description: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe

query: where((parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\brave\.exe$|.*\\chrome\.exe$|.*\\firefox\.exe$|.*\\msedge\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "#" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["%comspec%", "bitsadmin", "certutil", "cmd", "cscript", "curl", "finger", "mshta", "powershell", "pwsh", "regsvr32", "rundll32", "schtasks", "wget", "wscript"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["account", "anti-bot", "botcheck", "captcha", "challenge", "confirmation", "fraud", "human", "identification", "identificator", "identity", "robot", "validation", "verification", "verify"]))
description:
Suspicious FileFix Execution Pattern: Detects suspicious FileFix execution patterns where users are tricked into running malicious commands through browser file upload dialog manipulation.
This attack typically begins when users visit malicious websites impersonating legitimate services or news platforms,
which may display fake CAPTCHA challenges or direct instructions to open file explorer and paste clipboard content.
The clipboard content usually contains commands that download and execute malware, such as information stealing tools.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "gatherNetworkInfo.vbs" AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i))
description: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "::$index_allocation")
description: Potential Hidden Directory Creation Via NTFS INDEX_ALLOCATION Stream - CLI: Detects command line containing reference to the "::$index_allocation" stream, which can be used as a technique to prevent access to folders or files from tooling such as "explorer.exe" or "powershell.exe"

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["echo", "copy", "type", "file createnew", "cacls"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\Windows\Fonts\\" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".sh", ".exe", ".dll", ".bin", ".bat", ".cmd", ".js", ".msh", ".reg", ".scr", ".ps", ".vb", ".jar", ".pl", ".inf", ".cpl", ".hta", ".msi", ".vbs"]))
description: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn't require admin privillege to be written and executed from.

Potential Homoglyph Attack Using Lookalike Characters: Detects the presence of unicode characters which are homoglyphs, or identical in appearance, to ASCII letter characters.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques. Only "perfect" homoglyphs are included; these are characters that
are indistinguishable from ASCII characters and thus may make excellent candidates for homoglyph attack characters.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["TVqQAAMAAAAEAAAA", "TVpQAAIAAAAEAA8A", "TVqAAAEAAAAEABAA", "TVoAAAAAAAAAAAAA", "TVpTAQEAAAAEAAAA"])
description: Base64 MZ Header In CommandLine: Detects encoded base64 MZ header in the commandline

query: where((process.exe_path=/.*\\node\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("node.exe") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Node.js")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http", "execSync", "spawn", "fs", "path", "zlib"])
description: Potentially Suspicious Inline JavaScript Execution via NodeJS Binary: Detects potentially suspicious inline JavaScript execution using Node.js with specific keywords in the command line.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["AddSecurityPackage", "AdjustTokenPrivileges", "Advapi32", "CloseHandle", "CreateProcessWithToken", "CreatePseudoConsole", "CreateRemoteThread", "CreateThread", "CreateUserThread", "DangerousGetHandle", "DuplicateTokenEx", "EnumerateSecurityPackages", "FreeHGlobal", "FreeLibrary", "GetDelegateForFunctionPointer", "GetLogonSessionData", "GetModuleHandle", "GetProcAddress", "GetProcessHandle", "GetTokenInformation", "ImpersonateLoggedOnUser", "kernel32", "LoadLibrary", "memcpy", "MiniDumpWriteDump", "ntdll", "OpenDesktop", "OpenProcess", "OpenProcessToken", "OpenThreadToken", "OpenWindowStation", "PtrToString", "QueueUserApc", "ReadProcessMemory", "RevertToSelf", "RtlCreateUserThread", "secur32", "SetThreadToken", "VirtualAlloc", "VirtualFree", "VirtualProtect", "WaitForSingleObject", "WriteInt32", "WriteProcessMemory", "ZeroFreeGlobalAllocUnicode"]) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/.*\\MpCmdRun\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "GetLoadLibraryWAddress32" OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\CompatTelRunner\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["FreeHGlobal", "PtrToString", "kernel32", "CloseHandle"])))
description: Potential WinAPI Calls Via CommandLine: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["find ", "find.exe", "findstr", "select-string ", "strings"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["eyJ0eXAiOi", "eyJhbGciOi", " eyJ0eX", ' "eyJ0eX"', """ 'eyJ0eX'""", " eyJhbG", ' "eyJhbG"', """ 'eyJhbG'"""]))
description:
Potentially Suspicious JWT Token Search Via CLI: Detects potentially suspicious search for JWT tokens via CLI by looking for the string "eyJ0eX" or "eyJhbG".
JWT tokens are often used for access-tokens across various applications and services like Microsoft 365, Azure, AWS, Google Cloud, and others.
Threat actors may search for these tokens to steal them for lateral movement or privilege escalation.

query:
where((parent_process.exe_path=/.*\explorer\.exe$/i OR parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".lnk") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["                 ", "	", "
", "", "", "", "", "", ""] OR process.cmd_line=/





/i))
description:
Suspicious LNK Command-Line Padding with Whitespace Characters: Detects exploitation of LNK file command-line length discrepancy, where attackers hide malicious commands beyond the 260-character UI limit while the actual command-line argument field supports 4096 characters using whitespace padding (e.g., 0x20, 0x09-0x0D).
Adversaries insert non-printable whitespace characters (e.g., Line Feed \x0A, Carriage Return \x0D) to pad the visible section of the LNK file, pushing malicious commands past the UI-visible boundary.
The hidden payload, executed at runtime but invisible in Windows Explorer properties, enables stealthy execution and evasionâ€”commonly used for social engineering attacks.
This rule flags suspicious use of such padding observed in real-world attacks.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [" /c", "dir ", "\Users\\"] AND NOT process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " rmdir " OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\net\.exe$|.*\\net1\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "user" AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["/domain", "/add", "/delete", "/active", "/expires", "/passwordreq", "/scriptpath", "/times", "/workstations"]) OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\whoami\.exe$|.*\\quser\.exe$|.*\\qwinsta\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["whoami.exe", "quser.exe", "qwinsta.exe"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\wmic\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["useraccount", "get"] OR process.exe_path=/.*\\cmdkey\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /l")
description: Local Accounts Discovery: Local accounts, System Owner/User discovery using operating systems utilities

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["lsass.dmp", "lsass.zip", "lsass.rar", "Andrew.dmp", "Coredump.dmp", "NotLSASS.zip", "lsass_2", "lsassdump", "lsassdmp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["lsass", ".dmp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["SQLDmpr", ".mdmp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["nanodump", ".dmp"])
description: LSASS Dump Keyword In CommandLine: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ms-appinstaller://?source=", "http"])
description:
Potential File Download Via MS-AppInstaller Protocol Handler: Detects usage of the "ms-appinstaller" protocol handler via command line to potentially download arbitrary files via AppInstaller.EXE
The downloaded files are temporarly stored in ":\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.DesktopAppInstaller_8wekyb3d8bbwe\AC\INetCache\<RANDOM-8-CHAR-DIRECTORY>"

query: where(process.cmd_line=/ipconfig\s+\/all/i OR process.cmd_line=/netsh\s+interface show interface/i OR process.cmd_line=/arp\s+-a/i OR process.cmd_line=/nbtstat\s+-n/i OR process.cmd_line=/net\s+config/i OR process.cmd_line=/route\s+print/i)
description: Suspicious Network Command: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["for ", "foreach "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["nslookup", "ping"]))
description: Suspicious Scan Loop Network: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\tshark\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-i" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\windump\.exe$/i)
description:
Potential Network Sniffing Activity Using Network Tools: Detects potential network sniffing via use of network tools such as "tshark", "windump".
Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection.
An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\\.exe$/i)
description: Process Launched Without Image Name: Detect the use of processes with no name (".exe"), which can be used to evade Image-based detections.

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\NTDSDump\.exe$|.*\\NTDSDumpEx\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ntds.dit", "system.hiv"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "NTDSgrab.ps1" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["ac i ntds", "create full"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["/c copy ", "\windows\ntds\ntds.dit"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["activate instance ntds", "create full"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["powershell", "ntds.dit"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "ntds.dit" AND (parent_process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\apache", "\tomcat", "\AppData\\", "\Temp\\", "\Public\\", "\PerfLogs\\"] OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\apache", "\tomcat", "\AppData\\", "\Temp\\", "\Public\\", "\PerfLogs\\"]))
description: Suspicious Process Patterns NTDS.DIT Exfil: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Win32_NTEventlogFile" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".BackupEventlog(", ".ChangeSecurityPermissions(", ".ChangeSecurityPermissionsEx(", ".ClearEventLog(", ".Delete(", ".DeleteEx(", ".Rename(", ".TakeOwnerShip(", ".TakeOwnerShipEx("]))
description: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["~1\\", "~2\\"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\System32\Dism.exe", "C:\Windows\System32\cleanmgr.exe"] OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["\AppData\\", "\Temp\\"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\~1\\unzip\.exe$|.*\~1\\7zG\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\WebEx\\WebexHost\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\thor\\thor64\.exe$/i OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("InstallShield (R)") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("InstallShield (R) Setup Engine") OR process.exe_file.author = NOCASE("InstallShield Software Corporation")))
description: Use Short Name Path in Image: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image detection

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["~1.exe", "~1.bat", "~1.msi", "~1.vbe", "~1.vbs", "~1.dll", "~1.ps1", "~1.js", "~1.hta", "~2.exe", "~2.bat", "~2.msi", "~2.vbe", "~2.vbs", "~2.dll", "~2.ps1", "~2.js", "~2.hta"]) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\WebEx\\WebexHost\.exe$|.*\\thor\\thor64\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "C:\xampp\vcredist\VCREDI~1.EXE"))
description: Use NTFS Short Name in Command Line: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

query: where((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["~1.bat", "~1.dll", "~1.exe", "~1.hta", "~1.js", "~1.msi", "~1.ps1", "~1.tmp", "~1.vbe", "~1.vbs", "~2.bat", "~2.dll", "~2.exe", "~2.hta", "~2.js", "~2.msi", "~2.ps1", "~2.tmp", "~2.vbe", "~2.vbs"]) AND NOT parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\explorer.exe") AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\WebEx\\WebexHost\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\thor\\thor64\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\PROGRA~1\WinZip\WZPREL~1.EXE") OR process.exe_path=/.*\\VCREDI\~1\.EXE$/i))
description: Use NTFS Short Name in Image: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image based detection

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-WebRequest", "iwr ", "Invoke-RestMethod", "irm ", "wget ", "curl ", "DownloadFile", "DownloadString"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" 0x", "//0x", ".0x", ".00x"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http://%", "%2e"] OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,4}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,7}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/0[0-9]{3,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/(0[0-9]{1,11}\.){3}0[0-9]{1,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/0[0-9]{1,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/ [0-7]{7,13}/i) AND NOT process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/((25[0-5]|(2[0-4]|1\d|[1-9])?\d)(\.|\b)){4}/i)
description: Obfuscated IP Download Activity: Detects use of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal...) in an URL combined with a download command

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\ping\.exe$|.*\\arp\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" 0x", "//0x", ".0x", ".00x"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["http://%", "%2e"] OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,4}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/[0-9]{1,3}\.0[0-9]{3,7}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/0[0-9]{3,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/(0[0-9]{1,11}\.){3}0[0-9]{1,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/0[0-9]{1,11}/i OR process.cmd_line=/ [0-7]{7,13}/i) AND NOT process.cmd_line=/https?:\/\/((25[0-5]|(2[0-4]|1\d|[1-9])?\d)(\.|\b)){4}/i)
description: Obfuscated IP Via CLI: Detects usage of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal, etc.) via command line

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\minesweeper\.exe$|.*\\winver\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$)/i OR (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\csrss\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\eventvwr\.exe$|.*\\calc\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\WerFault\.exe$|.*\\wermgr\.exe$|.*\\conhost\.exe$|.*\\mmc\.exe$|.*\\win32calc\.exe$|.*\\notepad\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path = null))
description: Suspicious Process Parents: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\InstallUtil\.exe$|.*\\RegAsm\.exe$|.*\\RegSvcs\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["InstallUtil.exe", "RegAsm.exe", "RegSvcs.exe", "REGSVR32.EXE", "RUNDLL32.EXE"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Default.GetString", "DownloadString", "FromBase64String", "ICM ", "IEX ", "Invoke-Command", "Invoke-Expression"]))
description:
Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL: Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll.
This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cmd\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["Cmd.Exe", "PowerShell.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["echo", ">", "\\.\pipe\\"])
description: Privilege Escalation via Named Pipe Impersonation: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [".key", ".pgp", ".gpg", ".ppk", ".p12", ".pem", ".pfx", ".cer", ".p7b", ".asc"]) AND ((process.exe_path=/.*\\cmd\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("Cmd.Exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "dir " OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "Get-ChildItem " OR process.exe_path=/.*\\findstr\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("FINDSTR.EXE")))
description: Private Keys Reconnaissance Via CommandLine Tools: Adversaries may search for private key certificate files on compromised systems for insecurely stored credential

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -u system ", " --user system ", " -u NT", ' -u "NT', """ -u 'NT""", " --system ", " -u administrator "]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -c cmd", ' -c "cmd', " -c powershell", ' -c "powershell', " --command cmd", " --command powershell", " -c whoami", " -c wscript", " -c cscript"]))
description: Suspicious RunAs-Like Flag Combination: Detects suspicious command line flags that let the user set a target user and command as e.g. seen in PsExec-like tools

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["\CVE-202", "\CVE202"] OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\poc\.exe$|.*\\artifact\.exe$|.*\\artifact64\.exe$|.*\\artifact_protected\.exe$|.*\\artifact32\.exe$|.*\\artifact32big\.exe$|.*obfuscated\.exe$|.*obfusc\.exe$|.*\\meterpreter$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["inject.ps1", "Invoke-CVE", "pupy.ps1", "payload.ps1", "beacon.ps1", "PowerView.ps1", "bypass.ps1", "obfuscated.ps1", "obfusc.ps1", "obfus.ps1", "obfs.ps1", "evil.ps1", "MiniDogz.ps1", "_enc.ps1", "\shell.ps1", "\rshell.ps1", "revshell.ps1", "\av.ps1", "\av_test.ps1", "adrecon.ps1", "mimikatz.ps1", "\PowerUp_", "powerup.ps1", "\Temp\a.ps1", "\Temp\p.ps1", "\Temp\1.ps1", "Hound.ps1", "encode.ps1", "powercat.ps1"])

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\tree\.com$|.*\\WMIC\.exe$|.*\\doskey\.exe$|.*\\sc\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["wmic.exe", "DOSKEY.EXE", "sc.exe"]) AND (parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" > %TEMP%\\", " > %TMP%\\"]))
description: Recon Information for Export with Command Prompt: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

query: where(process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["RECYCLERS.BIN\\", "RECYCLER.BIN\\"])
description: Suspicious Process Execution From Fake Recycle.Bin Folder: Detects process execution from a fake recycle bin folder, often used to avoid security solution.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ">" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\\127.0.0.1\admin$\\", "\\localhost\admin$\\"]))
description: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers

query: where(((process.exe_path=/.*\\reg\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("reg.exe")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "add" OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["powershell.exe", "pwsh.dll"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["New-ItemProperty", "Set-ItemProperty", "ni ", "sp "])) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\ms-settings\shell\open\command")
description:
Registry Modification of MS-settings Protocol Handler: Detects registry modifications to the 'ms-settings' protocol handler, which is frequently targeted for UAC bypass or persistence.
Attackers can modify this registry to execute malicious code with elevated privileges by hijacking the command execution path.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":3389" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -L ", " -P ", " -R ", " -pw ", " -ssh "]))
description: Potential Remote Desktop Tunneling: Detects potential use of an SSH utility to establish RDP over a reverse SSH Tunnel. This can be used by attackers to enable routing of network packets that would otherwise not reach their intended destination.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\u202e", "[U+202E]"])
description:
Potential Defense Evasion Via Right-to-Left Override: Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -ep bypass ", " -ExecutionPolicy bypass ", " -w hidden ", "/e:javascript ", "/e:Jscript ", "/e:vbscript "] OR process.name IIN ["cscript.exe", "mshta.exe", "wscript.exe"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [":\Perflogs\\", ":\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\Local\Temp", "\AppData\Roaming\Temp", "\Temporary Internet", "\Windows\Temp"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favorites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Favourites\\"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL [":\Users\\", "\Contacts\\"]))
description: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\mshta\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Windows\Temp", "\Temporary Internet", "\AppData\Local\Temp", "\AppData\Roaming\Temp", "%TEMP%", "%TMP%", "%LocalAppData%\Temp"]) AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" >", "Out-File", "ConvertTo-Json", "-WindowStyle hidden -Verb runAs", "\Windows\system32\config\systemprofile\AppData\Local\Temp\Amazon\EC2-Windows\\"]))

description: Sensitive File Access Via Volume Shadow Copy Backup: Detects a command that accesses the VolumeShadowCopy in order to extract sensitive files such as the Security or SAM registry hives or the AD database (ntds.dit)

"SntpService", "Sophos", "SQ1SafeOLRService", "SQL Backups", "SQL Server", "SQLAgent", "SQLANYs_Sage_FAS_Fixed_Assets", "SQLBrowser", "SQLsafe", "SQLSERVERAGENT", "SQLTELEMETRY", "SQLWriter", "SSISTELEMETRY130", "SstpSvc", "storflt", "svcGenericHost", "swc_service", "swi_filter", "swi_service", "swi_update", "Symantec", "sysmon", "TeamViewer", "Telemetryserver", "ThreatLockerService", "TMBMServer", "TmCCSF", "TmFilter", "TMiCRCScanService", "tmlisten", "TMLWCSService", "TmPfw", "TmPreFilter", "TmProxy", "TMSmartRelayService", "tmusa", "Tomcat", "Trend Micro Deep Security Manager", "TrueKey", "UFNet", "UI0Detect", "UniFi", "UTODetect", "vds", "Veeam", "VeeamDeploySvc", "Veritas System Recovery", "vmic", "VMTools", "vmvss", "VSApiNt", "VSS", "W3Svc", "wbengine", "WdNisSvc", "WeanClOudSve", "Weems JY", "WinDefend", "wmms", "wozyprobackup", "WPFFontCache_v0400", "WRSVC", "wsbexchange", "WSearch", "wscsvc", "Zoolz 2 Service"]))
description: Suspicious Windows Service Tampering: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\vssadmin\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "wmic.exe", "VSSADMIN.EXE"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shadow", "create"])
description: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\wmic\.exe$|.*\\vssadmin\.exe$|.*\\diskshadow\.exe$)/i OR process.name IIN ["PowerShell.EXE", "pwsh.dll", "wmic.exe", "VSSADMIN.EXE", "diskshadow.exe"]) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["shadow", "delete"] OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\wbadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("WBADMIN.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["delete", "catalog", "quiet"] OR (process.exe_path=/.*\\vssadmin\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("VSSADMIN.EXE")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["resize", "shadowstorage"] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["unbounded", "/MaxSize="]))
description: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ":\Windows\Sysnative\\" OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS ":\Windows\Sysnative\\") AND NOT ((process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework64\v", "C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v", "C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm\v", "C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\FrameworkArm64\v"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\ngen\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "install") AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ['"C:\Windows\sysnative\cmd.exe"', "\xampp\\", "\catalina_start.bat"]))
description: Process Creation Using Sysnative Folder: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\atbroker\.exe$|.*\\audiodg\.exe$|.*\\bcdedit\.exe$|.*\\bitsadmin\.exe$|.*\\certreq\.exe$|.*\\certutil\.exe$|.*\\cmstp\.exe$|.*\\conhost\.exe$|.*\\consent\.exe$|.*\\cscript\.exe$|.*\\csrss\.exe$|.*\\dashost\.exe$|.*\\defrag\.exe$|.*\\dfrgui\.exe$|.*\\dism\.exe$|.*\\dllhost\.exe$|.*\\dllhst3g\.exe$|.*\\dwm\.exe$|.*\\eventvwr\.exe$|.*\\logonui\.exe$|.*\\LsaIso\.exe$|.*\\lsass\.exe$|.*\\lsm\.exe$|.*\\msiexec\.exe$|.*\\ntoskrnl\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$|.*\\regsvr32\.exe$|.*\\rundll32\.exe$|.*\\runonce\.exe$|.*\\RuntimeBroker\.exe$|.*\\schtasks\.exe$|.*\\services\.exe$|.*\\sihost\.exe$|.*\\smartscreen\.exe$|.*\\smss\.exe$|.*\\spoolsv\.exe$|.*\\svchost\.exe$|.*\\taskhost\.exe$|.*\\taskhostw\.exe$|.*\\Taskmgr\.exe$|.*\\userinit\.exe$|.*\\werfault\.exe$|.*\\werfaultsecure\.exe$|.*\\wininit\.exe$|.*\\winlogon\.exe$|.*\\winver\.exe$|.*\\wlanext\.exe$|.*\\wscript\.exe$|.*\\wsl\.exe$|.*\\wsmprovhost\.exe$)/i) AND NOT (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\$WINDOWS.~BT\\", "C:\$WinREAgent\\", "C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution\\", "C:\Windows\System32\\", "C:\Windows\SystemTemp\\", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\\", "C:\Windows\uus\\", "C:\Windows\WinSxS\\"] OR (process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ANY ["C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7\\", "C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview\\", "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\Microsoft.PowerShellPreview", "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WindowsApps\Microsoft.PowerShellPreview"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\pwsh\.exe$/i OR (process.exe_path ISTARTS-WITH-ANY ["C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\MicrosoftCorporationII.WindowsSubsystemForLinux", "C:\Program Files\WSL\\"]) AND process.exe_path=/.*\\wsl\.exe$/i OR process.exe_path ICONTAINS-ALL ["""C:\Users\'""", "\AppData\Local\Microsoft\WindowsApps\\", "\wsl.exe"]) AND NOT process.exe_path ICONTAINS "\SystemRoot\System32\\")
description: System File Execution Location Anomaly: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\SYSVOL\\", "\policies\\"])
description: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["echo ", "copy ", "type ", "file createnew"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" C:\Windows\System32\Tasks\\", " C:\Windows\SysWow64\Tasks\\"]))
description:
Tasks Folder Evasion: The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths.
Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application
in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\te\.exe$/i OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\te\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("\te.exe"))
description:
Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection: Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces
Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\vsjitdebugger\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\vsimmersiveactivatehelper\*\.exe$|.*\\devenv\.exe$)/i))
description:
Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger: There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger.
This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary.
The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\userinit\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "\netlogon\\" OR process.exe_path=/.*\\explorer\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("explorer.exe") OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE") OR process.exe_path = null))
description: Suspicious Userinit Child Process: Detects a suspicious child process of userinit

query: where(parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\Velociraptor\.exe$/i AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["code.exe", "tunnel", "--accept-server-license-terms"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["msiexec", "/i", "http"] OR (process.exe_path=/(.*\\powershell\.exe$|.*\\powershell_ise\.exe$|.*\\pwsh\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["Invoke-WebRequest ", "IWR ", ".DownloadFile", ".DownloadString"])))
description: Suspicious Velociraptor Child Process: Detects the suspicious use of the Velociraptor DFIR tool to execute other tools or download additional payloads, as seen in a campaign where it was abused for remote access and to stage further attacks.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["123456789", "123123qwE", "Asd123.aaaa", "Decryptme", "P@ssw0rd!", "Pass8080", "password123", "test@202"])
description:
Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI: Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI.
An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["[System.Net.WebRequest]::create", "curl ", "Invoke-RestMethod", "Invoke-WebRequest", " irm ", "iwr ", "Resume-BitsTransfer", "Start-BitsTransfer", "wget ", "WinHttp.WinHttpRequest"])
description: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS ".exe whoami")
description: WhoAmI as Parameter: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\control\.exe$/i AND parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\WorkFolders\.exe$/i AND NOT process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\System32\control.exe"))
description: Execution via WorkFolders.exe: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe

query: where(process.cmd_line=/.*svchost\.exe$/i AND process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/(.*\\rpcnet\.exe$|.*\\rpcnetp\.exe$)/i OR process.cmd_line = null))
description: Suspect Svchost Activity: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.exe_path IIN ["C:\Windows\System32\svchost.exe", "C:\Windows\SysWOW64\svchost.exe"] OR process.name = NOCASE("svchost.exe")))
description:
Suspicious Process Masquerading As SvcHost.EXE: Detects a suspicious process that is masquerading as the legitimate "svchost.exe" by naming its binary "svchost.exe" and executing from an uncommon location.
Adversaries often disguise their malicious binaries by naming them after legitimate system processes like "svchost.exe" to evade detection.

query: where(parent_process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["\svchost.exe", "termsvcs"] AND NOT (process.exe_path=/(.*\\rdpclip\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\csrss\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\wininit\.exe$|.*:\\Windows\\System32\\winlogon\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_path = null))
description: Terminal Service Process Spawn: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\svchost\.exe$/i AND NOT (process.cmd_line=/-k\s\w{1,64}(\s?(-p|-s))?/i OR process.cmd_line = NOCASE("") OR process.cmd_line = null) AND NOT (parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\MsMpEng\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "svchost.exe" OR parent_process.exe_path=/.*\\MRT\.exe$/i AND process.cmd_line = NOCASE("svchost.exe")))
description:
Uncommon Svchost Command Line Parameter: Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.

query: where((process.exe_file.product_name=/.*AccessChk$/i OR process.exe_file.description ICONTAINS "Reports effective permissions" OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\accesschk\.exe$|.*\\accesschk64\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("accesschk.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["uwcqv ", "kwsu ", "qwsu ", "uwdqs "]))
description: Permission Check Via Accesschk.EXE: Detects the usage of the "Accesschk" utility, an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being abused by attacker to verify process privileges

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\ADExp\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer64\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer64a\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AdExp") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Active Directory Editor") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Sysinternals ADExplorer")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "snapshot")
description: Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database. This can be used by attackers to extract data for Bloodhound, usernames for password spraying or use the meta data for social engineering. The snapshot doesn't contain password hashes but there have been cases, where administrators put passwords in the comment field.

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\ADExp\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer64\.exe$|.*\\ADExplorer64a\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("AdExp") OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("Active Directory Editor") OR process.exe_file.product_name = NOCASE("Sysinternals ADExplorer")) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "snapshot" AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\Downloads\\", "\Users\Public\\", "\AppData\\", "\Windows\Temp\\"]))
description: Suspicious Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory. This can be used by attackers to extract data for Bloodhound, usernames for password spraying or use the meta data for social engineering. The snapshot doesn't contain password hashes but there have been cases, where administrators put passwords in the comment field.

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”accepteula" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•accepteula")
description: Potential Execution of Sysinternals Tools: Detects command lines that contain the 'accepteula' flag which could be a sign of execution of one of the Sysinternals tools

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\livekd\.exe$|.*\\livekd64\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("livekd.exe"))
description: Potential Memory Dumping Activity Via LiveKD: Detects execution of LiveKD based on PE metadata or image name

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\livekd\.exe$|.*\\livekd64\.exe$)/i OR process.name = NOCASE("livekd.exe")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -m" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /m" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“m" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”m" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•m"))
description: Kernel Memory Dump Via LiveKD: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory

query: where(process.exe_path=/(.*\\procdump\.exe$|.*\\procdump64\.exe$)/i)
description: Procdump Execution: Detects usage of the SysInternals Procdump utility

query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy procdump", "move procdump"] OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["copy ", ".dmp "] AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["2.dmp", "lsass", "out.dmp"]) OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["copy lsass.exe_", "move lsass.exe_"])
description: Potential SysInternals ProcDump Evasion: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name

query: where((process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•ma " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -mm " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /mm " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“mm " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”mm " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•mm " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”mp " OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•mp ") AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" ls", " keyiso", " samss"]))
description:
Potential LSASS Process Dump Via Procdump: Detects potential credential harvesting attempts through LSASS memory dumps using ProcDump.
This rule identifies suspicious command-line patterns that combine memory dump flags (-ma, -mm, -mp) with LSASS-related process markers.
LSASS (Local Security Authority Subsystem Service) contains sensitive authentication data including plaintext passwords, NTLM hashes, and Kerberos tickets in memory.
Attackers commonly dump LSASS memory to extract credentials for lateral movement and privilege escalation.

query: where(process.exe_path=/.*\\psexec\.exe$/i OR process.name = NOCASE("psexec.c"))
description: Psexec Execution: Detects user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline

ICONTAINS " â€•s cmd" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s -i cmd" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s /i cmd" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s â€“i cmd" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s â€”i cmd" OR query: where(process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ALL ["accepteula", " -u ", " -p ", " \\"] AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY ["\\localhost", "\\127."]))
description: Potential PsExec Remote Execution: Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility

query: where(process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\PSEXESVC.exe") OR process.name = NOCASE("psexesvc.exe"))
description: PsExec Service Execution: Detects launch of the PSEXESVC service, which means that this system was the target of a psexec remote execution

query: where(parent_process.exe_path = NOCASE("C:\Windows\PSEXESVC.exe") AND (process.username ICONTAINS-ANY ["AUTHORI", "AUTORI"]))
description: PsExec Service Child Process Execution as LOCAL SYSTEM: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("psloglist.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\psloglist\.exe$|.*\\psloglist64\.exe$)/i) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" security", " application", " system"]) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -d" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " /d" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“d" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”d" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•d" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -x" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/x" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“x" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”x" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•x" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•s" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " -g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " \/g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€“g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€”g" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS " â€•g"))

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("psservice.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\PsService\.exe$|.*\\PsService64\.exe$)/i)
description: Sysinternals PsService Execution: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsService which can be abused for service reconnaissance and tampering

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("pssuspend.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\pssuspend\.exe$|.*\\pssuspend64\.exe$)/i)

query: where((process.name = NOCASE("pssuspend.exe") OR process.exe_path=/(.*\\pssuspend\.exe$|.*\\pssuspend64\.exe$)/i) AND process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "msmpeng.exe")

query: where(process.name = NOCASE("sdelete.exe") AND NOT (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS-ANY [" -h", " -c", " -z", " /\?"]))

query: where((process.exe_path=/(.*\\Sysmon64\.exe$|.*\\Sysmon\.exe$)/i OR process.exe_file.description = NOCASE("System activity monitor")) AND (process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "-c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "/c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€“c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€”c" OR process.cmd_line ICONTAINS "â€•c"))
description: Sysmon Configuration Update: Detects updates to Sysmon's configuration. Attackers might update or replace the Sysmon configuration with a bare bone one to avoid monitoring without shutting down the service completely
